story:
BlackSquare Enigma is a patented, USB hardware data encryption device. If you have data you need to protect, you should own an Enigma!

Using BlackSquare Enigma, no one can decrypt your confidential data - EVER!

Every so often, a truly compelling and innovative product comes along that disrupts traditional technology in a positive way. BlackSquare Technologies Enigma is one of these products.

BlackSquare Enigma has the look and feel of a thumb drive, but it's NOT a thumb drive! 

Enigma is a USB hardware encryption & decryption device. Enigma doesn’t store data. It encrypts files and folders on your computer, external drives, or in the cloud. 

Enigma is the first and only patented, real-time USB hardware encryption and decryption device available to the consumer.

Cyber attacks have become more prevalent, sophisticated and costly. You never know who's looking at your data. Whether your data is stored on your hard drive, an external storage device or in the cloud, it’s more vulnerable than ever. Laptops and thumb drives can be lost or stolen. Networks and cloud storage apps can be penetrated and compromised. 

BlackSquare Enigma is a simple, safe and secure way to protect your data from these potentially damaging threats.

If you know how to find and select files on your computer, you already know how to use BlackSquare Enigma. It’s that intuitive.

(Check out the Windows and MAC demo videos to see for yourself how Enigma works.)

Just plug your Enigma along with any USB storage device into a USB port on your computer, log in and you’re good to go. Enigma’s home page shows your desktop, folders, documents and all your drives. Navigating to find and manage files and folders is a snap. 

Your BlackSquare Enigma will go through an initialization process the first time you use it. It takes a minute or two. This process consists of connecting an external USB storage device to your Enigma and plugging the pair into your PC or MAC.

You will be asked to initialize your Enigma. Click OK. Then create a strong password up to 32 characters in length. This will become your LOGON password. And the initialization of your Enigma is complete.

If you lose your Enigma, simply replace it (you’re not S-O-L). Once you have initialized your new Enigma and recreated your LOGON password, you are good to go.

Encrypt files that are of value to you. You can encrypt one file, multiple files, a single folder or multiple folders, all with a single click. You can encrypt and protect every file on your computer or within your network. 

The heart of the BlackSquare Enigma is our patented, Hardware Cryptographic Module, or HCM. Years of engineering, programming, coding, testing and debugging have gone into the development of BlackSquare Enigma. The patented HCM chipset is now in its 9th generation of development.

Versions of BlackSquare Enigma have been sold into government agencies and large enterprise customers, where encryption of data-at-rest is both critical and required by law.

Compatible with both WIN and MAC operating systems and all USB protocols, BlackSquare Enigma is a complex, hardened and proven security device that’s intuitive and really simple to use.

Find encrypted files using the 'search' function on both WIN and MAC

Using BlackSquare Enigma, encrypted files and folders are easy to recognize. The small icon identifying the default program for each file changes to a black square with a “b²” in it and an additional file extension -- .BKSQ (for BlackSquare) – will be added.

To find encrypted files, simply search the filename, or  *.BKSQ!

BlackSquare Enigma is transparent to the Operating System 

When you remove Enigma from your computer, all Enigma windows automatically disappear. All the recovery keys needed to decrypt your files reside within Enigma’s hardened security, not on your computer. No data is left behind for cyber thieves to use in their attempts to decrypt your files.

BlackSquare Enigma:

  • Is compatible with both Windows (XP and newer) and MAC OS X (thru 10.8.x) operating systems, both 32-and 64-bit
  • Encrypts data using AES-256-CBC
  • Is compatible with all USB protocols 
  • Encrypts data on internal and external drives, and cloud storage applications

Drag ‘n Drop, or Right Click – your choice! 

BlackSquare has provided a complete menu of features for both File and Folder operations. Use 'right-click' for menu driven options, or, drag the files or folders and drop them on the appropriate icon at the top of the page.   

BlackSquare Folder (left pane)and File (right pane) menus, using our right-click menu



BlackSquare's Enigma encrypts and protects files on any storage device that can be seen by your computer -- internal drives, external drives, servers, NAS boxes and cloud storage applications.  

IT, Security and encryption experts alike agree hardware encryption is faster and less vulnerable than software-based encryption. Until now, the problem has been finding a hardware solution that is easy to understand and simple to use. 

BlackSquare's Enigma is FIPS-140-2 certified and comes with very strong AES-256-CBC encryption, and has been certified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and Canada’s Communications Security Establishment (CSE). 

BlackSquare has implemented a two-factor-authentication (2FA) model using passwords. If the Enigma and your data -- your laptop, for example -- are stolen together, a cyber thief would need both your LOGON password and your file recovery password(s) to gain access to your encrypted files. 

Multiple variations of 2FA are currently being used by government agencies and the medical, financial and insurance industries.

To ensure each BlackSquare Enigma customer has the latest in features and enhancements, BlackSquare will provide an optional subscription update service. The purpose of the update is to provide enhancements and functional updates which have been extensively tested and approved. The BlackSquare development team has developed a road map of planned updates that are scheduled for testing and release in 2014. 

ALL BlackSquare Enigmas will come with the 2014 subscription update service at no charge during this campaign!  Get yours now!

Check out our great Perks. You will receive a hefty discount on the price of your Enigma with your pledge.

Check out our cool T-shirts! (color choices are Orange, Royal Blue and Slate Grey)

BlackSquare Enigma's simplicity, ease of use and exceptional security allow you to encrypt and protect your valuable data! It's truly an innovative and affordable product that can work for anybody in any application.

If you'd like to protect your data, you need an Enigma. Your support will help us to launch Enigma into the marketplace.

Be sure to spend a few minutes watching our videos and checking out the pix.  Please ask questions. We want to earn your business because we feel that BlackSquare Enigma is a remarkable product.

Each member of the BlackSquare team has over 20 years of experience in our respective fields, and most everyone's experience falls into the data storage, s/ware and h/ware encryption fields. Some members of the team are acknowledged subject matter experts in e-security, IT, encryption, software and firmware development, marketing, sales and public relations disciplines. Check out our team below:

  • Bob Fleming (founder).  Bob has been in the data encryption and data protection space since 2004.  In 2011, Bob began development of a USB-based, hardware data encryption solution which would target the consumer.  In 2012, Bob presented Enigma to more than 30 influential analysts, research firms and periodicals such as IDC, Aberdeen, Gartner, PC Magazine, 451 and eWeek with great success.  In 2002, Bob co-founded TruEffect, a successful online ad serving and analytics firm.
  • Scott Nelson Currently VP of Client Management at Placeable, Scott and Bob were co-founders at TruEffect. Scott has the uncanny ability to see, develop and implement online sales models and strategies.
  • Jerry Brown of Jerry BrownPR.com. Jerry is our wizard for all things PR, and he intends to continue doing PR until he gets it right.
  • Dale Clack  Dale brings over 30 years of CFO experience at the ‘big 4' CPA level.  Dale has an MBA, a CBI, and is a certified NxLeveL instructor.  Last but certainly not least, Dale gives back…he received the 2012 ‘Consultant of the Year’ award from the Colorado Small Business Development Center Network.
  • Tony Kiser Tony holds a CISSP certification, 25 years of IT, Security and Firewall policy management skills,  Tony is currently an e-Security manager at a Fortune 100 company. Somehow, Tony has found time to become a very talented golfer.
  • Dave Farmer   Dave has 30 years of experience developing software and firmware encryption solutions into IT and Security applications.  Dave has worked for Encryptx, bCompliant and Imation.  Dave leads and organizes our functionality and enhancement efforts for BlackSquare Enigma product lines.


  • BlackSquare's Enigma is a USB hardware encryption and decryption device specifically designed to encrypt and protect all of your files and folders.
  • Enigma is compatible with WIN and MAC OS's, and works with any USB protocol.
  • Enigma is very simple to use, and can be initialized within minutes.
  • Various agencies and large companies are testing and using Enigma.  
  • We've created a product that is simple, safe and secure;  Enigma is easy to use.
  • Without Enigma, your encrypted data cannot be decrypted.
  • If you feel that your data is vulnerable to cyber thieves, you need an Enigma!
  • MSRP for the Enigma consumer version is $129.95. 
  • Suggested retail for the annual consumer subscription update service is $42.00.

Please support us. And tell your friends to take a look at our campaign page under BlackSquare Enigma.

Become an Enigma backer and a lifelong user.

Risks and challenges

The BlackSquare Enigma product has been designed and tested for the consumer marketplace and is more than 90% complete.  What’s needed, you ask?  Our hardware solution is rock solid; fulfilling the product road map requires additional software and firmware development; design, verification and testing (DVT), and marketing to launch the product to explore and distribute through the appropriate channels.

Typical events associated with risk include:

  • Supply chain management-managing all of the various suppliers. We’ve resolved
    this issue by working very closely with TSMC, one of the world’s largest fab
    and semi manufacturers. We can't predict future issues that our suppliers might
    have delivering components on time, but we are extremely confident in the
    company we've chosen to work with to manufacture and deliver the BlackSquare
    Technologies Enigma consumer version.
  • HCM availability-our HCM is custom built for BlackSquare applications, and we’ve
    worked with the supplier for over 5 years.
  • Delivery dates from production to our facility in Colorado for volumes
    run an average of 8-10 weeks. This includes fine tuning and approvals for all artwork, product packaging, and logistics.
  • We have obtained an HTS duty free ruling for delivery into the US, so no
    worries here.
  • We anticipate minimal to no risk in ordering product from a single source
    supplier. Our manufacturers in Taiwan are both significant firms. We have
    longstanding relationships, but there is a tiny risk, and we should bring that
    to your attention as you evaluate the potential success of BlackSquare Enigma.

Versions of BlackSquare Enigma have been sold into government agencies and large enterprise customers, where encryption of data-at-rest is both critical and required by law. 
Compatible with both WIN and MAC operating systems and all USB protocols, BlackSquare Enigma is a complex, hardened and proven security device that’s intuitive and really simple to use. 

Find encrypted files using the 'search' function on both WIN and MAC
Using BlackSquare Enigma, encrypted files and folders are easy to recognize. The small icon identifying the default program for each file changes to a black square with a “b²” in it and an additional file extension -- .BKSQ (for BlackSquare) – will be added.

To find encrypted files, simply search the filename, or  *.BKSQ!
BlackSquare Enigma is transparent to the Operating System 
When you remove Enigma from your computer, all Enigma windows automatically disappear. All the recovery keys needed to decrypt your files reside within Enigma’s hardened security, not on your computer. No data is left behind for cyber thieves to use in their attempts to decrypt your files.
BlackSquare Enigma:

Is compatible with both Windows (XP and newer) and MAC OS X (thru 10.8.x) operating systems, both 32-and 64-bit
Encrypts data using AES-256-CBC
Is compatible with all USB protocols 

Encrypts data on internal and external drives, and cloud storage applications

Drag ‘n Drop, or Right Click – your choice! 
BlackSquare has provided a complete menu of features for both File and Folder operations. Use 'right-click' for menu driven options, or, drag the files or folders and drop them on the appropriate icon at the top of the page.    

BlackSquare Folder (left pane)and File (right pane) menus, using our right-click menu


BlackSquare's Enigma encrypts and protects files on any storage device that can be seen by your computer -- internal drives, external drives, servers, NAS boxes and cloud storage applications.  
IT, Security and encryption experts alike agree hardware encryption is faster and less vulnerable than software-based encryption. Until now, the problem has been finding a hardware solution that is easy to understand and simple to use.  
BlackSquare's Enigma is FIPS-140-2
certified and comes with very strong AES-256-CBC encryption, and has been
certified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and
Canada’s Communications Security Establishment (CSE). 

BlackSquare has implemented a two-factor-authentication (2FA) model using passwords. If the Enigma and your data -- your laptop, for example -- are stolen together, a cyber thief would need both your LOGON password and your file recovery password(s) to gain access to your encrypted files. 
Multiple variations of 2FA are currently being used by government agencies and the medical, financial and insurance industries. 

To ensure each BlackSquare Enigma customer has the latest in features and enhancements, BlackSquare will provide an optional subscription update service. The purpose of the update is to provide enhancements and functional updates which have been extensively tested and approved. The BlackSquare development team has developed a road map of planned updates that are scheduled for testing and release in 2014.  
ALL BlackSquare Enigmas will come with the 2014 subscription update service at no charge during this campaign!  Get yours now!

Check out our great Perks. You will receive a hefty discount on the price of your Enigma with your pledge.

Check out our cool T-shirts! (color choices are Orange, Royal Blue and Slate Grey)


BlackSquare Enigma's simplicity, ease of use and exceptional security allow you to encrypt and protect your valuable data! It's truly an innovative and affordable product that can work for anybody in any application.
If you'd like to protect your data, you need an Enigma. Your support will help us to launch Enigma into the marketplace. 
Be sure to spend a few minutes watching our videos and checking out the pix.  Please ask questions. We want to earn your business because we feel that BlackSquare Enigma is a remarkable product.

Each member of the BlackSquare team has over 20 years of experience in our respective fields, and most everyone's experience falls into the data storage, s/ware and h/ware encryption fields. Some members of the team are acknowledged subject matter experts in e-security, IT, encryption, software and firmware development, marketing, sales and public relations disciplines. Check out our team below:



Bob Fleming (founder).  Bob has been in the data encryption and
     data protection space since 2004.  In 2011, Bob
     began development of a USB-based, hardware data encryption solution which
     would target the consumer.  In 2012,
     Bob presented Enigma to more than 30 influential analysts, research firms
     and periodicals such as IDC, Aberdeen, Gartner, PC Magazine, 451 and eWeek
     with great success.  In 2002, Bob co-founded TruEffect, a successful online ad serving and analytics firm.

Scott Nelson Currently VP of Client Management at Placeable, Scott and Bob were co-founders at TruEffect. Scott has the uncanny ability to see, develop and implement online sales models and strategies.

Jerry Brown of Jerry BrownPR.com. Jerry is our
wizard for all things PR, and he intends to continue doing PR until he gets it
right.

Dale Clack  Dale brings over 30 years of CFO
experience at the ‘big 4' CPA level.  Dale
has an MBA, a CBI, and is a certified NxLeveL instructor.  Last but certainly not least, Dale gives back…he
received the 2012 ‘Consultant of the Year’ award from the Colorado Small Business
Development Center Network.
Tony Kiser 
Tony holds a CISSP certification, 25 years of IT, Security and Firewall policy
management skills,  Tony is currently an
e-Security manager at a Fortune 100 company. Somehow, Tony has found time to become a very talented golfer.

Dave Farmer   Dave has 30 years of experience developing software and firmware encryption solutions into IT and Security applications.  Dave has worked for
Encryptx, bCompliant and Imation.  Dave leads and organizes our functionality and enhancement efforts for BlackSquare Enigma product lines.




BlackSquare's Enigma is a USB hardware encryption and decryption device specifically designed to encrypt and protect all of your files and folders. 
Enigma is compatible with WIN and MAC OS's, and works with any USB protocol.
Enigma is very simple to use, and can be initialized within minutes.
Various agencies and large companies are testing and using Enigma.   
We've created a product that is simple, safe and secure;  Enigma is easy to use. 
Without Enigma, your encrypted data cannot be decrypted. 
If you feel that your data is vulnerable to cyber thieves, you need an Enigma! 
MSRP for the Enigma consumer version is $129.95. 
Suggested retail for the annual consumer subscription update service is $42.00.


Please support us. And tell your friends to take a look at our campaign page under BlackSquare Enigma. 
Become an Enigma backer and a lifelong user. 

Risks and challenges 
The BlackSquare Enigma product has been designed
and tested for the consumer marketplace and is more than 90% complete.  What’s needed, you ask?  Our hardware solution is rock solid; fulfilling
the product road map requires additional software and firmware development; design, verification and
testing (DVT), and marketing to launch the product to explore and distribute through the appropriate channels.
Typical events associated with risk include: 

Supply chain management-managing all of the various suppliers. We’ve resolvedthis issue by working very closely with TSMC, one of the world’s largest faband semi manufacturers. We can't predict future issues that our suppliers mighthave delivering components on time, but we are extremely confident in thecompany we've chosen to work with to manufacture and deliver the BlackSquareTechnologies Enigma consumer version. 
HCM availability-our HCM is custom built for BlackSquare applications, and we’veworked with the supplier for over 5 years. 
Delivery dates from production to our facility in Colorado for volumesrun an average of 8-10 weeks. This includes fine tuning and approvals for all artwork, product packaging, and logistics. 
We have obtained an HTS duty free ruling for delivery into the US, so noworries here. 
We anticipate minimal to no risk in ordering product from a single sourcesupplier. Our manufacturers in Taiwan are both significant firms. We havelongstanding relationships, but there is a tiny risk, and we should bring thatto your attention as you evaluate the potential success of BlackSquare Enigma.

story:
NOW AVAILABLE ON WWW.LIMITLESSLED.COM

 
 
 


The LimitlessLED smartbulbs can be controlled from remotely anywhere in your home.


Frequently changing your light bulbs may become a thing of the past. The LimitlessLED technology demonstrates up to 50,000 hours of useful life per smartbulb, which could mean changing your lightbulbs just two or three times in a lifetime.
 

The new lightbulbs are extremely hi-tech, containing both warm white and cool white capability in a single light bulb. The wireless remote allows the user to gradually change between the two colors and every smartbulb has a built in dimming feature that allows the user to remotely control the brightness in both warm white and cool white modes. 


One of the most practical uses for LimitlessLED is its ability to group and switch large zones of multiple smartbulbs from multiple remotes, in many simultaneous combinations. This feature is great when used as a different channel for every room in your home or when used in commercial buildings where each channel can have up to 100 or more bulbs.

The LimitlessLED bulbs are cold enough to touch, even when at full brightness, therefore safer in young children’s rooms. The smartbulbs are unbreakable, so are safe in bedside lamps that are prone to be knocked over. There will be no more sweeping up broken glass.

 

The entire electrical and home automation industry has never before had the luxury of such capabilities in a simple light bulb. There will be no need for expensive installation of wall dimmers, extra wiring, or electrician fees. You just simply swap your existing light bulb.

 

The new smartbulb not only performs in efficiency, but delivers in aesthetics and lighting performance. Within the 180degree down and outward field of light produced by the LimitlessLED, the brightness achieved is more than a standard 60W incandescent bulb.  This is more than adequate for recessed lighting, dome lighting, hanging lights and in some cases even chandelier lighting. The high quality 7.5W LimitlessLED bulb easily outshines 60W incandescent bulbs at an equivalent 800Lumens.

 

• 3 Step Quick and Easy setup for Remotes.

1) Just replace existing light bulbs
2) Turn the light bulb on, and within 2 seconds, press the button on the remote you wish to securely syncronize the light bulb with.
3) Continue doing this for all lights and all remotes in your home.



or

• 3 Step Quick and Easy setup for iOS and Androids.
1) Power on the Limitless base station
2) Setup WiFi using your web browser
3) Run the LimitlessLED App on your smartphone, turn the light bulb on, and within 2 seconds, press the button on the screen you wish to securely syncronize the light bulb with.

GET YOUR PERK NOW.  FOR 4 LimitlessLED is just $18.50 per lightbulb.>>


“I’m still a bit blown away by your light bulbs, after seeing them in action, quite a bit of potential there!” –Roger Shaw, Business Banking Manager.

“Innovative technology that will light our future” –Samsung LED

“I cannot wait so that I can start showing it to my contacts” – Ken, JPMorgan Chase, Business Banking Team.

Create Your Ambience. It's as Easy as Installing an App.

Limitless LED is the first affordable wireless LED light bulb built for the 21st century • You can wirelessly command all the 2.4Ghz wireless Limitless LED lights in your home, controlling the brightness, the ambience, and even switching them on and off. We are using dedicated Warm White LEDs and dedicated Cool White LEDs because we wanted the richest cool whites and warmest whites as possible, unlike RGB where the whites are washed out. We also use solid state memory to keep your settings even when the bulb is removed from the mains socket for example when you move house if you are renting! and even keeps settings when the handheld remote batteries are removed. Like most normal TV remotes, our remote also lasts many years on a single set of batteries.

Design Really Matters• We have designed a beautifully high tech, smart looking battery operated remote.

Great design

Only the best technology • This is not some cheap direct infrared wireless that you can find in the shops. Nor is it some cheap LED controller that requires transformers for your ceiling lights.

We are using highspeed 2.4Ghz wireless microchips INSIDE each light bulb.

The future is in your hands •We are also working with Eric Migicovsky and his Pebble smartwatch team to bring you this quick and easy control over your lighting.

Imagine coming home from work and as you enter the GPS area of your house or your local WiFi, your phone gives you a message “Welcome Home, would you like to turn your Lights on?” you press an ok button and the pebble app feeds a message back to the smart box in the home, and turns on the Kitchen and Lounge lights.

As you go to sit down in front of a movie for the evening, you open an app on the Pebble that contains a list of rooms in the house to dim or turn off the lights. You select Lounge lights, and select “Dim Lounge Lights to 50%?”

As you go to bed, and you look at your watch from in bed, and it says “Bedroom Lights Off?” and you select the button on the watch, and it instructs the pebble app to send a command to the http server in the house, and it wirelessly turns off the lights in your room.

“An amazing application of Pebble” - Eric Migicovsky


“The SmartThings iPhone App will be free up to 100 light bulbs and things per hub limit, for Kickstarter backers as a special benefit.” - The SmartThings Team.

Green LED technology meets the Cloud on iPhone.

 


SmartThings needs more "things". Before now, it was only destined to control your desk lamps via a battery operated wireless socket, But Now with the wireless Limitless LED you can control your main home lighting via the Limitless Smart base station and SmartThings hub.

Pebble smartwatch has a very bright future.. especially now that it will be able to control your Limitless LED Lights wirelessly.

 

Your Infrared TV remote when used with the Android Base station will be able to control your wireless lights, and the Android base station will be able to control your TV via infrared.

The world is opening up. 

Open Standards • We believe nothing should be tied into one supplier; everyone should integrate and play together. Our smart box uses open standards, and is a totally open platform allowing other future smart lights and other smart devices in the home to communicate with our box. It also uses an opensource operating system so that you can totally customize it to your needs.

 

Smoking fast

Only the fastest technology • This is not some cheap software thrown together in a few days. We have been refining the software for many months. We take a lot of pride in testing and monitoring the speed and performance after every new introduction of code into our code base. We measure everything down to milliseconds. We love the speed of Google, so we want to ensure the speed of lighting control is also within milliseconds. Our LED technology and software gives instantaneous Full Brightness On, way faster than any incandescent or energy saver bulbs.

 

Smarter, Greener – let’s do our part.

Highest Efficiency • We didn’t just settle for low efficiency; we aimed high and have designed it at 75Lumen per Watt, which is a great achievement for the latest LED technology. Each Wireless Limitless LED light bulb will last over 50,000 hours according to Limitless Designs LLC Testing Labs, and Samsung LED testing labs, based on 9,000hrs of testing and logarithmic extrapolation to L70 (70% LED light performance as per USA industry standard measurement guidelines)

You will save over $319 in electricity costs per lightbulb

x12 Lightbulbs = $3828 dollars in SAVINGS!

60Watt Standard LightBulb
1,095hrs (3hrs per day) x 0.060kWh x 11c/kWh = $7.28
7.5Watt LimitlessLED
1,095hrs (3hrs per day) x 0.0075kWh x 11c/kWh = $0.90


LED lights contain no toxic material, no mercury nor lead, and can be safely recycled to recover valuable materials, such as copper and aluminum, at the end of their lifespan. LED lights emit no ultraviolet or infrared radiation, which means our bulbs won't damage your artworks, merchandise or artifacts over time.

We tested our LimitlessLED bulbs to extreme conditions in the labs. They are flame and ignition resistant all the way up to 1200DegF and beyond! Cap strength tested at >4000V! Insulation resistance between current-carrying metal parts of the cap and accessible parts of the lamp are >4MegaΩ! The cap remains firmly attached when subjected to torque levels of more than 26.5inch pounds of force!

 

LimitlessLED Wireless Smartbulbs are the leading edge technology for LED.


Worldwide base fitting support, get your perks now, we will get your feedback for the style you want at the end of the campaign.

Uses the latest in 2012 Advanced Electronics

This is Limitless Designs version 2 of the LimitlessLED circuitry. Our latest version 3 contains more SamsungLED chips for better heat distribution, supreme longevity, and faster wireless.

 

 
 
 
 
 

NATIVE iPhone and Android Apps

We believe the best performance and responsiveness comes only from native Smartphone apps, meaning you get a separate custom app for iPhone; iPad; Android; and Android Tablets, giving all the latest features designed specifically for each device, not just a slow generic web interface.

 

DEVELOPERS, PROGRAMMERS, and HOBBYISTS

Other developers can connect their device or smarthub to take control of the LimitlessLED smartbulbs. Our exclusive indiegogo android smart base station is fully admin enabled by default so that developers can create their own customized software. Just send us an email, we would love to hear about your ideas and projects, we will help out where we can.

LIMITLESS ANDROID BASE STATION

• Rockchip Dual-Core >1.0Ghz CPU, Android 4.0, DDR3 1GB RAM
• 12GB Solid State File Storage (4GB Internal + 8GB MicroSD)
• Built-in WiFi and 2.4Ghz RF.
• Built-in Infrared Receiver - The infrared receiver can learn your TV remote for the buttons you would like to assign to which ever lights in the home you like.
• 2x USB ports… for Bluetooth or Keyboard or Mouse or 3G or TXT or IR sender.
• Standard HDMI output for 1080P TV and standard PC monitors.
• Power Adapter (US, UK, AU, NZ)
• Ethernet Network RJ45 port

You can plug this android base station into your tv to also get internet, games, and lighting control from your tv.


We will Film interesting videos and updates for Backers. 

This will be like MythBusters filming for LED! :)
• Our LED lights are practically unbreakable. Don’t take our word for it, we’ll try it out and film it for you. We will do drop tests from a 10 storey building! Maybe even from a swing bridge!
• Surface temperature of the LED dictates the life of the bulb. We will film surface temperatures of the LED at different altitudes. How about top of a mountain! Or in the hot sun!
• How about a 30 day Time lapse video of continuous LimitlessLED on/off bulb cycles.
• How far can the wireless stretch. From the top of a treehouse down the road?
From inside the letterbox? What effect, if any, does walls and appliances have on wireless. A fridge? A microwave? A concrete wall?
• Video film of getting comparing lumens from our Limitless LED to common household bulbs.
• How to Measure LED energy use, x20 LED bulbs.
• Measure of LUX, CRI color index film.
Anything else our backers want us to try out and film...

Project Team

Hamish Ahern
Jon Drenas
Matt Minnell
Vanessa Ahern
Rudy Lee
Jay Thakker
Vo Trung Liem
Zain Shah
Justin Allan
Alicia Ahern
Sam Daniels
Victor Vlasenko
Manoj Manani
Rodney Ahern
Manthan Dalal

Background and Experience

We are a project team led by Hamish Ahern, Project Manager and Founder of Limitless Designs LLC.
Jon Drenas from Fountain Valley – Los Angeles; assisting with shipping, storage, staffing, and logistics.
Matt Minnell from Bay Of Plenty, New Zealand. has extensive experience in broadcasting industry including radio and television and in LED screens and LED Video walls.
Hamish Ahern is from the beach town of Mt Maunganui, New Zealand, has a Degree in Computer Science and is a Lead Software programmer, Systems Analyst and qualified+experienced Project Manager, with over 15 years experience in technology. Our team has proven experience in electronic design, engineering of circuit boards, usb, bluetooth, and wifi modules for motorsport and performance vehicles. EvoScan Datalogger is a project that our team succeeded to design & build a great looking, highly functional product, which included circuit boards for high-speed communication with vehicle computers, and most specifically for Mitsubishi EvoX’s. This also included the design, build and testing of the world’s first in-car touch screen system using USB technology to communicate directly with factory vehicle ECUs. That project was called EvoScan Navigator, which graphically displays; logs; alarms; in full color live vehicle gauges on a 5inch touch screen in front of the driver. The EvoScan Navigator is working with high-tech electronic sensors and communications protocols, similar to the information an F1 race car has.
Everyone in the project team brings experienced skills such as Java, Xcode, C++, Accounting, Product design & build, Management and Logistics experience.

Stretch Goals

at each level of 5,000 backers, we will activate one or more additional features.
• Everyone will get clear decal sticker ‘Room Name’ labels for their remotes.
• We will ramp up Pebble smartwatch support faster and earlier.
• We will ramp up SmartThings support faster and earlier. Smart Things Presence sensor will activate the lights for you when you arrive, and turn off when you leave.
• New Circuit board design with 24 internal LEDs instead of 20 LEDs. Increase lighting efficiency and brightness.
• USB Infrared sender for Pebble or iPhone to mute and control your TV from the base station.
• USB Infrared sender for Thermostat and AirCon control from the base station using your Pebble or SmartPhone.
• NEST Thermostat control via the Limitless Smart Base Station including Pebble support.
• USB Infrared receiver for learning TV remotes to control your lighting. So that you can assign any buttons on your standard TV remote to control the lights.
• Everyone gets a 2-channel 2.4Ghz wireless keyring remote.• Everyone gets a findme beeper in every remote.
• 1 more wireless remote color option.
• 2 more Limitless base station color options.
• Random turn-on lights software added to the remote firmware, to give your home a lived in look when you are away on holiday.
• Motion Sensor in the remote to activate the lights when you enter the room.
• Light Sensor in the remote to activate the lights when it gets dark.
• More wireless keyring remote color options.
• A 2.4Ghz receiver module that can unlock and start your Car from your Pebble or iPhone via the Limitless base station.
• A 2.4Ghz receiver module that can activate your garage door from your Pebble or iPhone via the Limitless base station.
• Software to Make your lights dim to the music from iTunes


Perks and Rewards

Perks are available on the right hand side of the page >>

With your support and backing we will be able to “Kick Start Up”

• “Power Up” our quality manufacturing in large quantities.
• “Super Combo” Fully test our circuit boards and assemble in large quantities.
• “Feed and Water” our Industry leading Software development team.
• “Friendly Co-op Mode” to gain USA FCC/EMC/UL certification.

Thanks, we hope you will join us.

We are a team with Huge ideas, that are really excited about this project.
Back us now! we have some great Perks...>>



Risks and Challenges
We are an experienced electronics manufacturer and internet sales company for USA and Worldwide. But as with anything there is always an element of risk. We are a long way past pre-production, testing, and stress testing stages, so we have eliminated a huge portion of product design risks already. We will bring your product to you as quickly and cost effectively as possible, and will keep all backers in the loop with anything unforseen. Current Project Status: EXCELLENT/GREEN.

UPDATE: Kickstarter's new rules as at 20th Sept 2012 no longer allow 3D renders and they do not allow multiple quantities, so here we are, bringing you our LimitlessLED live to you on Indiegogo...

UPDATE: Media Images Download here.

Click the Gallery tab above for more Demo videos.

Worldwide base fitting support, get your perks now, we will get your feedback for the style you want at the end of the campaign.

Uses the latest in 2012 Advanced Electronics
This is Limitless Designs version 2 of the LimitlessLED circuitry. Our latest version 3 contains more SamsungLED chips for better heat distribution, supreme longevity, and faster wireless.

 

 

 
 
 

 
NATIVE iPhone and Android Apps
We believe the best performance and responsiveness comes only from native Smartphone apps, meaning you get a separate custom app for iPhone; iPad; Android; and Android Tablets, giving all the latest features designed specifically for each device, not just a slow generic web interface.
 

DEVELOPERS, PROGRAMMERS, and HOBBYISTS

Other developers can connect their device or smarthub to take control of the LimitlessLED smartbulbs. Our exclusive indiegogo android smart base station is fully admin enabled by default so that developers can create their own customized software. Just send us an email, we would love to hear about your ideas and projects, we will help out where we can.

LIMITLESS ANDROID BASE STATION
• Rockchip Dual-Core >1.0Ghz CPU, Android 4.0, DDR3 1GB RAM• 12GB Solid State File Storage (4GB Internal + 8GB MicroSD)• Built-in WiFi and 2.4Ghz RF.• Built-in Infrared Receiver - The infrared receiver can learn your TV remote for the buttons you would like to assign to which ever lights in the home you like.• 2x USB ports… for Bluetooth or Keyboard or Mouse or 3G or TXT or IR sender.• Standard HDMI output for 1080P TV and standard PC monitors.• Power Adapter (US, UK, AU, NZ)• Ethernet Network RJ45 port You can plug this android base station into your tv to also get internet, games, and lighting control from your tv.

We will Film interesting videos and updates for Backers. 

This will be like MythBusters filming for LED! :)• Our LED lights are practically unbreakable. Don’t take our word for it, we’ll try it out and film it for you. We will do drop tests from a 10 storey building! Maybe even from a swing bridge!• Surface temperature of the LED dictates the life of the bulb. We will film surface temperatures of the LED at different altitudes. How about top of a mountain! Or in the hot sun!• How about a 30 day Time lapse video of continuous LimitlessLED on/off bulb cycles.• How far can the wireless stretch. From the top of a treehouse down the road? From inside the letterbox? What effect, if any, does walls and appliances have on wireless. A fridge? A microwave? A concrete wall?• Video film of getting comparing lumens from our Limitless LED to common household bulbs.• How to Measure LED energy use, x20 LED bulbs.• Measure of LUX, CRI color index film.Anything else our backers want us to try out and film...
Project Team
Hamish AhernJon DrenasMatt MinnellVanessa AhernRudy LeeJay ThakkerVo Trung LiemZain ShahJustin AllanAlicia AhernSam DanielsVictor VlasenkoManoj MananiRodney AhernManthan Dalal

Background and Experience
We are a project team led by Hamish Ahern, Project Manager and Founder of Limitless Designs LLC. Jon Drenas from Fountain Valley – Los Angeles; assisting with shipping, storage, staffing, and logistics. Matt Minnell from Bay Of Plenty, New Zealand. has extensive experience in broadcasting industry including radio and television and in LED screens and LED Video walls.Hamish Ahern is from the beach town of Mt Maunganui, New Zealand, has a Degree in Computer Science and is a Lead Software programmer, Systems Analyst and qualified+experienced Project Manager, with over 15 years experience in technology. Our team has proven experience in electronic design, engineering of circuit boards, usb, bluetooth, and wifi modules for motorsport and performance vehicles. EvoScan Datalogger is a project that our team succeeded to design & build a great looking, highly functional product, which included circuit boards for high-speed communication with vehicle computers, and most specifically for Mitsubishi EvoX’s. This also included the design, build and testing of the world’s first in-car touch screen system using USB technology to communicate directly with factory vehicle ECUs. That project was called EvoScan Navigator, which graphically displays; logs; alarms; in full color live vehicle gauges on a 5inch touch screen in front of the driver. The EvoScan Navigator is working with high-tech electronic sensors and communications protocols, similar to the information an F1 race car has. Everyone in the project team brings experienced skills such as Java, Xcode, C++, Accounting, Product design & build, Management and Logistics experience.

Stretch Goals
at each level of 5,000 backers, we will activate one or more additional features.• Everyone will get clear decal sticker ‘Room Name’ labels for their remotes.• We will ramp up Pebble smartwatch support faster and earlier.• We will ramp up SmartThings support faster and earlier. Smart Things Presence sensor will activate the lights for you when you arrive, and turn off when you leave.• New Circuit board design with 24 internal LEDs instead of 20 LEDs. Increase lighting efficiency and brightness.• USB Infrared sender for Pebble or iPhone to mute and control your TV from the base station.• USB Infrared sender for Thermostat and AirCon control from the base station using your Pebble or SmartPhone.• NEST Thermostat control via the Limitless Smart Base Station including Pebble support.• USB Infrared receiver for learning TV remotes to control your lighting. So that you can assign any buttons on your standard TV remote to control the lights.• Everyone gets a 2-channel 2.4Ghz wireless keyring remote.• Everyone gets a findme beeper in every remote.• 1 more wireless remote color option.• 2 more Limitless base station color options.• Random turn-on lights software added to the remote firmware, to give your home a lived in look when you are away on holiday.• Motion Sensor in the remote to activate the lights when you enter the room.• Light Sensor in the remote to activate the lights when it gets dark.• More wireless keyring remote color options.• A 2.4Ghz receiver module that can unlock and start your Car from your Pebble or iPhone via the Limitless base station.• A 2.4Ghz receiver module that can activate your garage door from your Pebble or iPhone via the Limitless base station.• Software to Make your lights dim to the music from iTunes


Perks and Rewards
Perks are available on the right hand side of the page >>


With your support and backing we will be able to “Kick Start Up”

• “Power Up” our quality manufacturing in large quantities.• “Super Combo” Fully test our circuit boards and assemble in large quantities.• “Feed and Water” our Industry leading Software development team.• “Friendly Co-op Mode” to gain USA FCC/EMC/UL certification.

Thanks, we hope you will join us.
We are a team with Huge ideas, that are really excited about this project.Back us now! we have some great Perks...>>Risks and ChallengesWe are an experienced electronics manufacturer and internet sales company for USA and Worldwide. But as with anything there is always an element of risk. We are a long way past pre-production, testing, and stress testing stages, so we have eliminated a huge portion of product design risks already. We will bring your product to you as quickly and cost effectively as possible, and will keep all backers in the loop with anything unforseen. Current Project Status: EXCELLENT/GREEN.
UPDATE: Kickstarter's new rules as at 20th Sept 2012 no longer allow 3D renders and they do not allow multiple quantities, so here we are, bringing you our LimitlessLED live to you on Indiegogo... UPDATE: Media Images Download here.Click the Gallery tab above for more Demo videos.

story:
Arduino. LCD. Keypad. Finished. Easy.

That's the idea behind the Mmintbox.

While there are several molded Arduino enclosures on the market, nothing has yet been available to utilize LCD keypad shields.  We aim to change that.

The product details:

The plan is to make a black injection-molded ABS enclosure with a gray silicone keypad.  The internals are strictly off-the-shelf: an LCD keypad shield mated to an Arduino or compatible board.  There are 2 versions to cover the vast majority of LCD keypad shields: The Mmintbox 1 is designed for the DFRobot/Sainsmart/generic eBay shield, and the Mmintbox 2 fits the Adafruit/Sparkfun/Linksprite shield.  Either will take any "classic" Arduino board (Uno/Duemilanove/Diecimila/etc.) or an Arduino Mega.  In addition to the electronics, there is also room in the case and locating features for a 9V battery.  A small protoboard is an available option that will fit along side a regular Arduino (will not fit with a Mega).

Mmintbox 1

Mmintbox 2


Mmintbox 1 with transparent case to show internal layout

Exploded view

Current Status:

The basic design is complete in Solidworks.  Several prototypes have been 3D printed to check the function with a DFRobot LCD shield and an Arduino Uno R3. We are continuing to refine the design as we work with our prototypes. 


What we need:

ORDERS! ORDERS! ORDERS!

In order to put the Mmintbox into production, there will be substantial start-up costs:

  • Injection mold tooling
  • Per-part charges
  • Indiegogo & Paypal fees 
  • Hardware for assembly
  • SLA prototypes for final design validation
  • Packaging
  • Shipping costs

In addition to your orders, we need EXPOSURE!  Spread the word to your hackerspace members, Facebook friends, tech bloggers, internet forum members, Twitter followers, etc.  Even if you can't contribute financially, it doesn't mean you can't help this project succeed!  

What you get:

We've gone to a little extra trouble to make sure there are perks for every contributor at every level.  The Mmintbrownie Recipe and Paper Models are a fun way to say thanks to our smaller contributors, and a nice bonus to everyone ordering hardware.  We're offering enclosures and accesories at several levels; see all the perks at right.

Assuming a successful fundraising campaign, parts will go into production after final design validation and a short sample run. Contributors will be sent their perks per their pre-order once they are available.  Pre-order prices include shipping in the USA.  Orders from other countries are OK, but contact us for additional shipping costs.

Mmintbox 1 prototype & Mmintbox 1 paper model

Risks & Challenges

Since the Mmintbox is designed specifically for multiple existing PCB designs, there is some risk that changes to currently compatible PCBs (or the components thereof) may render them incompatible.  

Additionally, there are also all the risks attendant with contract production.  Production dates could slip or less than perfect parts could be sent.  We try to select vendors with good reputations to minimize this risk, but until we have a full run of perfect parts in hand on the day we expect, it still exists.

FAQs

What's with the name?

The point of the project is a MINimal INTerface box for a human to interact with an Arduino.  The extra "M" is because we learned there is another tech product called Mintbox (a fanless PC running Linux Mint) and we didn't want any confusion.

What if you exceed the funding goal?

We have some ideas for even more cool add-ons for the Mmintbox and would love to add stretch goals!

What if the goal isn't met?

Then there apparently isn't sufficient demand to justify production at this time, and you get your money back.  

Will the Mmintbox enclosures still be available after the funding campaign is over?

That is the plan.  Enough parts will be ordered to allow further orders.  But don't wait around, we need your orders to make this happen!

Who's in charge?  How do I know you are qualified?

Ryan Bollig, professional product designer and chief stamp licker.  I'm all over the internets.  See: Here , here , here , here , here , and this is one of my injection molded designs.

story:
Serperio is the world’s first voice-activated computer apprentice. It manages complex computer tasks and learns as it goes along. 

Serperio – turning your computer into a genius

Serperio is a program that will be available on Mac and Windows. However, Serperio is more of an input device for your computer. Once you install it, you'll be able to directly address Serperio with questions and commands. All without a press of a button.

Serperio will include all regular features we have become accustomed to with mobile device assistants. This includes sending emails via voice, trivia questions, sports scores, weather, notes, reminders, basic math, and other features. 

Multitasking Reinvented

Multitasking will become a breeze with Serperio. It is hands-free and completely automated. 

For example, looking up weather with your keyboard and mouse for  requires that you open your web browser, type your location in along with the word "weather," and then search for the answer. 

With Serperio you will be able to simply ask for the weather and hear the answer. You could be working on something completely different on your computer, but you'll get an answer within seconds without even having to open a new tab or press a button. 

The Serperio Lite assistant features will be available for free once Serperio goes live, but as an early bird that pledges $10 you will receive the Lite version before anyone else. Not to mention that you’ll also given a 50% discount on the advanced version of Serperio - for life. 

Why Serperio is the Superior Computer Apprentice

As of May 2014, there are no computer assistants that match the ones on our mobile devices. Releasing Serperio  will make it the world’s first computer voice-assistant, but it will accomplish much more than that. Our software is defined more as a "computer-apprentice" because it will be able to learn things it wasn't previously programmed to do. 

If a user asks Serperio to turn on an antivirus program that it doesn't already know how to operate for example, it can just be taught. The user would let Serperio know that they want to teach it how to "turn on my antivirus software," and then begin to turn on the program by themselves. Serperio will scan the screen and learn the process that goes into turning on that certain software. Mind you, Serperio isn't jsut recording a macro. It is learning how to accomplish a task regardless of the screen size or window placement of the program.

Just imagine being able to have your computer accomplish tedious tasks without even having to touch it. That's the future with Serperio. 

A computer apprentice that is ready to help at all times will save time and improve the user's efficiency, whether it’s for entertainment or work. If you need to undo something in Photoshop, just say "Serperio, undo" and watch the magic happen. Need to create a new Word document? Just ask Serperio.

Serperio will know how to work with hundreds of websites and programs out of the box. You can expect it to easily integrate with the most important parts of your computing needs. It will know how to operate antivirus programs, Netflix, Pandora, Gmail, Outlook, etc. 

That’s not all though. Serperio will also be able to manage your account passwords with a master password if you choose to let it. It's password manager will make it simple to manage passwords, as well as allowing Serperio to login accounts when completing tasks.

Pricing

The advanced self-learning features and password manager will cost $6.95 a month and $29.95 a year for non-founders. As an early however, you will be able to secure the most advanced features of Serperio permanently for just $49. You will also have access to the advanced version of Serperio before anyone else.

What Serperio Can Do For You

Serperio can be registered on up to six laptops, computers and tablets for non-founders. 

Serperio Lite 

  • Answer sports and fact-based information
  • Check stocks
  • Provide you with the weather
  • Email a friend or co-worker
  • Convert metrics
  • Basic math
  • Call phones or Skype accounts using your voice*
  • Find a movie nearby to watch
  • Find restaurants and other services
  • Post to social-networks
  • Message friends using social networks
  • Launch a program
  • Set reminders
  • Send and accept reminders from friends
  • Access and update contacts via 3rd party solutions
  • Ask for help and commands Serperio Lite provides
  • Pause movies, navigate web browsers, undo steps in programs
  • Grammar check an email
  • Check title capitalization
  • Change hundreds of operating systems settings, brightness, power, etc.
  • Show desktop, empty recycle bin, update operating system, uninstall applications, start virus scanning, and much more.

Serperio – Early founders get permanent membership and early access

  • Accomplishes everything Serperio Lite does
  • Voice-control hundreds of website and software tasks
  • Teach Serperio how to do what you need it to
  • Self-updates monthly with new tasks taught by other users**
  • Manage passwords, shipping and payment information with Serperio
  • Send reminders via text message to friends***
  • Download and install new programs
  • Control Nest and other home devices
  • Text friends
*Google Voice, Skype, or another telephony solution will be required.
**New tasks are verified by the Serperio team
***Up to 50 sent text messages a day when Serperio is first released. 
****A GroupMe account will be required.

FAQs:

1.) How will Serperio be able to learn new things? -It will scan the screen of the user to learn how visual elements look, and will split the inputs it has to learn into fields, mouse movements, clicks, keyboard strokes, etc.
2.) How will Serperio be able to order food? -Using APIs such as https://hackfood.ordr.in/ http://ordr.in/ http://www.seamless.com/business-development/developers/
3.) Will you offer an iOS or Android app? -Yes, but only as a microphone input device for your computer, laptop, or tablet at first. 
4.) Will you eventually offer to complete tasks without needing to have a computer on? -Yes! Our long-term goals are to have servers setup that accomplish tasks for users from their phones and computers without even having to use their physical resources. Adding a movie to a Netflix queue for example could be done on our servers with their login account, so they don't even need a computer for us to accomplish such a task. Our long-term dream would be to put Serperio in every smart car, smart watch, etc.
5.) Will you develop the screen scanning software? -No, that is available open-source.
6.) Will you develop the English engine for determining what task needs to be accomplished? -No, that will be licensed. 
7.) Will you develop the voice recognition software or text-to-voice software? -No, that will be licensed by the same company Amazon licenses the voice solutions of. 
8.) What will you develop anyways? -We will develop the Serperio program using the necessary technologies we have to license and build on.
9.) Will I be able to ask Serperio to do something without it taking up my screen? -Yes. 
10.) Will Serperio ever show advertisements? -No.
11.) Will Serperio ever sell my data? -No.
12.) Will Serperio ever use my data against me to show me recommendations based on my likes? -No. 
13. Will Serperio change my life? -That's up to however much you're willing to fund Serperio to make it a reality :)
14.) Will Serperio record audio using my microphone and send it to the main servers? -No. Only when Serperio is addressed do we process voice requests. Serperio will have a 10 second memory in which is listens for its name. Every time it is not addressed in those 10 seconds, it will forget what the microphone picked up.
15.) Will Serperio be able to accomplish tasks with a typed question or command? -We believe in helping people access their computer in any way they wish or require. The answer to this is yes and always will be.
16.) Will I be able to change Serperio's voice? -Never. We kid of course! You'll be able to pick from a male and female voice. 
17.) Will I be able to change what I address Serperio by? -Yes.
18.) Is Serperio a male or female computer assistant? -Yes and no. Serperio is a program that is nested no your computer. It can communicate using a female or male voice. However, we love that we'll be able to call a computer assistant "Sir Perio." 
19.) Will Serperio be available in other languages? -Not when it is first released. 
20.) Will Serperio ever be able to command my flying iron suit? -No...t yet. 
21.) Will Serperio ever mobilize into Skynet. -Report any time-traveling robots to us right away so we can shut it down before it's too late!

The answer to this is yes and always will be.16.) Will I be able to change Serperio's voice? -Never. We kid of course! You'll be able to pick from a male and female voice. 17.) Will I be able to change what I address Serperio by? -Yes.18.) Is Serperio a male or female computer assistant? -Yes and no. Serperio is a program that is nested no your computer. It can communicate using a female or male voice. However, we love that we'll be able to call a computer assistant "Sir Perio." 19.) Will Serperio be available in other languages? -Not when it is first released. 20.) Will Serperio ever be able to command my flying iron suit? -No...t yet. 21.) Will Serperio ever mobilize into Skynet. -Report any time-traveling robots to us right away so we can shut it down before it's too late!

story:
Update Jan 9th, 2015 ***
Here's a couple photos of the Mia 1/2 size Alpha prototype. more to come over this weekend as I power her up and get her to swiffer my house. ONLY 3 MIAs for $500 left.

Update Jan 7th, 2015 ***

3 lucky earlybird supporters can now get a full version full size Mia for just $500

Update Dec 18th, 2014 *** 

If we reach our goal through thousands of small contributions, we will be building as many Mia's as we can and donating 50% of Mia's built to charitable organizations, children's hospitals, old age homes, and the like.  With a list of names of the people like you who helped bring them to life.

Update Dec 17th, 2014***
Posted Our Teaser Video 

Meet Mia

We've spent months designing and perfecting a service robot that would be useful, strong, personable and last a long time without service and maintenance.  Mia is the culmination of years of Cognitive Scripting (Artificial Intelligence), open source software development, research and planning.  We took months studying the market, buying robots, building robots, testing, using and playing with them, even marveling at work that has been done by other companies and hobbyists alike.  We've solved many of the problems keeping robots from reaching the public on a large commercial scale including affordable pricing. 

No Programming Required!

We developed Mia to be extremely easy to use, right out of the box.  She comes completely setup and already understands hundreds of commands and recognizes thousands of objects.  There's no programming needed to help Mia learn new actions.  Mia tells you when she doesn't know how to do something and asks you to show her how.  You simply use your smartphone as a remote control to "show" Mia how to perform an action.  Once you create an action you save it directly on Mia's onboard Quad Core computer and tell Mia what command will run the action the next time.   That's all.  You can also upload and sell Actions in the Mia Action Store (ready in February 2015). Let's see who can make the best Mia - "History of Dance" Action.

Building A Useful Robot.

We believe that we've created something special in Mia.  Mia offers many outstanding features and functionality at an incredibly low price compared to all of the other robots that we've purchased, programmed and tested as we found that some robots were useful, others were entertaining, but none of them were easy to use.  

During our extensive research we quickly learned the drawbacks of owning or building any robot and went directly to work on solving the main problems facing the industry and keeping robots from making it to market in a big way.  Aside from Mia being extremely customizable and easy to operate, we knew she had to be at minimum, capable of easily learning and performing tasks that would deem her a useful addition to any family or business.

To be able to design and build a low cost, fully functional, easy to use robot for the masses we brought on some extremely talented hardware technical experts who have over 15 years of experience in hardware and motor system design and control to the Mia project.  We discovered that having 10 servos and an intense controller board just for her hands would increase costs substantially so we first worked on removing every unnecessary motor, servo and controller board from Mia giving her gloves and a gear driven flexible thumb instead of multiple fingers drawn by strings. This instantly offered Mia the ability to hold heavier objects. Of course Mia cannot play an acoustic piano, but she has no problem running a midi file to control an entire orchestra on a digital piano.   We also focused on how we could reuse the same strong motors and gears over and over, allowing us to order more of the same components and reduce Mia's overall production cost. Both of Mia’s shoulders and elbows and her hips use the same gears and the same size motors and same type of rotors further increasing simplicity in design and reducing costs. 

We then went to work on Mia’s brain. We contemplated using numerous operating systems but in order to keep licensing fees from seeping into the cost of building and distributing a useful robot, we opted to use MyRobotLab's fully open source robotic operating system which already contained hundreds of plugins to help Mia achieve all the tasks we wanted her to achieve in operating motors, controlling lights, recognizing and tracking objects, learning her environment and autonomous conversation.  All that was left was adding the Impervio Technologies Cognitive Scripting engine (Artificial Intelligence software) and a remote controller application to allow users to program custom actions for Mia to perform in their own environment. 

Cognitive Scripting allows an easy method for a user to teach Mia new tasks compared with most other Robots requiring to program a robot to perform each new task. In other words you don’t have to be a software programmer to own and teach Mia new tasks. We have designed a very simple and easy method for you or any average person to communicate with Mia which includes just talking to her.



What Mia Can Do For You?

Mia is very helpful and can perform fairly complex household tasks that can make your life a lot easier. Once Mia learns a task, she will repeat it exactly the way you taught her to perform it, every single time. (Subject to variances allowed in programming for object recognition and placement)

  • Sweeping the floor 
  • Putting prepared meals in the microwave at specific times. 
  • Turn on lights when it's getting dark, turn them off when it's light. 
  • Pick up toys and put them back in their place.
  • Using a vacuum cleaner the way you teach her.
  • Set the table the way you teach her.
  • Making microwave popcorn.
  • Bringing you and your guests drinks
  • Making the coffee.
  • Sorting the laundry.
  • Carry the laundry basket.
  • Help bring in the groceries.

This is a partial list as Mia's abilities to learn from your remote control programming are endless. With time you can teach Mia just about anything.  She can also help outside too!  

Mia's built with heavy duty drive motors, large wheels and enough clearance to allow her to run on grass and uneven terrain.  While Mia is outside, she can perform numerous outdoor tasks. (She's not waterproof so we don't recommend taking her out in the rain or snow or take her boating) Thanks to Mia's 4 rechargeable 12v batteries and optional solar charger Mia can run at top speeds of 5mph for over 6 hours.  

  • Play with the pets.
  • Play ball with the kids. 
  • Run to the store and let Mia carry your bags home.
  • Pick up toys in the yard.
  • Take out the garbage.
  • Refill bird feeders.
  • Feed the fish.
  • Turn on and off outdoor lights.
  • Open/Close the garage (RF and IR transmitter)
  • Walk the pet.
  • Move garden objects or follow you with plants.


Mia carries a full low voltage computer inside her torso with a Quad Core Processor, 4Gb of ram and 500Gb HDD.  She's running the latest Ubuntu build and all of her software and various entertainment packages are coupled with Google Speech To Text (STT) functionality. An onboard 100" HD Pico projector and an embedded audio system and subwoofer allows Mia to become the life of any party! 

  • Watch movies with Mia on any wall in your house.
  • Ask Mia to tell jokes. 
  • Ask Mia questions, she will read the answer and show you more information through her projector.
  • Browse a website using wireless USB keyboard and touchpad (not included)
  • Download Mia dance routines from the Mia Cloud and let Mia play your favourite MP3's, or videos and Dance to the music.
  • Have Mia play movies from Netflix.
  • Play video games.
  • Let Mia play a playlist while she serves your guests at parties.
  • Anything a multimedia computer can do, Mia can do too.

Here's The Deal!

Right now we're in the production process. We need your help to get past this point.  We think Mia could be the most incredible product on the market today, but even great ideas have failed because no one wanted them or they cost too much.  We've done everything in our power to make Mia high quality, low cost and easy to use, now it's your turn.  In order for us to prove to the world that this is something that the public wants we are offering Mia for a specially discounted Pre-Order Sale Price, giving you the opportunity to help prove us right.  

We need a minimum of $250,000 USD in funding to be able to build and bring a low cost, fully functional, easy to use robot to the world market in order to help make people’s lives easier and more enjoyable.

If we reach our goal, all of the funds raised will be spent on building and delivering Mia, the world’s first affordable, full service robot.

We are offering many unique perks including owning your own Mia!

Please help us achieve our goal and support the Mia Project as it will truly make the world a better place!

We need 90 sales of Mia in 45 days to keep this project alive.

  • Looking to raise 250,000 USD Dollars for mass production and delivery of 90 Mia's.
  • Anyone who doesn't order a Mia, will be entered into a draw to win a full version Mia with optional solar panels and wireless keyboard/touchpad. For every 1000 supporters who come on board,  we will draw from the names of all the supporters.   The earlier you support our project the more draws you are entered into.
  • Delivery of any Mia Robots ordered are expected to be delivered by July 15th, 2015
  • Anyone pre-ordering a Mia Robot before December 24th 2015 will receive their ownership certificate and proof of payment along with the special Mia Holiday Gift Card.

The Impact

We need your support as every bit helps to get this dream to come to life. We hope one day that service robots can be an integral part of everyone's life.  We hope you share that dream and hope you want to make this happen.  We would be very grateful for your support.

Mia helps make a better life for her owners as she can be used to help in so many ways in hospitals to deliver medication, entertain patients and sick children.  In the classroom Mia could help with keeping the class organized and help with lessons and presentations.  In retirement homes Mia can help the elderly with day to day tasks that have become challenging for the elderly but would be no problem for Mia to perform over and over again. 

We believe Mia could be the first real robot on the market that can offer such a wide array of uses at such an extraordinary price and we truly hope you agree and would really be proud to have you as a supporter.  

Risks & Challenges

We've assembled an incredible team, scoured the market and built and researched everything about Mia, her systems and her production costs and process.  With your support we WILL bring Mia to market and we WILL deliver every order we receive.  With that being said, as determined as we are there are some things we can't foresee, a problem with a shipment, a delay on a part or mould being created. A slight revision to design for the betterment of the final product.  Sometimes you just have no way to deliver every order on time, in this case, we promise to be clear and concise in our communication of any roadblocks that may keep anyone from getting their Mia on time.

We have put together a stellar management and development team that has a long history of solving problems as well as the connections and contacts required to fulfil on our promises to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SHARE THIS WITH EVERYONE YOU THINK CAN HELP US SUCCEED. 
LIKE AND SHARE OUR FACEBOOK PAGE http://www.facebook.com/miarobot
FOLLOW US ON TWITTER: http://www.twitter.com/themiarobot

story:
SUMMARY

We dread queues on checkout lines at super markets and grocery stores as we often have them here in Nigeria, and we know we are not alone in this. So we hope that by these humble steps we are taking, we can turn around retail payments and checkouts and make something as common as shopping at a grocery store so easy and non-painstaking, just by applying a technology as common as QR codes.

Our initial target market are the over 29 million Nigerians with access to a good smartphone and internet service. We think we can make a difference in their lives by saving them the time that would have been spent on checkout lines.


PAYMENTS AND CHECKOUTS

Nigeria is the largest country by population in Africa with over 170 million people. E-commerce, and modern commerce generally is just beginning to boom in our recent democratic efforts. Because of this, large retail shops and stores are still somewhat few, and concentrated in Lagos, our largest city in Nigeria. So a visit to the mall is always accompanied by so much frenzy, that sometimes it isn't worth the advantages. To get just a loaf of bread in a store at the mall could take one almost an hour because of long queues at checkout points.

So if there could be a way to make retail shopping painless, self-service, and cheap at the same time, retailers would love this. It would increase customer satisfaction and turnover as more people would get to buy more stuff within a short period of time. That's what our project has set out to do. With Knitle, we can make a great impact on these millions living in our cities and save them some time, using just a simple technology like QR codes.

Here's an example of a typical busy day (which is almost every day) in one of our premier retail stores in Nigeria:

Many are seasoned business men and women just trying to grab an item before getting on with their busy schedules. We can help these people save some time with this project. They would absolutely love and pay for it.

SCENARIOS

1.  Jess is a customer at Shoprite. So she visits Shoprite one busy Saturday to buy just a loaf of bread. On getting to the checkout line, she sees this long queue of customers trying to checkout. Most of these customers have more than 5 items to pay for. She thinks to herself, "will just an item keep me on this long queue for almost 30 minutes?" She's not happy, so she decides to drop the bread and come back later or just buy from the seller alongside the road. Now here's where we come in. If she could just have scanned a QR Code pasted on the Bread wrapper to pay, and show Shoprite staff an e-receipt from us confirming her payment, she'd be good and happy.

2.  Fatima is a Shoprite customer. She visits Shoprite one busy Saturday and buys lots of items. Noticing that the queue at the checkout point is long, she pulls out her phone, launches our app and scans the QR Codes of all the items she has picked from the shelves. She immediately pays and gets an e-receipt that she can show to the Shoprite staff as proof of payment.

3.  John loves movies. He sees a trailer on Youtube for a movie currently showing in the Silverbird Cinemas and loves it instantly. But he's usually weary of the fact that tickets for hit movies are hard to buy on location at the cinema because of the long queues. So luckily for him, a QR Code is shown at the end of the trailer he watched to enable him "Follow to pay". He pulls out his mobile phone, scans the QR Code, pays for the movie, and gets an e-receipt immediately to show as proof of payment. On getting to the cinema, he just walks in, shows the receipt to the staff, and takes a seat to watch his favorite movie.


THE STEPS

  1. Pick an item off the shelf that you would like to buy and scan the qr code on the item to put it in a virtual cart. (Much like this:)

  2. Pick other items like this one as you go on with your shopping.
  3. When done, visit your cart in the app and make payments.
  4. You get an e-receipt confirming that you have paid for these items.
  5. Proceed to bag the items you have bought at designated points in the store.
  6. On your way out, present the e-receipt to the store staff so they can confirm your payment and update their records.
And that's it. You're done. That simple. No queuing. All self-service. That's what we envision.

WHERE WE ARE

We are currently on a beta testing stage. We just launched the base for our payments system. It features making qr codes for various activities on the web and how that would be helpful for a "buying" or "paying" activity. We have activities like  "Like on Facebook", "Follow on Twitter", "Watch on Youtube" etc. currently on the site.

This funding would enable us to establish ourselves as a proper company, hire staff to help with other software integration issues, and ensure that we move fast enough to get ahead of competitors and other big companies trying to get it this space.

Sample QR code designs


Scan any of those codes to test it.

Visit our site to see more


YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE

Each dollar you contribute to our project would help bring the Knitle reality into a better one. As you may have figured out, this idea isn't only helpful here at home in Nigeria but it can be applied worldwide. So you helping us, would mean we can expand and you'd be able to get this awesome self-service shopping soonest in your area.

See the side bar for perks that can encourage you to contribute and get some usefulness for your money in the mean time.


HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WOULD BE USED

  1. $10k would go into getting proper office spaces.
  2. While we are superstars at software development (yes we are :)), we need extra help with a lot of other logistics. So another $15k would go into hiring top talent in the country, relocating them to our city, and ensuring their salary payments for at least a year.
  3. $10k would go into launching our payments portal, its marketing, and customer acquisition.
  4. Believe you me, that's about what we need. The remainder $15k would be kept for unforeseen challenges. We can't escape them, and they would always come because, hello, this is Nigeria.


ABOUT US

We are young people from Nigeria just trying to do something worth writing about. We happened to have attended and met at Covenant University, Nigeria, one of the best universities in Nigeria, and there we sparked our entrepreneurial drive.


CONCLUSION

We are sorry if all of your questions are not answered, and we know they aren't. We are basically engineers and totally new to this. This was tasking in itself and all we want to do is make great products. If you believe in this and are willing to overlook our seeming weakness, please back us in this campaign. Thanks a lot for understanding.

Knitle Team.
