story:
As Featured in:

Mommy to Elodie:  Xentry In My Home

info oomph I/O:  Xentry: Turn Your Old Smartphones Into Smartdoors

mobiletime Brazil:   Start-up transforma smartphone velho em interfone

Techcrunch:  Xentry Wants You To Reuse Your Old Smartphone As A Wi-Fi Door Caller Display

Mommy to Elodie:  How to Repurpose Your Old Smartphone

Gadget:  Xentry Turns Old Smartphones into High-Tech Peepholes

Coolest Gadgets:  Xentry transforms smartphone into electronic door caller display

ubergizmo:  Xentry Enlists Old Smartphones As Wi-Fi Door Sentry

psfk:  Convert Outdated Smartphones Into Door Peepholes 

Why Xentry?

Xentry's Housing

Xentry, Xavage's first product, uses your spare smartphone to capture and transmit live audio and video at your door to your iOS or Android devices.

We understand that older phones' batteries may not have the original charging capacity from years of charging. So we give users the option of having the phones constantly connected to the charging cable. 
 
 
You can easily install Xentry to any glass surface or any door with a peephole.  Please click here for a short installation video.

To get clear sound to and from the visitor outside, Xavage developed a proprietary, patent-pending audio transfer system that simplifies the electronics used. This system includes acoustic channels, customized peephole, and other sound enhancing elements.

Current housing designs accommodate the iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4/4S, and Samsung Galaxy S Fascinate.

For the Xentry System to work, install Xentry's software onto the Xentry at the door and your mobile devices (viewer).  The viewing software works on any of the current iPhone or Android models in the market.

 

Xentry's Features  

  • Front and rear camera support
  • One button touch to save still pictures
  • Zooming and exposure adjustment
   
  • Two-way audio with push-to-talk
  • Patent-pending acoustic transfer system
  
  • Play background sounds to create the illusion that you are not alone.
  • Live voice alteration feature gives a deeper pitch to your voice.
  
 
  • Receive instant door movement notification on your mobile devices.
 
  • iOS and Android working together.
  • Xentry can talk to your existing iOS and/or Android devices.  
 
  • Receive notifications when there is door movement.
  • Xentry plays your custom message each time a visitor goes through the door

 
 

Easy to Use Xentry Software

Web of Cam is easy to install and setup. Simply install the app on both the door smartphone and the smartphone you use everyday. An easy-to-use interface allows you to choose whether the smartphone is a viewer or the camera.

Additional Features: 

  • Automatic camera discovery and pairing. 
  • Password protection for cameras. 
  • Simultaneous connection from multiple viewers.
  • Zooming and exposure adjustment. 

 

Technical Specifications

  • Any Android and iOS devices (Android 2.2 API Level 8 & iOS4.3+) can communicate with Xentry.
  • The Xentry enclosure supports iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, or Samsung Galaxy S Facinate. If there is a smartphone model you would like to see in a Xentry, go here.
  • Power button extender allows easy access to your smartphone's power button even though your smartphone is inside the Xentry housing.
  • We are looking into using environmentally friendly material for Xentry housing.
  • No tools required to install a smartphone into Xentry.
  • Backers can use the spare smartphone's existing battery or have the Xentry connected to the charging cable.  Xavage provides a 15 feet (3 meter) USB adaptor cable while the backers use their existing charging accessories..
  • Dimensions: Xentry for iPhone: 147mm height (5.79"), 73mm width (2.87"), 23mm depth (0.91")Xentry for Galaxy S Fascinate: 153mm height (6.03"), 79mm width (3.12"), 23mm depth (0.91")

Where We Are Now

Xavage Technologies LLC and KalaVision has been developing Xentry for the past 12 months. We have been able to produce hardware and software prototypes. We have tested the prototypes, made some changes, and created new software builds and more rapid prototyping hardware. If we want to bring Xentry to market, we need additional funding to get to manufacturing. We need the support of Indiegogo to make this project a reality.

The funding will be used primarily for:

  • Acquiring tooling for every model. Every model requires dedicated tooling / molds for injection molding.Tooling costs (injection molds, tooling set up, etc…) are very costly, even more so when there are multiple models.
  • Acquiring software and hardware resources. Additional software and hardware engineering resources are required for bringing the prototype to production. 

Perks

Here is what will be included with Xentry

Housing for iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4/4S or Galaxy S Fascinate

  • High Quality Peephole Assembly
  • Modified Peephole Ring Amplifier
  • 15' USB Extension Cable
  • Web of Cam, Xentry Edition Mobile App
  • Phone not included.

We will offer the Xentry worldwide. Orders outside the USA will be charged an additional $20 for shipping (for single Xentry).

We Appreciate Your Support

Xavage Technologies LLC and KalaVision truly appreciate your support. Without your support, Xentry can not be made a reality!

Thank You,

 

Risks and Challenges

We have successfully demonstrated all of the features mentioned above with prototype hardware and software. Taking the project to the next level, from prototype to production, requires more resources. The following is what we currently see as risks and challenges:

Software

  • Updating Android prototype software to production ready. 
  • Completing iOS features implementation and bringing the software to product ready. 
  • Full product testing to iron out bugs.

Hardware

  • We are working with a manufacturer and have identified several alternate manufacturers. Before production starts, all of the designs need to go through Design for Manufacturing (DFM) to ensure finished product is robust. 
  • If final product quality is not to our standard, we will use our alternate manufacturer. Given our overall project schedule, this should not cause delay in our final delivery date.

 

Xavage team

At Xavage Technologies LLC  (pronounced savage) we believe in reusing our smartphones. Our mission is to find new purposes for these unused devices. We integrate your old devices with our new housings and dedicated software to create practical solutions for everyday living.

 

Our special thanks to...

Chris from Sem3DDesign for great 3D modeling and prototyping.

Logan Pierce of LoganWPierce Graphic Design and his buddies for our awesome video.
story_txt:
As Featured in:

Mommy to Elodie:  Xentry In My Home
info oomph I/O:  Xentry: Turn Your Old Smartphones Into Smartdoors
mobiletime Brazil:   Start-up transforma smartphone velho em interfone
Techcrunch:  Xentry Wants You To Reuse Your Old Smartphone As A Wi-Fi Door Caller Display
Mommy to Elodie:  How to Repurpose Your Old Smartphone
Gadget:  Xentry Turns Old Smartphones into High-Tech Peepholes
Coolest Gadgets:  Xentry transforms smartphone into electronic door caller display
ubergizmo:  Xentry Enlists Old Smartphones As Wi-Fi Door Sentry
psfk:  Convert Outdated Smartphones Into Door Peepholes 
Why Xentry?

Xentry's Housing
Xentry, Xavage's first product, uses your spare smartphone to capture and transmit live audio and video at your door to your iOS or Android devices.




We understand that older phones' batteries may not have the original charging capacity from years of charging. So we give users the option of having the phones constantly connected to the charging cable. 
 

 

You can easily install Xentry to any glass surface or any door with a peephole.  Please click here for a short installation video.
To get clear sound to and from the visitor outside, Xavage developed a proprietary, patent-pending audio transfer system that simplifies the electronics used. This system includes acoustic channels, customized peephole, and other sound enhancing elements.
Current housing designs accommodate the iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4/4S, and Samsung Galaxy S Fascinate.
For the Xentry System to work, install Xentry's software onto the Xentry at the door and your mobile devices (viewer).  The viewing software works on any of the current iPhone or Android models in the market.


 
Xentry's Features  



Front and rear camera support
One button touch to save still pictures
Zooming and exposure adjustment

   


Two-way audio with push-to-talk
Patent-pending acoustic transfer system

  


Play background sounds to create the illusion that you are not alone.
Live voice alteration feature gives a deeper pitch to your voice.

  

 


Receive instant door movement notification on your mobile devices.


 


iOS and Android working together.

Xentry can talk to your existing iOS and/or Android devices.  

 


Receive notifications when there is door movement.
Xentry plays your custom message each time a visitor goes through the door


 
 


Easy to Use Xentry Software



Web of Cam is easy to install and setup. Simply install the app on both the door smartphone and the smartphone you use everyday. An easy-to-use interface allows you to choose whether the smartphone is a viewer or the camera.


Additional Features: 

Automatic camera discovery and pairing. 
Password protection for cameras. 
Simultaneous connection from multiple viewers.
Zooming and exposure adjustment. 

 
Technical Specifications


Any Android and iOS devices (Android 2.2 API Level 8 & iOS4.3+) can communicate with Xentry.
The Xentry enclosure supports iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, or Samsung Galaxy S Facinate. If there is a smartphone model you would like to see in a Xentry, go here.
Power button extender allows easy access to your smartphone's power button even though your smartphone is inside the Xentry housing.
We are looking into using environmentally friendly material for Xentry housing.
No tools required to install a smartphone into Xentry.
Backers can use the spare smartphone's existing battery or have the Xentry connected to the charging cable.  Xavage provides a 15 feet (3 meter) USB adaptor cable while the backers use their existing charging accessories..
Dimensions: Xentry for iPhone: 147mm height (5.79"), 73mm width (2.87"), 23mm depth (0.91")Xentry for Galaxy S Fascinate: 153mm height (6.03"), 79mm width (3.12"), 23mm depth (0.91")

Where We Are Now
Xavage Technologies LLC and KalaVision has been developing Xentry for the past 12 months. We have been able to produce hardware and software prototypes. We have tested the prototypes, made some changes, and created new software builds and more rapid prototyping hardware. If we want to bring Xentry to market, we need additional funding to get to manufacturing. We need the support of Indiegogo to make this project a reality.
The funding will be used primarily for:

Acquiring tooling for every model. Every model requires dedicated tooling / molds for injection molding.Tooling costs (injection molds, tooling set up, etc…) are very costly, even more so when there are multiple models.
Acquiring software and hardware resources. Additional software and hardware engineering resources are required for bringing the prototype to production. 

Perks
Here is what will be included with Xentry
Housing for iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4/4S or Galaxy S Fascinate

High Quality Peephole Assembly
Modified Peephole Ring Amplifier
15' USB Extension Cable
Web of Cam, Xentry Edition Mobile App
Phone not included.



We will offer the Xentry worldwide. Orders outside the USA will be charged an additional $20 for shipping (for single Xentry).


We Appreciate Your Support
Xavage Technologies LLC and KalaVision truly appreciate your support. Without your support, Xentry can not be made a reality!
Thank You,



 
Risks and Challenges

We have successfully demonstrated all of the features mentioned above with prototype hardware and software. Taking the project to the next level, from prototype to production, requires more resources. The following is what we currently see as risks and challenges:
Software

Updating Android prototype software to production ready. 
Completing iOS features implementation and bringing the software to product ready. 
Full product testing to iron out bugs.

Hardware

We are working with a manufacturer and have identified several alternate manufacturers. Before production starts, all of the designs need to go through Design for Manufacturing (DFM) to ensure finished product is robust. 
If final product quality is not to our standard, we will use our alternate manufacturer. Given our overall project schedule, this should not cause delay in our final delivery date.

 
Xavage team
At Xavage Technologies LLC  (pronounced savage) we believe in reusing our smartphones. Our mission is to find new purposes for these unused devices. We integrate your old devices with our new housings and dedicated software to create practical solutions for everyday living.

 
Our special thanks to...
Chris from Sem3DDesign for great 3D modeling and prototyping.
Logan Pierce of LoganWPierce Graphic Design and his buddies for our awesome video.

story:
What could be better than a 3D printer? A 3D printer with a laser!

Ester will be an affordable desktop Selective Laser Sintering 3D printer. With a 1,000cc build volume, sub-millimeter resolution, and no need for support material, Ester will provide the ability to print your imagination.

Designed for the Maker in all of us

Ester will bring Selective Laser Sintering (SLS) to everyone. Existing SLS machines are large, extremely expensive, and difficult to use. Ester will be designed to fit on your workbench, and into your workflow.

Laser Sintering, at your desk

The right combination of parts, pricing, and availability has made it possible to create an affordable, powder-based, laser sintering printer that isn't the size of a large refrigerator, and doesn't cost as much as a small house. The age of the desktop 3D laser printer is finally here! Well, almost...

Join us

That’s where you come in. Backing this project will help turn the prototype into a Developer Kit and deliver it to your doorstep. In the process, you'll become part of a growing community exploring the limits of affordable laser sintering. Where we go next will be largely up to you.

Any extra funds, and the experience gained from making the Developer Kit, will go towards making the retail version of Ester, exploring new print materials, and then on to bigger and better printers. Oh, and bigger lasers.

Why Laser Sintering?

First, some background. Laser Sintering is a process that uses a laser to fuse layers of powder into a solid part. Like the FDM printers, the process starts with slicing a model into layers. After that, it gets different. The printer starts by spreading a layer of powder onto the build surface. Then it uses a laser to fuse the parts of the powder corresponding to the slice of the model. Next, a new layer of powder is spread and the process is repeated until the entire model is printed. Simple.

So, why is it so great? For one, you can print in any material that can be turned into a powder, and melted by a laser. That's actually a lot of stuff if you stop to think about it. The range of sinterable materials has barely been explored. And that leaves it up to you, dear Maker, to help us explore this new world of possibilities.

Second, Laser Sintering doesn't require supports. Yes, you read that right. No. More. Supports. Ever. The powder surrounding the part holds it in place so that you don't have to. You can print parts on top of each other, next to each other, or even one inside the other. Want to print an entire bearing race? No problem.

Gear Bearing by emmett (125 microns, polyester)

With SLS we can move beyond static models and figurines. Now we can print actual functioning mechanical parts. Oh, and no supports.

Doesn't this already exist?

Yes it does. But have you seen the prices?! The existing commercial machines sell for hundreds of thousands of dollars, and that's for the cheap ones. I can't afford that, so I decided to make something that us mere mortals can afford.

The Ester Developer Kit is designed to use materials that are readily available and don't require expensive fabrication steps. All of the components can be bought online or made at your local workshop.

Prototype 4, coming together at TechShop San Jose

Why should I back this?

If you're a serious Maker, if you want to help develop an Open Source SLS printer, or if you just love tinkering with 3D printers, then you already know why. Order a Developer Kit already. You'll be glad you did. I mentioned the lasers, right?

If you're more interested in a printer that just works, then Ester isn't quite ready for you...yet. This campaign is all about making Ester "just work", so that you can someday order one and have it delivered to your door. Backing this project, no matter how much, or how little, will help make that happen.

Project Status

Ester is still in active development, and is currently designed for Makers and hardcore prototypers. She's not pretty, but she's got it where it counts. Several functional prototypes have been built and are busily printing calibration cubes, companion cubes, gears, gear bearings, and anything else I can think of to throw at them.

Prototype version 4.5

Currently, layer heights of around 150 microns work well, and 125 micron works reasonably well, depending on the model. The goal is to print 100 micron layers reliably enough to start the print and walk away. Mechanically, Ester can go well below 100 microns, but that's currently uncharted territory, and below 50 microns the size of the powder grain becomes the limiting factor. 

The prototype hardware needs a few more tweaks, but is otherwise working very well. It still needs to be productized, and a lot of software needs to be written, but it's actually useable the way it is.

Print Material

Ester will ship configured for sintering polyester powder, but there are plenty of other materials to try. It's just a matter of finding the right parameters for each material. Once you have your very own Ester you'll be able to experiment with sintering anything you can imagine. Chocolate, anyone?

Currently polyester powder can be printed at high resolution, but low strength. Nylon can be printed at high strength but low resolution. This will very likely change as development continues. As more people try more materials we'll learn what parameters work for each material. As more people buy SLS printers, we'll be able to convince the nylon suppliers to offer finer grained powder at more reasonable prices. It's all up to you!

Needs more resolution (600 micron, nylon 618s)


What’s left to do?

Ester has come a long ways in the last few months, but there’s still much to do before she’s ready to ship.

  • Unified controller board: The Ester prototypes are using various controller boards that have been scavenged from existing FDM printers, and have had laser controllers grafted onto them. While they work well enough for development, they’re a rat’s nest of wires that shouldn’t be seen in public. Not that I have anything against rats; I’m sure their nests are very nice, but they make for lousy printer controllers. The plan is to create a new ARM-based controller board that unifies all of the electronics. The new controller board will be released as Open Source/Open Hardware.
  • Controller firmware: Creating custom controller boards will require custom firmware. New firmware will be written from scratch to make sure we get something that works reliably and is built specifically for this kind of printer. The mechanics of SLS printers are different enough that using the existing families of FDM printer firmware is proving to be problematic. All of the firmware will be Open Source and released under a BSD license.
  • Desktop software: Existing desktop printing software tends to be either proprietary, and therefore tied to a specific printer, or difficult to use. Ester is a new kind of printer, and will require custom interface software. The desktop software will be completely Open Source, and my hope is that it will some day be able to interface with all consumer-grade 3D printers (FDM, SLS, and whatever comes next). Writing multi-platform desktop software is a huge task and may take significantly longer than finishing the hardware. This is the highest risk item on the list. The primary development platform will be Mac OS X, and the OS X version will be available first.
  • Hardware design: The prototypes are, shall we say, not easy to look at. Although they've served admirably during development, it's time for a new look. The Development Kits will keep the same Maker-friendly design, but will be fully enclosed with internally-housed electronics. As always, the final design will be just as Open Source as the rest of the project.

Target Specifications

The Ester prototypes have a 100mm build cube and are using 1W lasers, but otherwise meet the target specifications. Upgrading the laser is a matter of finding a reliable supplier, and the larger build volume just needs to be tested. Easy as pie, right?

  • Build size: 150mm x 150mm x 150mm
  • Layer height: 100 microns or less
  • X/Y resolution: 100 microns or better
  • Laser power: 4 Watts
  • Laser Wavelength: 808nm
  • Material: Anything that’s a fine powder (<50 micron grain size)

What do you get in the box?

Each reward level that includes a kit will contain all of the parts and hardware needed to assemble an Ester Developer Edition printer. You'll need to supply a few common tools, a host computer, and your imagination.



OK, I'm in. What's the plan?

Once this project is fully funded, I'll finalize the design of the Early Access Kits and order materials. When the Early Access Kits are ready to go (sometime around March 2015) they'll go out to those intrepid few who ordered them. We'll spend some time working out the kinks and iterating on the Developer Kit design, as well as the mountain of software that needs to be written. You'll be getting regular progress updates from yours truly, and you can track the development process with a repository on GitHub. At this point, any long-lead items will have been ordered. After finalizing the Developer Kit design, the materials will be sent out for professional cutting and then packaged locally. Not too long after that you'll get an email confirming your shipping details. And that's when the fun starts!


Where does my money go?

About 85% of the funds will go towards purchasing materials, fabrication, and shipping. Most of the remainder is for buying equipment and supporting development of the retail version of Ester. Anything left over after that will go towards Ester's sister project. But that's a secret...for now.


What about the retail version?

The Retail Version will incorporate everything learned from the Developer Kits. It will be designed to serve the wider 3D printing community, and will be much more user friendly. Whereas the Developer Kit is designed to be built by anyone with a decent workshop, the Retail Version will be designed for modern manufacturing techniques. With a little luck, and your support, it will also be a little cheaper, and a lot prettier.

Thanks for your support!

Your support is what makes it possible for me to bring Ester to you.

story:
What is Solarella?

Solarella is a solar-powered garden or beach umbrella equipped with solar modules and rechargeable battery so that you can charge your phone, tablet, or camera all while relaxing, undisturbed in the sun! Solarella allows you to enjoy your smartphone or tablet in a space with no electrical plugs, without the fear of draining the battery. When it is cloudy or dark out, you can still enjoy the benefits of solar power thanks to the high capacity battery pack inside the Solarella.


Solarella is a product that started with one very simple question: “Why does my phone battery always die when I’m enjoying the beach and there is no plug nearby?” It was developed with three key tenets in mind: functional design, ease of use and freedom for the user.


Beautiful in any space: Solarella is designed with the idea to blend design and functionality.  Its bold yet simple beauty, minimal embellishments and lack of unsightly wires make Solarella enviable in any space. 

Let there be light: if you are having an evening pool party or relaxing in the garden, you can use the built in LED light to illuminate your view. As the daylight fades into nightfall, keep the mood and atmosphere alive.



Stream music: with Solarella, you can stream an infinite selection of music through its Bluetooth speaker. You can play any music your smart phone, tablet or laptop can access, from online streaming sites or your personal music collection. No wires required.  

Why we need your help?

We have built a prototype and are starting to build the first functional samples of the Solarella  that will soon be ready for testing and production. Though we have big ambitions, we are a small team with the capacity to finance only modest production runs.  Placing an order of multiple thousands of units is beyond our grasp. 

This is where you come in!  You can help us to increase the amount of product we can order from the factory as well as accelerate the speed with which we can deliver it to the homes of our customers. Your support will make this possible and will be a vital spark in growing a company passionate about creating the most innovative umbrellas in the world.

Perks for our supporters:

Support us at any of the unique levels below to receive our gratitude, your Solarella (or multiple ones) for up to 40% off the $499 retail price. 

Select your level of support from the sidebar at the top right of this page.


Earn a free Solarella by referring friends!

Help us by spreading the word via email and social media. You can earn $50 in credit toward our campaign every time one of your referral’s purchases a Solarella.  The amount of credit you can earn is limitless!  Once the campaign is over, we will apply this credit to your account, giving you a refund on your purchase or credit towards the purchase of a new Solarella.  Please note: contributors cannot receive referral credit for referring themselves.  For instance, of two contributors, only one can be the 'referrer' and receive campaign credit for the other's contribution.

How to participate in the referral program:

It’s simple. Log in to your Indiegogo account. Be sure to use the same account you used when you claimed your Solarella. Then, look below our main video at the top of this page for buttons to share and copy your unique URL. Then start sharing!

The Solarella Team:

Rostislav Rusinov| Co-Founder, Lead Creative Director & Graphic Designer

With many years of experience leading design teams, Rostislav is our design guru.  He knows what it takes to build a cool product  and owns every aspect of making Solarella look good.  Rostislav is the guy who makes the final decisions on product design.

Pavel Nenkov | Co-Founder, Product & business development

With close to two decades of experience in the renewable energy industry, Pavel is an enterpreneur and visionary and is always thinking of new products. Pavel intuitively envisions the future of solar energy and his passion is defining innovative products and then developing the relationships necessary to bring them to life. He has his finger on the pulse of customer behavior and loves to work on products that provide people with a magical combination of convenience and pleasure.

FAQ:

When will I receive my Solarella?

We are doing our utmost to have the Solarella shipping in time for summer 2015. We will provide continuous updates about the production schedule during and after the campaign. The projected timelines mentioned for each perk will be firmed up over the coming weeks.  

Where do you ship to?

We use major courier companies and we will ship to anywhere that they deliver.

Is shipping included? 

Shipping is $39 for Europe, $79 worldwide (Purchasers are responsible for any VAT or customs duties levied by their own countries).

Is there a warranty for the Solarella?  

Yes, the Solarella comes with a one-year replacement warranty.

What are Solarella's specs?

10 ft ( 3m ) diameter.

6 ribs construction.

Aluminium pole.

High quality fabric, not easy to faint. Water repellent.

3 solar panels woven into the umbrella's canopy.

Rechargeable backup battery.

2 USB outlets in the pole.

LED lights.

Bluetooth speaker.

Base not included.

Does Solarella come in any other colours?

Solarella is currently only offered in white.  We have plans to introduce additional colours in future production runs. If this campaign greatly exceeds our expectations, we will introduce ‘stretch goals’ that will include additional colours for all backers to choose from.

Timeline:


Solarella, London 2014

Solarella is a product that started with one very simple question: “Why does my phone battery always die when I’m enjoying the beach and there is no plug nearby?” It was developed with three key tenets in mind: functional design, ease of use and freedom for the user.



Beautiful in any space: Solarella is designed with the idea to blend design and functionality.  Its bold yet simple beauty, minimal embellishments and lack of unsightly wires make Solarella enviable in any space. 


Let there be light: if you are having an evening pool party or relaxing in the garden, you can use the built in LED light to illuminate your view. As the daylight fades into nightfall, keep the mood and atmosphere alive.






Stream music: with Solarella, you can stream an infinite selection of music through its Bluetooth speaker. You can play any music your smart phone, tablet or laptop can access, from online streaming sites or your personal music collection. No wires required.  
Why we need your help?
 

We have built a prototype and are starting to build the first
functional samples of the Solarella  that
will soon be ready for testing and production. Though we have big ambitions, we are a small
team with the capacity to finance only modest production runs.  Placing an order of multiple thousands of
units is beyond our grasp. 
This is where you come in! 
You can help us to increase the amount of product we can order from the
factory as well as accelerate the speed with which we can deliver it to the
homes of our customers. Your support will make this possible and will be a
vital spark in growing a company passionate about creating the most innovative
umbrellas in the world.

Perks for our supporters:
 
Support us at any of the unique levels below to receive our
gratitude, your Solarella (or multiple ones) for up to 40% off the $499 retail price.  
Select your level of support from the sidebar at the top
right of this page.




Earn a free Solarella by referring friends!
Help us by spreading the word via email and social media.
You can earn $50 in credit toward our campaign every time one of your referral’s
purchases a Solarella.  The amount of
credit you can earn is limitless!  Once
the campaign is over, we will apply this credit to your account, giving you a
refund on your purchase or credit towards the purchase of a new Solarella.  Please note: contributors cannot receive
referral credit for referring themselves. 
For instance, of two contributors, only one can be the 'referrer' and
receive campaign credit for the other's contribution.
How to participate in the referral program:
It’s simple. Log in to your Indiegogo account. Be sure to
use the same account you used when you claimed your Solarella. Then, look below
our main video at the top of this page for buttons to share and copy your
unique URL. Then start sharing!


The Solarella Team:
 

Rostislav Rusinov| Co-Founder, Lead Creative Director &
Graphic Designer
With many years of experience leading design teams,
Rostislav is our design guru.  He knows
what it takes to build a cool product 
and owns every aspect of making Solarella look good.  Rostislav is the guy who makes the final
decisions on product design.
Pavel Nenkov | Co-Founder, Product & business
development
With close to two decades of experience in the renewable
energy industry, Pavel is an enterpreneur and visionary and is always thinking
of new products. Pavel intuitively envisions the future of solar energy and his
passion is defining innovative products and then developing the relationships
necessary to bring them to life. He has his finger on the pulse of customer behavior
and loves to work on products that provide people with a magical combination of
convenience and pleasure.


FAQ:

When will I receive my Solarella?
We are doing our utmost to have the Solarella shipping in time for summer 2015. We will provide continuous updates about the production schedule during and after the campaign. The projected timelines mentioned for each perk will be firmed up over the coming weeks.  
Where do you ship to?
We use major courier companies and we will ship to anywhere that they deliver.
Is shipping included? 

Shipping is $39 for Europe, $79 worldwide (Purchasers are responsible for any VAT or customs duties levied by their own countries).
Is there a warranty for the Solarella?  
Yes, the Solarella comes with a one-year replacement warranty.


What are Solarella's specs?

10 ft ( 3m ) diameter.
6 ribs construction.
Aluminium pole.
High quality fabric, not easy to faint. Water repellent.
3 solar panels woven into the umbrella's canopy.
Rechargeable backup battery.
2 USB outlets in the pole.
LED lights.
Bluetooth speaker.
Base not included.
Does Solarella come in any other colours?
Solarella is currently only offered in white.  We have plans to introduce additional colours in future production runs. If this campaign greatly exceeds our expectations, we will introduce ‘stretch goals’ that will include additional colours for all backers to choose from.

Timeline:


Solarella, London 2014

story:
We have developed a mini USB adapter called SensorNotes, with an open software architecture. By using 4-pins only, the sensorNotes can interface just about any type of sensors you want. Ranging from simple temperature resistive sensors, to digital barometer and humidity sensors, and up to devices that require more power for operation besides interface such as is an Arduino board.

So let's turn our mobiles into a laboratory, make use of its power and processing capabilities.

Our First Application

Our first application is highly accurate thermometer operating at high precision of 0.2 F. It can display and store your daily morning measurements. As an example you can easily find out the health state of your thyroid gland, and women may predict their ovulation cycles.

Share the temperature of the sea water with your friends by posting it on the FB wall and more...

Some more examples are shown in the following video:

  • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oiH1dyZlKrg

Product Highlights:

  • High Precision 0.2 F, Temperature Probe, made of Stainless steel
  • Low Cost and High Precision Mobile Instrument,
  • Differential analog inputs and an analog output, and general purpose digital I/O,
  • Can power and communicate with different kinds of sensors, from simple resistive, to advanced digital communication.

Brief History

Our development started several years ago with the first wireless sensor network platform named VSN (Versatile Sensor Network - Platform). It was a general purpose platform featuring energy harvesting, support for multiple radios, and a general purpose analogue and digital sensor interface, made of 6-pins. At the same time we began working on a compact sensor language for simple representation of sensor data and its configuration. We wanted to make the VSN smaller, more modular and ready for professional use.

SensorNotes Platform

So cutting down the VSN into smaller and more flexible pieces resulted in the SensorNotes Platform (SNP), which allows you to combine various boards of size 1.5 x 1.0 inch into a final solution. Boards are stacked by using side edge 16-bit connectors. The first two products built on the SNP are shown below:

SNP INSAmp and USB Sensor Adapter

The first (top in blue) is an ultra low input bias current, programmable gain with AC filter amplifier, for use in applications such as ECG, EMG, and measuring other very high impedance sources. The second (in red) is an USB Sensor Adapter built around the Cypress PSoC 1 with an additional precision reference, power supply, and general purpose sensor interface.

Using the USB Sensor Adapter and a precision probe made for our first application (highly accurate thermometer) we have developed the Android application, for which the screen shots are shown below:

Android ScreenShots

Post as seen on a Facebook wall.

And the last thing was to redefine the sensor interface, from the earlier VSN board which had a 6-pin connector to interface any type of sensor to 4 pins only. By doing this we are now able to use standard jack plugs, which are small, may be water-proof, and are easy to plug-in and out. The 4-pin interface preserves all of the features found in VSN which are differential analog inputs, analog output, providing multiple digital interfaces (UART, I2C, 1-Wire, GPIO) and at the same time it can power the sensor plugged in at selectable voltage level (5.0 V or 3.3 V).

Since there might be numerous and varied sensors plugged into the device, there is a need for simple sensor language that allows direct mapping between sensor level/raw registers and user display.

In the past years we have specified and deployed the so-called SensorNotes compact message layer. By using it, one can simply make one's own sensor, plug it into the USB Adapter and get the results immediately on the Android display, or may even configure the sensor. One can further make use of this data and integrate it with other applications using the Open API.

Product Specifications

USB Sensor Adapter:

  • Core CPU, Cypress PSoC 1 with USB support
  • High Precision and Stable Voltage Reference
  • High Precision Reference Resistance
  • On-board temperature sensor
  • Micro-USB and 4-pin Jack Interface

The 4-pin jack plug / sensor interface specifications:

  • TTL UART, with baud-rates up to 115200
  • Master and Slave I2C Support with selectable speed 50, 100 and 400 kHz
  • 1-Wire interface, supporting two-wire and three wire-connections
  • Differential Analog Inputs with programmable input resistances, gain and delta-sigma A/D with resolution up to 14-bits
  • Analog output
  • General Purpose GPIO
  • Power Supply with selectable 3.3 or 5.0 V

The sensor probe:

  • PT1000 sensor with precision 1/3B
  • Made of Stainless steel, material SS316 Ti (W. Nr.  1.4571)
  • Teflon Cable of length ~30 cm (11 inch) with a jack plug
  • Probe Certificate

Other deliveries:

  • Android application free to download supporting all above mentioned features,
  • SensorNotes USB Adapter Data-sheet with Programming Manual,
  • SensorNotes Compact Language, the Message Layer Specifications,
  • SensorNotes Tutorial, Making your own sensors.

Stretch goals

Production cost of the USB Adapter and Sensor Probe is high when it is manufactured at low quantities. So we are seeking towards massive production which would provide further discounts compared to presently set rewards.

In addition we would offer additional sensors, directly connected or indirectly via INSAmp board, with proper support for the Android application and open API.

Further goals we would like to determined together with you, fulfilling your desires.

Why do we need your support?

To complete the project into a market ready solution, which includes:

  • shrinking the present (hardware) USB Sensor adapter to about 1 by 1 inch; discussible during the project funding, we would like to hear what is your desired dimension. Now it is of size 1 by 1.5 inch (the prototype in red).
  • complete the case design and minimal sets of tools
  • purchase the USB Vendor ID
  • integrate the compact sensor language into the android application, including data representation and configuration
  • provide simple open API for integration with other applications
  • starting initial production
  • create semi-automated test environment for per-product verification.

Painting dedicated to this Project

Dreja Novak, has painted an artwork dedicated to this project, acrylic on canvas of size 100x80 cm. It represents the heat in different grades, from cold water up to the sun, and love depicted in the central part of the painting, symbolised by a man and woman coupled together.

Rewards

Our rewards are starting as low as 10 US$ for a postcard of the above painting, followed by a developer version of the USB SensorNotes board (with out case), which comes with a simple USB hello world program and analog interface. There follows a complete product - the thermometer, with a highly accurate sensor probe, and its variations with exclusive prints signed by the artist Dreja Novak. The original painting is also available.

Project Plan

  • Lunching the Project
  • Successful funding would allow us to place orders for material, which standard delivery time is estimated between 8-10 weeks, if taken from 'some' stock, this time may be reduced.
  • In parallel: PCB layout of the final board is to be done [2 weeks]
  • Testing [1 week]
  • Preparation for final production CAD [1 week]
  • Preparation of the test environment [1 week]
  • Production of PCBs [1 week]
  • Assembly, joins with the material as purchased immediately after successful funding of the project, [1 week]
  • Testing and packing [1 week+], depending on final quantity
  • Shipping [1 week+] depending on location and customs
  • Delivery of documentation.

In parallel to hardware, Android software development would require the following steps:

  • Definition of an open API, to support various hardware interface standards, ranging from analog up to digital, 1-wire, i2c, uart, gpio.
  • Developing the inner layer, implementation of the API
  • Integration of the SensorNotes Compact Language for i2c sensors, and high level API for easy 'high level access' from web browser or other application (includes JSON interface for seamless integration with other apps).
  • Delivery of documentation.

After fulfilment plans include:

  • Setup of a Community Support Portal at www.sensorNotes.com
  • Development of an additional sensor boards and sensor probes, as i.e. are motion sensors, alcohol-meters, force transducers (via INSAmp board), providing examples of how to connect Arduino board (and supply it) directly from mobile, ...

Check your Mobile USB Features

The SensorNotes plugs in directly to your mobile/handhelds USB port which must have enabled hardware and software support for so-called USB Host, or USB Accessory Port.

Since this is relatively new technology, found in mobiles in the last year and a half, we found it working seamlessly in most of the Samsung phones younger than a year. Some of HTC still lack a good support. To verify your device you may plug in a USB flash memory stick or a mouse and some activity should pop-up, or at least notification about your plugged in device. Note that Android version 4 is mandatory.

We may help you determine the USB features of your device. Drop us your model and the year of your phone.

Credits: sound which is used in the video is licensed under the Create Common License, found at ccixter.org.

story:
Visit www.smarterparis.com 

Like our Facebook page : http://facebook.com/smarterparis
Follow us on Twitter http://twitter.com/SmarterParis

______________________________________________________________________

Have you ever wanted to visit Paris without feeling like a foreigner? If so, then please support us in developing a fun, interactive “Parisian’s guide to Paris”.

Just like having a friend who lives in Paris, we aim to guide you with hints and tips that suit you; complete with unique opportunities to meet with Parisians while visiting Paris.

Our smartphone application will be interactive and fun, filled with exclusive content about Paris, and will include new and exciting functionalities.

Who are we ?

We are a passionate team and our guide will be written by Parisians, including me, my friends and my family.

I am a born Parisian and I specialize in software development. I love my city and I have always enjoyed acting as a guide to help friends and colleagues discover the city of lights whilst visiting from home and abroad. I will rely on a network of French and English speaking friends and family who will bring their own experiences to the guide.

What do we need ?

We need support from all around the world to prove that people have been waiting for such a guide. The money collected during this campaign will be spent to develop the mobile application and nothing else. We will manage everything else with our own time and money.

Why will our guide be different ?

 We are independent and the application will be advertisement free.
 Maps and content will be available offline (no roaming or charges)
 We are focused on connecting tourists with Parisians.
 It will be fun to use and immersive.
 All the content will be written by us, the locals.
 You will get a lot more than in a traditional guide.

How much will it cost ?

3,59€ or $3.99 or about the price of a Café crème.

What is our timeline and budget ?

More about the guide?

Our Parisian’s Guide to Paris will be available on the AppStore for both iPhones and iPads (but also Android Market if we double our goal).

It will provide a user-friendly interface to quickly access all our exclusive information about Paris.

All content will be available off-line, and will be kept up to date by pushed content when you are connected to a network.

What will it do ?


Future developments - An updated version will bring :
Comments and social network integration, Kids games, more languages, an integrated forum, a hotline number for Premium members, a radio with Parisian music and increase the services we have on offer.

Should we keep working on this ? It's completely up to you to decide !

Have a look at the pledges we have prepared for you:

Fancy getting a beautiful print of Paris signed by our photographer ?

Click here to select the one you prefer : Photo Album

We are proud to offer a unique opportunity to learn Light Painting from Alex VI, a rising Parisian photographer : www.alexvi.fr . Light Painting is a photographic technique that uses long duration exposure in a dark environment to create an artistic universe made of lights. Giving life to static elements. Light effects obtained are made in real time, in a single shot, without being edited on a computer. In the digital age, the Light Painting return to the essence of film photography : a single shot. Here are some cool examples:

 

 

You can also have a look at the eBooks we have uploaded in the Gallery tab. They are just a preview of what you will get if you choose Parisian recipes or Food lovers pledges.

     


Feel free to forward your questions to contact@smarterparis.com

Please share on Twitter, Facebook, email, balloons, zeppelins...

story:
CRUX is a personal USB library that brings greater ease and convenience to the storage, usage and management of multiple USB thumbdrives. It integrates the functionality of a multi-USB hub with the charm of craft and fabric to bring you a techtile solution. 

 As featured on

"Awesome USB storage pouch - say goodbye to missing thumbdrives!" - Stereo Electronics Singapore 

"The CRUX solves the problem!" - Culturepush

"It integrates the functionality of a multi-USB hub with the charm of craft and fabric to bring you a techtile solution." - Materialicious

"Why abuse a device that house such important data. CRUX will reverse it!" - Design Sojourn

"Selected Top 5 gadgets of the week" - GadgetFlow

"Featured in DesignYouTrust web & Flipboard" - Design You Trust

CRUX - Techtile Pouch

 

USB thumbdrive acts as a vital mid-term data storage solution. It is an intermediate medium for the transfer of information that is pivotal in allowing numerous communications, sharing as well as electronic processes to take place smoothly. Therefore, it is not uncommon to spot users who own several USB thumbdrives that cater towards their individual works and habits.

By merging the charm of fabric with simple technology, we aim to offer executives and students a personal lifestyle pouch that integrates their multiple USB thumbdrives, offering quick access to all the content in a single bundle.

 

How Does CRUX Work

After plugging in your USB thumbdrives into CRUX, access to all your storage content is reduced to a simple step of sliding the attached USB cable into your computer. 
A simple button buckle makes it easy for you to secure and retrieve your thumbdrive when any adjustment is required.

 

What CRUX Allows

Consolidation

Organisation of multiple USB thumbdrives for quick locating  

Protection

Contains and protects the thumbdrive from shock and damage

Content Acessiblity

Simultaneous access to content in multiple USB thumbdrives in a single plug in

 

Without CRUX

  • Limited number of USB ports
  • Unsuitable storage options
  • Misplacement & Locating
  • Clutter & Lack organisation

Alternative Use

 

With so many electronic devices fighting for your computer's USB ports, CRUX can also be your solution to this headache. Compatible with any of your USB-enabled devices, you can plug in your mouse receiver, Wifi dongle or phone chargers to ease the USB crunch.

 

Design 

Minimalist Design


Easy Use

Compact Size

 

Material


With an exterior surface that is lined with suede, Crux looks elegant and feels nice to the touch. It comes in three colors of Mocha Brown, Midnight Blue and Scarlet Red to suit individual preferences.

Its interior is made of neoprene, a material that is often used for applications ranging from diving wetsuits to laptop sleeves. This material resists degradation more than natural rubber, offering durability of use. In addition, its flexibility and softness also makes it ideal to accommodate and safely cushion thumbdrives of varying shapes and sizes.

A leather strap is used to hold the USB cable, enabling easy access by allowing your thumb to slide it out quickly from the side of CRUX.

 

Product Developlements

 

Product 

We have tested and experimented extensively with varying types of materials to deliver the most beautiful and durable product for you. Prototypes are also tested repeatedly and put through daily use.

Materials & Manufacturing

We have fabric suppliers on hand that are able to offer bulk quantity of the specific fabric and materials required for manufacturing. We will also be partnering an established local craft and bag initiative that is capable of manufacturing CRUX with high level of quality according to the specifications.

 

Reward

 

CRUX $25 


CRUX WITH PERSONALITY $35


CRUX COUPLE $50


PLUG & PLAY CRUX $55

CRUX COUPLE WITH PERSONALITY $60

CRUX FAMILY WITH PERSONALITY $90

Personalisation Details


 

Projected Schedule

This is our intended scheudule to prepare shipment by June.

April: Final refinement of product details

May: Finalise manufacturing details and material procurement

End May: Begin production of CRUX

June: Ship out CRUX

 

Your Contribution

As we continue to refine the final details of CRUX to make it even better for you, we are also gearing up towards making this product a reality. Your contribution will be the final push towards paying for the cost of material, manufacturing, packaging and shipping of our first production run.  

 

The Team

We are a group of young industrial designers that comprises of Eason, Elyn and Yee Jek. We embarked on this design with a simple goal to make the everyday a little more convenient and a little better. And now we will be pleased to make it a reality for you with your help.

 

FAQ

What is the size of CRUX?

Crux measure Length 9cm, Width 6cm and Thickness 2.2cm.
That is approximately the length and width of a credit card.

What are the sizes of USB thumbdrives that can fit into CRUX?

CRUX can fit any thumbdrive that up to 6cm long.
Most popular brands currently stock thumbdrives design that are no longer than 5cm.

What are the shipping charges?

Local shipping in Singapore will be free.
For international shipping, kindly add an additional $10.

How do I indicate my choice of color and choice of words for the personalization of CRUX?

We will be emailing all our contributors nearing the end of our campaign to verify the details. So do watch out for our updates!
story_txt:
CRUX is a personal USB library that brings greater ease and convenience to the storage, usage and management of multiple USB thumbdrives. It integrates the functionality of a multi-USB hub with the charm of craft and fabric to bring you a techtile solution. 
 As featured on
"Awesome USB storage pouch - say goodbye to missing thumbdrives!" - Stereo Electronics Singapore "The CRUX solves the problem!" - Culturepush
"It integrates the functionality of a multi-USB hub with the charm of craft and fabric to bring you a techtile solution." - Materialicious
"Why abuse a device that house such important data. CRUX will reverse it!" - Design Sojourn
"Selected Top 5 gadgets of the week" - GadgetFlow
"Featured in DesignYouTrust web & Flipboard" - Design You Trust
CRUX - Techtile Pouch
 
USB thumbdrive acts as a vital mid-term data storage solution. It is an intermediate medium for the transfer of information that is pivotal in allowing numerous communications, sharing as well as electronic processes to take place smoothly. Therefore, it is not uncommon to spot users who own several USB thumbdrives that cater towards their individual works and habits.
By merging the charm of fabric with simple technology, we aim to offer executives and students a personal lifestyle pouch that integrates their multiple USB thumbdrives, offering quick access to all the content in a single bundle.
 
How Does CRUX Work

After plugging in your USB thumbdrives into CRUX, access to all your storage content is reduced to a simple step of sliding the attached USB cable into your computer. 
  A simple button buckle makes it easy for you to secure and retrieve your thumbdrive when any adjustment is required.
 
What CRUX Allows
Consolidation
Organisation of multiple USB thumbdrives for quick locating  
Protection
Contains and protects the thumbdrive from shock and damage
Content Acessiblity
Simultaneous access to content in multiple USB thumbdrives in a single plug in
 
Without CRUX


Limited number of USB ports
Unsuitable storage options
Misplacement & Locating
Clutter & Lack organisation

Alternative Use 
With so many electronic devices fighting for your computer's USB ports, CRUX can also be your solution to this headache. Compatible with any of your USB-enabled devices, you can plug in your mouse receiver, Wifi dongle or phone chargers to ease the USB crunch.
 
Design 

Minimalist Design
Easy Use

Compact Size
 
Material

With an exterior surface that is lined with suede, Crux looks elegant and feels nice to the touch. It comes in three colors of Mocha Brown, Midnight Blue and Scarlet Red to suit individual preferences. Its interior is made of neoprene, a material that is often used for applications ranging from diving wetsuits to laptop sleeves. This material resists degradation more than natural rubber, offering durability of use. In addition, its flexibility and softness also makes it ideal to accommodate and safely cushion thumbdrives of varying shapes and sizes.  A leather strap is used to hold the USB cable, enabling easy access by allowing your thumb to slide it out quickly from the side of CRUX.

We will also be partnering an established local craft and bag initiative that is capable of manufacturing CRUX with high level of quality according to the specifications.

story:
About Zotero Reader

Reading scientific literature is needlessly cumbersome: either you carry around a big stack of printed papers, or manually sync PDFs and annotations across your electronic devices. Reading papers should be as easy as reading a book on an ereader.

There’s already a great app that allows you to collect, organize, cite and share scientific literature: Zotero. It plugs into your web browser and automatically senses content, allowing you to add it to your personal library with a single click.

So we set about to build an app to give you one-tap access to these papers on your Android tablet. We call it Zotero Reader.

The prototype was developed by Patrick Mineault, seasoned web developer and grad student in neuroscience at McGill University. After getting feedback from fellow scientists, he brought in Philippe Vachon-Rivard to turn his prototype into something more. Phil has been a web developer for over 5 years now and will help take this project to the next level by transforming Zotero Reader into a native Android application.

Why make it into an app?

While the Zotero Reader prototype gives you access to your Zotero library, it’s limited by the fact that it runs in the Android browser. A native Android application doesn’t have these limitations, and will offer enhanced functionality:

  • Offline access. Your papers will be available when you're offline: in the subway, in an airplane, at a conference with unreliable Wi-Fi
  • Auto-sync. Updates you make to your library will automatically be downloaded to your tablet, and annotations to PDFs will be automatically uploaded as soon as you're back online.
  • WebDAV support. The app will support WebDAV syncing in addition to Zotero file storage for attachments
  • Add and edit notes.
  • Native interface. Faster loading and browsing, one tap access, integration with other Android apps.

The application will be made available free of charge once it is completed and we’ll even release the code on github.

Where are the funds going?

The funds we’re asking for are going straight into development time, server and third-party API costs as well as Paypal and Indiegogo fees. Our goal is 6,000$. This will give us just enough resources to maintain the server, port the app and develop the new features shown in the previous section.

Contribute!

The prototype is available online at zoteroreader.com for you to try. Give it a shot, love it, then contribute to our campaign - you’ll get a much more powerful version for your Android devices! Remember, the final app will be free - every dollar you put in the campaign will help both you and your fellow scientist keep up with the scientific literature.

And even if you’re broke, you can still help! Just share the link to the prototype and to our campaign.

story:
3Dpad is now available already assembled on Tindie, "hand-made" by the inventor himself!

     

Open Electronics talks 3D-Pad: " A very interesting project for a touchless gesture control device: definitely worth supporting! "

"I don’t know about you, but I wondered if gesture-recognition is going to be as big the touchscreen. Ever since the film Minority Report and the rise of the Kinect, I have wondering how long it would take before it was everywhere. Seriously, I don’t why we are still using a mouse or other controller when we can just wave a hand and manipulate controls using the Force. Fortunately, there is the 3Dpad from Ootsidebox....
...Not to spoil the video or anything, but I really see an interesting 3DPad world. Why not have something that you can use gesture recognition on, from the smartphone, to the tablet, to the PC, to the TV! In short, let’s just put a 3Dpad on everything. "  The Geek Church Blog.
  Atmel  talks 3D-Pad:
" Ootsidebox goes touchless with the 3Dpad   "

ootsideboxがIndiegogoで非接触ジェスチャーインターフェース「3Dpad」の資金募集を開始した。Arduinoシールドとして動作し、オープンソース、価格は59ユーロから。

MATRIXSYNTH:
Elektor 3D pad: Touchless Gesture Control Interface Now on Indiegogo



3D-PAD: CONTROL POR GESTOS CON ARDUINO


http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XNzE3OTAyMzA0.html


Our vision:
"Touchless and gesture control everywhere and for everyone!"

But not provided by a big company like Microsoft, Samsung, Apple or similar.

Easily make your own with 3D-Pad!


What is 3D-Pad, and how does it work?

3D-Pad is a touchless gesture control interface providing 3D coordinates and gesture recognition, with a 10cm depth perception.


It consists of a sandwich made up of: 

  • a PCB called an electrode plane (1)
  • an  Arduino Shield (2)
  • an Arduino Uno (3) - based on ATMEL ATmega328


Detection principle:

To detect the proximity of the human hand or finger, we are using the  projected capacitive technique. This is the principle of virtually all modern touch screens - except that now we are in the air, relatively far away from the detector surface (10 cm max).

It’s very simple: We build capacitors which are as “open” as possible, using electrodes drawn on the electrode plane PCB in order to obtain a maximum “hand effect”.

The capacitors formed by the electrodes are part of an oscillator whose  frequency is influenced by the distance of a hand. When it enters the electrostatic field, this “intruder” is going to cut the field lines and divert the electrical charges.
Result:  the closer the hand approaches the electrodes, the more the oscillator’s frequency increases.

The following signal processing is used:

  • a phase/frequency comparator
  • a control and locking program

This simple system makes the conversion of the very small frequency shift into a variation in a voltage signal which is easy to use:


The embedded software (sketch) running on the Arduino UNO will exploit the analog result in order to:

  • Calculate 3D coordinates
  • Recognize basic gestures (swipes, push and rotations)
  • Send it all to a host device on the USB COM port


The evaluation software (PC) will enable you to quickly evaluate the 3D-Pad. You'll see all the values sent by the Arduino Uno (1), the gesture events (2) and the 3D coordinates in the form of a cursor (3).

We designed the first prototypes with our partner Elektor Labs

Check out the full description in the May edition of Elektor Magazine


3Dpad prototype's schematics (version Elektor magazine) You can download the pdf here: http://goo.gl/hqILDr

 

What’s it used for?

3Dpad can be used in a very wide field of applications, for instance:
medical & healthcare (should reduce the nosocomial risk), household  appliance control (think at cooking when your hands are covered of fat content), gaming with "air control", and many other. 

But at the moment our favorite app is music, using 3Dpad as an "3D Air control" MIDI controller. Watch our first experiment in the video below:



3Dpad project timeline:


Our Team:


Meet us at the events:

                                                                                       MakerFaire Paris - June 21 & 22


Why do we ask for your support?



3Dpad is only the starting point for OOTSIDEBOX:
We have many other ideas to share in the field of human - machine interaction: touchless & gesture interfaces, telehaptics, wearable technology, artificial intelligence and many more. We are sure you will love it!


Your support in this Indiegogo campaign is the key to start OOTSIDEBOX right now.



We have rewards for you:

Limited edition of our special design T-shirt

Elektor green membership card

3D-Pad shield for Arduino: (1) + (2)

3D-Pad shield + Arduino UNO board (1) + (2) + (3)


The most amazing reward we offer you:

The ootsidebox's box

A unique opportunity to get one of the only two very early stage prototypes of 7 inches touchless screen, hand made by the inventor, Jean Noël himself!

You can see it in action in those videos: 
http://youtu.be/V67WuFBAX4A
http://youtu.be/yyR7JzCk8gs

This prototype has already traveled in a lot of famous places in Europe and USA, for instance the Noisebridge hackerspace in San Francisco, the Elektor Labs in the Netherlands, and recently at the Paris MakerFaire.

This is the only one available today and you can have it for a contribution of 11K Euros (or more), this way you'll become the one who "made it happen" for ootsidebox!

Think about it: what would have happened if you had acquired Apple's first prototype?

Here is what you've got inside the box:
* a 7 inches HDMI screen equiped with ootsidebox's touchless sensor
* a "Panda board" from TI, running demo software under Linux
* the alimentation providing all required voltages

You just plug it in, and the magical demo gets started...


 Jean-Noël - the inventor - says:

"The story started six years ago with my basic invention. For one year now I have been working full time on it to finally get it to market. 
The idea of this disruptive technology is to enable humans to interact with electronical devices by touchless and gestural mode. 

Ootsidebox is in competition with very big companies. However, we are able to give benefits that they cannot provide so far. I´m very proud of this fact and today we want to share it with all the creative people: artists, makers and hackers".


Feel free to share!

3D-pad is an open source and open hardware project:

   All schematics and software codes are provided under                                            Creative Commons license

    More about OOTSIDEBOX on ATMEL's blog:

                                   Interview: Jean-Noël talks Ootsidebox

Don't forget to take a look also at the Gallery (Top of this page)

story:
Short Summary

Hello. My name is Dimitris and I'm from Athens, Greece. I'm Civil Engineer with studies in Materials & Science Engineer. As a Civil Engineer many times my clients call me for a energy inspection to they houses. With thermography I can find the heat leakage and to tell him some ways to avoid that leakage.

What We Need & What You Get

I need about 2000 USD to built the first prototype and, if the judges choose me to show the potential of the thermography, live. And, believe me, this presentation it'll be amazing.

To be honest with you. Right now I'm at the design stage of the InfraMod. Yet I don't have any prototype to show you, but I'm working it. If, for any reason, I can't do a prototype or if  I don't go  to the headquarters of Motorola or if this protoype doesn't work good, I return to you all your funds. This is clear.

The Impact

With InfraMod you can use infrared with very simpe way, Just like to change a Mod to the your Moto Z phone. And where you can use the InfraMod?

Here is some applications of infrared techonology:

  1. First of all, in my section, to provide the heat leakage at the constructions.
  2. For quality control. If you are a quality inspector and you want to see if the metal tube who you use in site is good or it have some internal cracks inside who can't see with your eye.
  3. In health. The most simple use is to see if you of a family member have fever.
  4. Security Forces. Imagine a firefighter trying to see through the dense smoke if there is a person trapped in a fire. So easy with only one "click".
  5. You can use thermography even at the art! To do some "strange" portraits.

That is only few uses of thermography. Now you can understand why this Mod is so important.

Risks & Challenges

Here is a lot of risk. Maybe finally I don't be able to do a prototype. Or if a do one, this prototype to not working good. In any case I'll do my best to solve any issue. And as I mention above, I return any found.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to participate in this campaign it's ok. But please tell to others for this amazing Mod...
