story:
Our Mission

Over the past year we've been working on the first version of Vocal, a new podcast app for Linux that features built-in video playback, smart library management, offline support, automatic downloads, and a slew of other features. We have been focused on making it as user-friendly and beautiful as possible. We're proud of what we achieved with the first release, but we want to make Vocal the absolute best podcast app on any platform, and to do that we need your help!

Planned Features

  • A remarkable new directory browsing experience, with built-in iTunes podcast store listings

  • Multiple device sync (including up-to-the-second episode position sync)

  • Mobile device sync, including Android and iOS

  • Background feed updating and downloading

  • A new playback queue

  • A sleep timer

  • Better native experiences across multiple distributions

  • New search functionality and better filters

  • Full HTML show notes

  • Support for password protected feeds

  • Variable playback speeds

  • and much more!

How We Will Use the Funds

We plan to use the funds raised from this campaign in several ways. Until now, all costs associated with the project (hosting, domain registrations, etc.) have been funded out of pocket. All development has also been done in Nathan's spare time, when he's not working one of two other jobs and attending college as a full time student.

If the campaign gets funded, Nathan will quit his primary job to work on Vocal on a regular basis. This means working full-time for four months in the summer and one month in the winter, and a couple days per week throughout the rest of the year. The funds will be used to pay for his living expenses for at least one full year since he will be giving up his primary source of income, and will also cover the costs of maintaining the project.

We also want to use the funds to pay other contributors, whether they be developers, designers, artists, or anyone else. We think everyone deserves to be paid for the work they put into the project.

Why Fixed Funding?

Several people have asked why we went with a fixed funding campaign instead of using flexible funding. There are two main reasons we decided to do it this way:

  1. The $14,000 goal represents that absolute minimum Nathan would need to pay for living expenses for a year. If we don't reach that goal, full-time development simply isn't possible.

  2. We think that sometimes flexible funding is viewed less seriously and used by projects and people to bring in money without a guarantee of a final product. We want to make it clear that we are very serious and passionate about our work.

Stretch Goals

$20, 000 - Chromecast support

We'll add support to let you cast both video and audio episodes to your Chromecast directly from within the app.

$25, 000 - Unofficial elementary OS podcast

We'll do an unofficial elementary OS podcast on a regular basis (weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly).

$32, 000 - SCALE 14x or 15x 
We'll attend SCALE in Southern California! We want to meet everyone and be able to say thank you in person. We'll go to SCALE 14x if Nathan's college schedule allows, or fallback to 15x if there's no way around it.

$40, 000 - Vocal 3.0 

If we reach $40, 000 we'll have enough to fund two years of development for Vocal!

$50, 000 - To Be Announced

$60, 000 - To Be Announced

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially there are many other ways to help out! Please consider sharing this campaign on social media and sending it to as many people as possible. I'm convinced that with your help we can make something really spectacular.
story_txt:
Our Mission
 Over the past year we've been working on the first version of Vocal, a new podcast app for Linux that features built-in video playback, smart library management, offline support, automatic downloads, and a slew of other features. We have been focused on making it as user-friendly and beautiful as possible. We're proud of what we achieved with the first release, but we want to make Vocal the absolute best podcast app on any platform, and to do that we need your help!
Planned Features




A
remarkable new directory browsing experience, with built-in iTunes
podcast store listings





Multiple
device sync (including up-to-the-second episode position sync)






Mobile
device sync, including Android and iOS






Background
feed updating and downloading






A
new playback queue






A
sleep timer






Better
native experiences across multiple distributions


New search functionality and better filters




Full
HTML show notes






Support
for password protected feeds






Variable
playback speeds


and much more!

  How We Will Use the Funds
We plan to use the funds raised from this campaign in several ways. Until now, all costs associated with the project (hosting, domain registrations, etc.) have been funded out of pocket. All development has also been done in Nathan's spare time, when he's not working one of two other jobs and attending college as a full time student.
If the campaign gets funded, Nathan will quit his primary job to work on Vocal on a regular basis. This means working full-time for four months in the summer and one month in the winter, and a couple days per week throughout the rest of the year. The funds will be used to pay for his living expenses for at least one full year since he will be giving up his primary source of income, and will also cover the costs of maintaining the project.
We also want to use the funds to pay other contributors, whether they be developers, designers, artists, or anyone else. We think everyone deserves to be paid for the work they put into the project.
Why Fixed Funding?
Several people have asked why we went with a fixed funding campaign instead of using flexible funding. There are two main reasons we decided to do it this way:



The
$14,000 goal represents that absolute minimum Nathan would need to
pay for living expenses for a year. If we don't reach that goal,
full-time development simply isn't possible.



We
think that sometimes flexible funding is viewed less seriously and
used by projects and people to bring in money without a guarantee of
a final product. We want to make it clear that we are very serious
and passionate about our work.



Stretch Goals

$20, 000 - Chromecast support


We'll add support to let you cast both video and audio episodes to your Chromecast directly from
within the app.
$25, 000 - Unofficial elementary OS podcast
We'll do an unofficial elementary OS podcast on a regular basis (weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly).
$32, 000 - SCALE 14x or 15x 
We'll attend SCALE in Southern California! We want to meet everyone and be able to say thank you in person. We'll go to SCALE 14x if Nathan's college schedule allows, or fallback to 15x if there's no way around it.


$40, 000 - Vocal 3.0 
If we reach $40, 000 we'll have enough to fund two years of development for Vocal!

$50, 000 - To Be Announced


$60, 000 - To Be Announced


Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially there are many other ways to help out! Please consider sharing this campaign on social media and sending it to as many people as possible. I'm convinced that with your help we can make something really spectacular.

story:
Introducing: Fundamental magnetic cables – the best cross device cable that connects all your devices automatically.

 

The new Fundamental magnetic cable solves all problems you have with your charging and synch cables!

Stop wasting your money on low quality cables that don’t last. We put 1 and 1 together: Best quality materials and newest technology:

  • One cable for all your devices (Lightning, Micro USB)
  • Stronger magnets
  • Stronger and tangle free braiding
  • Supports dual side data transfer and charging
  • LED Indicator  
  • Fast charging
  • Aluminium plugs

The result is an excellent cable that works with every Micro USB and Lightning (Apple) device. And never breaks.

It’s so simple: Our fundamental cables come with a reversible magnetic connector which connects instantly – without any need of turning it around.

 

Best materials for utmost quality:

- High force neodym magnets for best precision  

- Cloth coated cord for a tangle free use

- 18K gold-plated needles for long lasting and stable fast charging experience

- Copper core for relyable data transfers and super fast charging at the same time

- Highly resistant allumnium plug 

- LED indicator for easy use

No frustration with low quality and tangled cables!

We have checked the cable with several strict quality tests – here in Germany. The Fundamental cable meets all requirements by 100% to ensure long lasting pleasure!

 

 If you own a Fundamental cable you do not need any other! Our Fundamental magnetic cables fits to all your devices with micro-USB (Android) and Lightning port (Apple).

You will never need another cable again!

 

We all know that problem:

Breaking cables and connectors. That's frustrating and no one wants that! With our Fundamental cable you have on cable that outlasts all your devices!

One Fundamental cable costs much less money that buying 10 times bad quality cables!

Say „Good Bye“ to your low quality cables. You will buy our Fundamental Cable once – with full satisfaction!

We use the strongest and most efficient materials to make our Fundamental magnetic cables as strong and durable as possible.

With our Fundamental magnetic cables we can say that our cables are many times stronger than the average cables out there. We use anti-scratch aluminum for the plugs and a strong braiding for the cables to ensure perfect agility and durability. It’s even strong enough to make pull-ups with it.

 

 This is the next generation of magnetic cables: Stronger magnets that ever before!

You already have spent too much money on bad quality cables that just fit to one of your devices. Our Fundamental Cables connect instantly – on both sides! We use the next generation of strong magnets to ensure an immediate and strong instant connection.

Just let your cable do the work for you! Connect your phone just by one hand!

In contrary to most cables available on the market, the Fundamental cable features a automatic connection system with ultra-strong magnets. 

Our cable connects and disconnects without frustration. Just hold the cable near the phone and it will connect easily – in every occasion: Bed, car, office or just at home.

 

Annoyed of tangled cables all the time? Our perfectly selected materials will keep you free from tangled cables and give you perfect agility, strength and flexibility. 

 

 

 

 In contrast to most cables on the market our cables support data transfer as well as charging at highest speed - for Android and Apple devices!

That means for you less time plugged in – more time to make the best out of the day.

 

 

 Did you already had a device that broke because of water and dust in the charging port? Fundamental magnetic will change that! Using our cable will protect your phone from dust and dirt and extends the life of your device!

 

 

 

In average we charge our mobiles 1,32 times a day! That means 430 times frustration a year with bad fittig cables.

We at Fundamental have been working hard to change that. With our fundamental cable series we offer a cable that is suitable for daily use without any frustration.

Since we are only two german engineering students, who invested only their own founds for developing the best cable on the market so far, we are now trying to take the next step. With your support we want to help you and everyone else to stop wasting any more money and time on bad cables that only feed the industry.

The goal of our project is not to earn money. If we reach our goal we will have enough money to start our project sustainably so that we can continue in improving our products and develope new innovative solutions for you!

If you have any questions, do not hesitate to drop us an email at hello@fundamental-accessoires.com - ‎we’ll get back to you within 24 hours. 

 

 

Share this campaign on Facebook with your friends and say your people that you backed our project.

Simply send us a screenshot of the post at the end of the campaign.  

As a special "Thank You" we will add a tip of your choice!  

FOR FREE!

 

 We are two engineering students from germany, frustrated by using bad quality cables. Bad cables cost money and are frustrating. We wanted to change that. Lead by our passion for quality, we developed a high quality cable for everyday use. As we started up with nothing, we spent our own money to this project and are only backed by our selfes. 

Now we need your help. Support us, bringing a change to the industry that is producing poor quality cables in order to make you buy more cables and give them your money. That is bad! Spent your money to good stuff, buy an ice cream!

We are confident that you will be excited by our cable. No frustration by charging your phone anymore.

We are very thankfull for your support. Without your support it would not be possible for us to face the financial challenges. Another point with that you would help us a lot is sharing our campaign. You are enthused by the idea of an easy to use, long lasting high quality magnetic cable?

Share our campaign with your friends! Share our campaign and tell your friends about it. Together we can make it!

 

Risks

Delivery time: With any product design and development project, there are always schedule risks associated with manufacturing, supply chain logistics or that suppliers do not fulfill orders on time. We selected our suppliers on basis of the criteria as professionality, quality and reliability. Till now we have overcome many of the difficulties related to the manufacturing and supply chain building process. At this point, we are at the very final stage of this project and will do what we can to deliver as scheduled. 
Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside of the EU, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. 
Customs: Some countries are known for being very slow with customs, and you probably know if you live in one. We're sorry that we can't put a magic stamp on our packages to help them get through faster. 
As transparency is key for us, we’ll keep you frequently updated about our progress and compliance with time schedules. 
If you have any questions at all email us at hello@fundamental-accessories.com

story:
This campaign will only receive funds if at least $50,000 is raised by Tue Jan 08 at 11:59PM PT.

Aladdin is a USB keyboard, not a USB drive. It remembers the keystrokes of your password, not passwords in text files. It saves you time whenever you need to enter passwords.

Aladdin also improves the current situation of people using short, simple or identical passwords everywhere by removing the need to memorise passwords.

"what if you lose it? It is a good question - but that is not what Aladdin is trying to solve - it is trying to solve a bigger problem - trying to remember," by security blogger alapan

Aladdin works with Windows, Mac, Linux as well as smartphones and tablets that accept USB keyboards (See FAQ).

Aladdin also works with passwords managers such as LastPass, KeePass and 1Password. After all, you still need a password to protect the safe!

Aladdin also works across remote sessions such as RDP, VNC, Synergy, SSH and Telnet.

Aladdin is fully open source.

2012/12/11 We are featured on Indiegogo homepage!

2012/12/12 Security blog

Problem 1 - Identical Passwords (Password Leaks)

  • 6.46 million LinkedIn passwords leaked online | ZDNet

  • Yahoo breach puts users of other sites at risk | Reuters

  • Thousands of Twitter passwords exposed | CNET

  • eHarmony, Last.fm hit by same hackers that leaked ... - The Guardian

  • PSA: League of Legends reports EU security breach ... - The Verge

  • Blizzard hacked: Battle.net leaks emails and more - SlashGear

Problem 2 - Simple Passwords (Dictionary Attacks)

  • The 25 Most Popular Passwords of 2012 - Gizmodo

    1. password (Unchanged)
    2. 123456 (Unchanged)
    3. 12345678 (Unchanged)
    4. abc123 (Up 1)
    5. qwerty (Down 1)
    6. monkey (Unchanged)
    7. letmein (Up 1)
    8. dragon (Up 2)
    9. 111111 (Up 3)
    10. baseball (Up 1)
    11. iloveyou (Up 2)
    12. trustno1 (Down 3)
    13. 1234567 (Down 6)
    14. sunshine (Up 1)
    15. master (Down 1)
    16. 123123 (Up 4)
    17. welcome (New)
    18. shadow (Up 1)
    19. ashley (Down 3)
    20. football (Up 5)
    21. jesus (New)
    22. michael (Up 2)
    23. ninja (New)
    24. mustang (New)
    25. password1 (New)

Problem 3 - Short Passwords

  • 25-GPU cluster cracks every standard Windows password in <6 hours | ars technica

A password-cracking expert has unveiled a computer cluster that can cycle through as many as 350 billion guesses per second. It's an almost unprecedented speed that can try every possible Windows passcode in the typical enterprise in less than six hours.

Solution to Problem 1 - Use Different Passwords

Solution to Problem 2 - Use Complex Passwords

Solution to Problem 3 - Use Long Passwords

However, these solutions actually create a new problem because mighty as we may be, we cannot remember so many long, complex, and different passwords. This leads back to problems 1, 2, 3. Remembering passwords may be a necessary evil in the past, but it doesn't have to stay that way.

Now, ask yourself, how do you open your front door? "I use my key!" you shouted. How do you unlock your car? The list goes on... We have used keys to unlock things for centuries so why not computers?

"But...keyboard...password...computer..." I hear you muttered along those lines. Part of the problem is that computers have been using passwords for as long as they have existed. It is unlikely to change everything that's already built from the login screen to websites. However, shouldn't technology work for people, not the other way round?

What if there is something that can remember my password and unlock my computer & websites just like a house key?

Solution to Problems 1, 2, 3 - Aladdin

Here, I proudly present to you - Aladdin: Open Source Hardware Key to Your Online Security. It is the key to your computer & websites. You should treat it like your house key. Put it on your key chain and keep it with you at all times. OK, maybe not in the shower.

Aladdin Prototype 2 & PC

In short, when you plug Aladdin into your computer, he types your password so you don't have to. Simple, isn't it? There is no software to be installed on your computer because it appears as another USB keyboard to your computer. Everything you need to use Aladdin already exists on your computers.

How to Use Aladdin

Method 1 - Single Aladdin

You can simply unlock your computer as seen in the demo. It is usually used when it is more important to maintain physical security than worrying about being hacked. Of course, never leave your key and the lock together unattended. You can also protect your password safe with this method.

Method 2 - Single Aladdin

Think of something you can remember, but different, let's say fb for Facebook and link for LinkedIn.

Then, coupled with a red Aladdin which outputs chahb3Id, you can set up your passwords like:

Website
Password
Facebook fbchahb3Id
LinkedIn linkchahb3Id

Now your password is formed with something from your brain that's easy to remember, but different and something complex that's from Aladdin and the resulting password is long.

Method 3 - Multiple Aladdin

You can simply unlock your computer as seen in the video, but some argues doing that is less secure so how about two Aladdin? You can make up at least 6 unique passwords by plugging them in up to two times individually as well as sequentially.

For example, if A is a red Aladdin key and B is a green Aladdin key, then they can make up to at least 6 unique passwords:

Key
Password
A chahb3Id
B dah4Ohxi
AA chahb3Idchahb3Id
AB chahb3Iddah4Ohxi
BA dah4Ohxichahb3Id
BB dah4Ohxidah4Ohxi

With more Aladdin, the number increases very quickly due to permutation, and with just 3 Aladdin:

  • Number of 1-unit length passwords (1! + 1! + 1!) = 3
  • Number of 2-unit length passwords (2! + 2! + 2!) = 6
  • Number of 3-unit length passwords (3! + 3! + 3!) = 18

These make up 27 unique passwords, which should be more than enough to most people.

Mixed Mode

How about combining these methods? You can even invent your own method, e.g. instead of typing something before or after plugging in Aladdin, you can delete something after it's plugged in!

I personally use the mixed mode; I use a really long password as you've seen in the demo for my laptop because I never leave Aladdin alone with my laptop unattended. For online accounts, I used method 2 for social websites and methods 3 for banking sites.

Features

On its own, Aladdin can:

  • Unlock your computer and websites;
  • Generate and store one random password;
  • Re-generate the stored password.

With host software, it can also:

  • Reset to its default state;
  • Change the length of the random password (default = 8, max 255);
  • Replace the stored password with your choice;
  • Switch between automatically enter the stored password or not (default = No).

Most Asked Questions

  • Q: What if I lose my Aladdin?
  • A: Because Aladdin is mapping digital security to physical security, you would do what you do when you lose your house key, i.e. call a locksmith. Since it is for your computer, you'll ask a computer locksmith (Administrator) to reset your password. If it is for a website login, then you'll request a password reset email to be sent to you. Resetting password is just like replacing the lock in the physical world. Of course you can save yourself the trouble by having multiple Aladdin keys just like you have spare house keys.
  • Q: What if someone stole my Aladdin?
  • A: Report it to the police, seriously. You should do what you do when someone stole your house key. You should change your locks (passwords) as soon as possible. The thief would still need your home address or your login in order to gain access though.
  • Q: Compared to a house key, wouldn't it be easier for someone to pick up my Aladdin and plug into his computer so he knows my password while I have no idea my password was copied?
  • A: Compared to Aladdin, wouldn't it be easier for someone to pick up your house key and press it into a piece of soap so he now has a copy of your house key while you have no idea your house key was copied?

Progress

When I had the idea, what I first did was doing a Google search. No surprise that there exist similar things, however, none of them are at the stage as a finished and affordable product. However, they provided great starting points. One, in particular, is Joonas Pihlajamaa's Code and Life blog - DIY USB password generator which Aladdin has improved upon. In collaboration with Joonas, Aladdin will be released under the GNU General Public License (GPL) too.

In the past few months, I've completed:

Prototyping - two working prototypes have been made, Prototype 1 with a breadboard with the circuits shown below, and Prototype 2 with a red pre-assembled PCB called AVR Stick from SparkFun as seen in the video. By combining the Atmel ATtiny85 micro controller and objective development's V-USB (an open source firmware-only USB driver), a viable USB device can be implemented totally based on open source software.

Aladdin Prototype 1

 

Aladdin Prototype 2

Programming - both the firmware that generates and types the password and corresponding command line interface (CLI) to reset/change the stored password were written (see Features above).

Researching - finding out all the logistics including industrial design, manufacturing, certification, licensing, packaging and distribution...etc...

Funding

Nothing can be made with nothing so that's where you come in. In order to free everyone from the burden of memorising passwords, and make Aladdin a reality, it needs to tap into the economies of scale. This means a manufacturing run of 10,000 units minimum.

The funding will be used between Jan-Mar/2013 to do:

Programming - a better firmware and possibly a nice graphical user interfaces (GUI) to be written to make the whole experience more awesome. The software will be published on the web under GPL. Extra features that are being experimented with the host software include:

  • Insert user name;
  • Press Ctrl-Alt-Del;
  • Press Win-L;
  • Any combinations of above.

CAD Designing - cases that can be attached to the key chain will be designed and funders will vote on their favourite case which goes into production. It may or may not look like the photos shown and it is totally dependent on funders' votes.

PCB Designing - circuits need to be turned into a PCB that fit inside the case. Once a case is voted the favourite, a PCB will be laid within the footprint. One possible design is shown below.

Package Designing - a blister pack with instructions will be designed to protect Aladdin during transit.

The next phase will take place between Apr-Jun/2013 and involves:

Manufacturing - in addition to assembling the components, there are also the CE or FCC approval requirements. Several suppliers have been contacted and they all have their pros and cons. UK suppliers cost three times more than their overseas counterparts, but it might be easier to communicate with them. Overseas suppliers are cheaper, but come with a greater risk of delay. Hence, UK companies with local design capabilities and overseas manufacturing facilities were contacted. Aladdin is "Designed in Europe."

Distribution - several distribution companies have been contacted. Amazon.co.uk seems to be the most reliable choice, but they currently do not ship outside the EU. Dependent on the locations of the funders, more than one shipping company may be needed.

Your Aladdin is on its way to you in Jun/2013.

FAQ

  • Q: What problem does Aladdin solve?
  • A: Aladdin is trying to improve the current situation of people using simple or identical passwords everywhere by removing the need to memorise passwords. Imagine this, we never try to memorise the exact imprints of our house keys, we just have to remember which key is to which lock. Similarly, we don’t have to memorise our passwords, we just have to remember which Aladdin to which computer or website (e.g. by colours).
  • Q: Why is using the same password such a bad thing?
  • A: Using the same password means you trust your secret to a third party which may not adhere to the best practice, e.g. LinkedIn stored unsalted password hashes.
  • Q: How do I unlock my computer and websites with just a solo Aladdin?
  • A: Although you can use the same password, it's not recommended. However, there is nothing stopping you from typing something before or after plugging Aladdin in. Now your password is formed with something from your brain that's easy to remember, but different and something complex that's from Aladdin and the resulting password is long.
  • Q: What kind of computers can I use Aladdin with?
  • A: Since Aladdin emulates a USB keyboard, it works with Windows, Linux, Mac OS and more...
  • Q: What about tablets?
  • A: It is believed that Aladdin may work with iPad via the iPad Camera Kit, but the truth is that it has never been tested. Android tablets with USB OTG functionalities may support Aladdin too.
  • Q: What browsers does Aladdin support?
  • A: Aladdin works with Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Internet Explorer, Opera and more...
  • Q: What websites accept Aladdin password entries?
  • A: Virtually all websites including Facebook, Hotmail, Amazon and more...

Risks and Challenges

Supply Chain - while we have every confidence in the suppliers, it is dependent on their manufacturing capacities and capabilities to ensure on-time deliveries.

Things out of Our Control - if future USB standards become backward-incompatible, then it might stop Aladdin from working. However, the chance is probably lower than winning the lottery. As long as USB keyboards are still being made, Aladdin will continue to work.

Origin

The story began when 6.5 million LinkedIn passwords were leaked in Jun/2012. My password was one of them. I, like everyone else, used the same password across multiple websites. Consequently, I had to change passwords for 10+ websites. I have been working on a feasible solution since then.

This project also comes from the maker/hacker community. The software and the circuits are open-sourced by me or others. However, because there has never been a suitable enclosure that was designed and manufactured, the maker/hacker community cannot use it in daily lives (you wouldn't be able to carry a bare printed circuit board (PCB) on your key chain without the risk of damaging it). One aspect of the project is to design a sleek and minimalistic enclosure voted by funders that looks cool and can be attached to the keychain. Another is to improve its usability. All codes are released under GPL. CAD and PCB designs are Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike (CC BY-SA) licensed.

Who

Hi, my name is Alvin Chang, and I have been an independent IT consultant since 2010. I've seen many cases where computer technologies have fewer contributions to human convenience than TV remotes. I wanted to change that after I attended the Open Source Convention 2011. Therefore, I founded CHANGTECH Labs aiming to make technologies work for people, not the other way round.

Why Open Source

Click to see my article on Open Source Way.
story_txt:
This campaign will only receive funds if at least $50,000 is raised by Tue Jan 08 at 11:59PM PT.
Aladdin is a USB keyboard, not a USB drive. It remembers the keystrokes of your password, not passwords in text files. It saves you time whenever you need to enter passwords.
Aladdin also improves the current situation of people using short, simple or identical passwords everywhere by removing the need to memorise passwords.
"what if you lose it? It is a good question - but that is not what Aladdin is trying to solve - it is trying to solve a bigger problem - trying to remember," by security blogger alapan
Aladdin works with Windows, Mac, Linux as well as smartphones and tablets that accept USB keyboards (See FAQ).
Aladdin also works with passwords managers such as LastPass, KeePass and 1Password. After all, you still need a password to protect the safe!
Aladdin also works across remote sessions such as RDP, VNC, Synergy, SSH and Telnet.
Aladdin is fully open source.


2012/12/11 We are featured on Indiegogo homepage!

2012/12/12 Security blog

Problem 1 - Identical Passwords (Password Leaks)


6.46 million LinkedIn passwords leaked online | ZDNet


Yahoo breach puts users of other sites at risk | Reuters


Thousands of Twitter passwords exposed | CNET


eHarmony, Last.fm hit by same hackers that leaked ... - The Guardian




PSA: League of Legends reports EU security breach ... - The Verge



Blizzard hacked: Battle.net leaks emails and more - SlashGear 



Problem 2 - Simple Passwords (Dictionary Attacks)


The 25 Most Popular Passwords of 2012 - Gizmodo

password (Unchanged)
123456 (Unchanged)
12345678 (Unchanged)
abc123 (Up 1)
qwerty (Down 1)
monkey (Unchanged)
letmein (Up 1)
dragon (Up 2)
111111 (Up 3)
baseball (Up 1)
iloveyou (Up 2)
trustno1 (Down 3)
1234567 (Down 6)
sunshine (Up 1)
master (Down 1)
123123 (Up 4)
welcome (New)
shadow (Up 1)
ashley (Down 3)
football (Up 5)
jesus (New)
michael (Up 2)
ninja (New)
mustang (New)
password1 (New)



Problem 3 - Short Passwords


25-GPU cluster cracks every standard Windows password in <6 hours | ars technica


A password-cracking expert has unveiled a computer cluster that can cycle through as many as 350 billion guesses per second. It's an almost unprecedented speed that can try every possible Windows passcode in the typical enterprise in less than six hours.



Solution to Problem 1 - Use Different Passwords


Solution to Problem 2 - Use Complex Passwords


Solution to Problem 3 - Use Long Passwords

However, these solutions actually create a new problem because mighty as we may be, we cannot remember so many long, complex, and different passwords. This leads back to problems 1, 2, 3. Remembering passwords may be a necessary evil in the past, but it doesn't have to stay that way.
Now, ask yourself, how do you open your front door? "I use my key!" you shouted. How do you unlock your car? The list goes on... We have used keys to unlock things for centuries so why not computers?
"But...keyboard...password...computer..." I hear you muttered along those lines. Part of the problem is that computers have been using passwords for as long as they have existed. It is unlikely to change everything that's already built from the login screen to websites. However, shouldn't technology work for people, not the other way round?
What if there is something that can remember my password and unlock my computer & websites just like a house key?
Solution to Problems 1, 2, 3 - Aladdin
Here, I proudly present to you - Aladdin: Open Source Hardware Key to Your Online Security. It is the key to your computer & websites. You should treat it like your house key. Put it on your key chain and keep it with you at all times. OK, maybe not in the shower.
Aladdin Prototype 2 & PC

In short, when you plug Aladdin into your computer, he types your password so you don't have to. Simple, isn't it? There is no software to be installed on your computer because it appears as another USB keyboard to your computer. Everything you need to use Aladdin already exists on your computers.
How to Use Aladdin
Method 1 - Single Aladdin
You can simply unlock your computer as seen in the demo. It is usually used when it is more important to maintain physical security than worrying about being hacked. Of course, never leave your key and the lock together unattended. You can also protect your password safe with this method.Method 2 - Single Aladdin
Think of something you can remember, but different, let's say fb for Facebook and link for LinkedIn.
Then, coupled with a red Aladdin which outputs chahb3Id, you can set up your passwords like:


Website
Password


Facebook

fbchahb3Id



LinkedIn

linkchahb3Id



Now your password is formed with something from your brain that's easy to remember, but different and something complex that's from Aladdin and the resulting password is long.
Method 3 - Multiple Aladdin
You can simply unlock your computer as seen in the video, but some argues doing that is less secure so how about two Aladdin? You can make up at least 6 unique passwords by plugging them in up to two times individually as well as sequentially.
For example, if A is a red Aladdin key and B is a green Aladdin key, then they can make up to at least 6 unique passwords:


Key
Password


A
chahb3Id


B
dah4Ohxi


AA

chahb3Idchahb3Id



AB

chahb3Iddah4Ohxi



BA

dah4Ohxichahb3Id



BB

dah4Ohxidah4Ohxi



With more Aladdin, the number increases very quickly due to permutation, and with just 3 Aladdin:

Number of 1-unit length passwords (1! + 1! + 1!) = 3
Number of 2-unit length passwords (2! + 2! + 2!) = 6
Number of 3-unit length passwords (3! + 3! + 3!) = 18

These make up 27 unique passwords, which should be more than enough to most people.
Mixed Mode
How about combining these methods? You can even invent your own method, e.g. instead of typing something before or after plugging in Aladdin, you can delete something after it's plugged in!
I personally use the mixed mode; I use a really long password as you've seen in the demo for my laptop because I never leave Aladdin alone with my laptop unattended. For online accounts, I used method 2 for social websites and methods 3 for banking sites.
Features
On its own, Aladdin can:

Unlock your computer and websites;
Generate and store one random password;
Re-generate the stored password.

With host software, it can also:

Reset to its default state;
Change the length of the random password (default = 8, max 255);
Replace the stored password with your choice;
Switch between automatically enter the stored password or not (default = No).

Most Asked Questions

Q: What if I lose my Aladdin?
A: Because Aladdin is mapping digital security to physical security, you would do what you do when you lose your house key, i.e. call a locksmith. Since it is for your computer, you'll ask a computer locksmith (Administrator) to reset your password. If it is for a website login, then you'll request a password reset email to be sent to you. Resetting password is just like replacing the lock in the physical world. Of course you can save yourself the trouble by having multiple Aladdin keys just like you have spare house keys.


Q: What if someone stole my Aladdin?
A: Report it to the police, seriously. You should do what you do when someone stole your house key. You should change your locks (passwords) as soon as possible. The thief would still need your home address or your login in order to gain access though.


Q: Compared to a house key, wouldn't it be easier for someone to pick up my Aladdin and plug into his computer so he knows my password while I have no idea my password was copied?
A: Compared to Aladdin, wouldn't it be easier for someone to pick up your house key and press it into a piece of soap so he now has a copy of your house key while you have no idea your house key was copied?


Progress
When I had the idea, what I first did was doing a Google search. No surprise that there exist similar things, however, none of them are at the stage as a finished and affordable product. However, they provided great starting points. One, in particular, is Joonas Pihlajamaa's Code and Life blog - DIY USB password generator which Aladdin has improved upon. In collaboration with Joonas, Aladdin will be released under the GNU General Public License (GPL) too.

In the past few months, I've completed:
Prototyping - two working prototypes have been made, Prototype 1 with a breadboard with the circuits shown below, and Prototype 2 with a red pre-assembled PCB called AVR Stick from SparkFun as seen in the video. By combining the Atmel ATtiny85 micro controller and objective development's V-USB (an open source firmware-only USB driver), a viable USB device can be implemented totally based on open source software. 
Aladdin Prototype 1

 
Aladdin Prototype 2

Programming - both the firmware that generates and types the password and corresponding command line interface (CLI) to reset/change the stored password were written (see Features above). 
Researching - finding out all the logistics including industrial design, manufacturing, certification, licensing, packaging and distribution...etc... 

Funding
Nothing can be made with nothing so that's where you come in. In order to free everyone from the burden of memorising passwords, and make Aladdin a reality, it needs to tap into the economies of scale. This means a manufacturing run of 10,000 units minimum.

The funding will be used between Jan-Mar/2013 to do:
Programming - a better firmware and possibly a nice graphical user interfaces (GUI) to be written to make the whole experience more awesome. The software will be published on the web under GPL. Extra features that are being experimented with the host software include:

Insert user name;
Press Ctrl-Alt-Del;
Press Win-L;
Any combinations of above.

CAD Designing - cases that can be attached to the key chain will be designed and funders will vote on their favourite case which goes into production. It may or may not look like the photos shown and it is totally dependent on funders' votes.

PCB Designing - circuits need to be turned into a PCB that fit inside the case. Once a case is voted the favourite, a PCB will be laid within the footprint. One possible design is shown below.

Package Designing - a blister pack with instructions will be designed to protect Aladdin during transit.
The next phase will take place between Apr-Jun/2013 and involves:
Manufacturing - in addition to assembling the components, there are also the CE or FCC approval requirements. Several suppliers have been contacted and they all have their pros and cons. UK suppliers cost three times more than their overseas counterparts, but it might be easier to communicate with them. Overseas suppliers are cheaper, but come with a greater risk of delay. Hence, UK companies with local design capabilities and overseas manufacturing facilities were contacted. Aladdin is "Designed in Europe."
Distribution - several distribution companies have been contacted. Amazon.co.uk seems to be the most reliable choice, but they currently do not ship outside the EU. Dependent on the locations of the funders, more than one shipping company may be needed.
Your Aladdin is on its way to you in Jun/2013.

FAQ

Q: What problem does Aladdin solve?
A: Aladdin is trying to improve the current situation of people using simple or identical passwords everywhere by removing the need to memorise passwords. Imagine this, we never try to memorise the exact imprints of our house keys, we just have to remember which key is to which lock. Similarly, we don’t have to memorise our passwords, we just have to remember which Aladdin to which computer or website (e.g. by colours).


Q: Why is using the same password such a bad thing?
A: Using the same password means you trust your secret to a third party which may not adhere to the best practice, e.g. LinkedIn stored unsalted password hashes.


Q: How do I unlock my computer and websites with just a solo Aladdin?
A: Although you can use the same password, it's not recommended. However, there is nothing stopping you from typing something before or after plugging Aladdin in. Now your password is formed with something from your brain that's easy to remember, but different and something complex that's from Aladdin and the resulting password is long.



Q: What kind of computers can I use Aladdin with?
A: Since Aladdin emulates a USB keyboard, it works with Windows, Linux, Mac OS and more...


Q: What about tablets?
A: It is believed that Aladdin may work with iPad via the iPad Camera Kit, but the truth is that it has never been tested. Android tablets with USB OTG functionalities may support Aladdin too.


Q: What browsers does Aladdin support?
A: Aladdin works with Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Internet Explorer, Opera and more...


Q: What websites accept Aladdin password entries?
A: Virtually all websites including Facebook, Hotmail, Amazon and more...


Risks and Challenges
Supply Chain - while we have every confidence in the suppliers, it is dependent on their manufacturing capacities and capabilities to ensure on-time deliveries.
Things out of Our Control - if future USB standards become backward-incompatible, then it might stop Aladdin from working. However, the chance is probably lower than winning the lottery. As long as USB keyboards are still being made, Aladdin will continue to work.

Origin
The story began when 6.5 million LinkedIn passwords were leaked in Jun/2012. My password was one of them. I, like everyone else, used the same password across multiple websites. Consequently, I had to change passwords for 10+ websites. I have been working on a feasible solution since then.
This project also comes from the maker/hacker community. The software and the circuits are open-sourced by me or others. However, because there has never been a suitable enclosure that was designed and manufactured, the maker/hacker community cannot use it in daily lives (you wouldn't be able to carry a bare printed circuit board (PCB) on your key chain without the risk of damaging it). One aspect of the project is to design a sleek and minimalistic enclosure voted by funders that looks cool and can be attached to the keychain. Another is to improve its usability. All codes are released under GPL. CAD and PCB designs are Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike (CC BY-SA) licensed.

Who
Hi, my name is Alvin Chang, and I have been an independent IT consultant since 2010. I've seen many cases where computer technologies have fewer contributions to human convenience than TV remotes. I wanted to change that after I attended the Open Source Convention 2011. Therefore, I founded CHANGTECH Labs aiming to make technologies work for people, not the other way round.

Why Open Source
Click to see my article on Open Source Way.

story:
Who is Padseen for?

In a world teeming with pad computing devices, is there room for our Padseen device? Even though we have "pad" in our name, Padseen is definitely not a pad computing device.  It's different. It's what we call a "cloud media player," and it fits quietly in your home and brings your connected media world one inch closer. 

If you are one of the 100 million Instagram users, you surely will love the Padseen media player.  It's a fun, new way to enjoy Instagram photos in the home, office or anywhere you've got a Wi-Fi connection. But it's not just for Instagram. You can get Facebook and Flickr photo updates on Padseen as well. Twitter photos? You bet, we're adding all these cloud photo services one by one as we speak.  

And the fun certainly doesn't end with photographs. Padseen starts with photos and then includes all the media you expect to see from an iPad: text, music, and video - all of them. 

Customize Your Social Media Experience By Using Your iPhone or Android Phone as the Remote Control.

Padseen is the first connected display product built for the mobile computing era. We designed Padseen with a careful balance of simplicity and usability in mind. It's infinitely customizable through useful cloud-connected apps.  We think your iPhone or Android phone is the best remote control. That's why we've included only two hardware buttons on Padseen and rely on the smartphone as its main interface. Use our free app to configure Padseen’s Wi-Fi connection, to manage the slideshow mode, and to link Padseen to your various social media accounts. Once it is set up the way you want it, Padseen goes to work, quietly pulling your designated media from the Internet. We plan to add as many social media set-up services as possible, allowing Padseen users to pick and choose right on their smartphones whatever they want to hear or see on the display.

Customize with Apps.

Apps bring Padseen to life. We have built an amazing Padseen app on both Android and iOS platforms for your use. For photos, you can now set up access credentials with Instagram, Facebook photo, and Flickr. You can also set up a Gmail account so that photos and videos can be sent directly to Padseen. Use the music control feature to play, pause or skip tracks on your phone with the touch of a button. We're working on a wake-me-up-with-the-weather-report app and a clock face app. These apps features will be the first, but more are in the works!  And when we add new features to the apps we can easily push them to you with an app update.

Customize by Programming Your Own App.

We take personalization one important step further. We are launching a programmable API so that users with a flair for programming can create their own apps that link to Padseen. Maybe you are with a company that needs a digital signage solution; Padseen is perfect for creating targeted promotions for hotels, cafes, and shops. Or maybe you want to create your own application for showing intimate family photos? How about a wake-me-up-with-music app?

How about a dedicated Twitter feed? A Soundcloud player?  The potential applications by customization are virtually unlimited. We will add information about our API on the Padseen API Development Section you will find at www.coolwi.com. 

How Padseen Works

Download the free Padseen app to your iPhone or Android phone. Use the app to set up Wi-Fi connectivity for Padseen over the air. Log in to your social media accounts such as Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter via the app. And bam! You're up and running. Photographs from your Instagram feed will start pushing to Padseen immediately; same for your Facebook and Flickr accounts. Use the Play/Pause button at the top to stop the photo slideshow and video and sound. And use the toggle button to switch photo display formats: show one large photo plus six thumbnail views, all thumbnail images, or one large photo plus text view. 

Compatibility.

  • iPhone 3GS, 4, 4S running iOS 5 or any iPod Touch with iOS 5 and up.
  • Android devices running OS 2.3 and up. 

Unfortunately, we don't yet have a Padseen app for the Blackberry or Windows Phone platform. But you can still ask your friends to send photos or videos to an email address you have set up for your Padseen media player. 

Where We're at:

Our development team has worked on Wi-Fi connected photo frames for years. We think what sets Padseen apart from Wi-Fi photo frames is our focus on leveraging the smartphone as the controller apparatus, that and the ability to customize the user experience using flexible and easy-to-update Apps. The Padseen that you see in the video is one of our actual working prototypes. 

We have completed the basic Padseen smartphone apps and the hardware design for the Padseen. To ensure quality and reliability, we have made some smart decisions by locating and using an Android SOC board that is powerful, fast, and proven (it had been shipped in over two million working Android pad devices).  With your support, we can bring Padseen into households around the world right away. While we're right in the middle of production preparation, your contribution will help fund:

  • Production tooling (this is a big up-front expense for any product manufacturer)
  • Financing for an initial, large component order
  • Wi-Fi, CE, FCC certifications

FAQ

Q. What’s the screen resolution?       A. It is 1024 X 600. 

Q. Does the player stay on all the time?       A. Yes.  But the screen will turn off by a timer setup feature.

Q. Does Padseen have a battery?      A. No, we designed Padseen to be a desktop device. This is not meant to be a portable device similar to iPad.  If it were, we would need to include an expensive battery in its design, and charge substantially more money for the Padseen purchase price. 

Q. Why no touch screen? A. For the same reason we don't include a battery. It is not an iPad. We did not want to design an expensive device with a quirky touch screen and have to charge a high price for it.  Wait until you see how well the app phone controller works! 

Q. Why use a 16 by 9, 10' LCD display?         A. This is the most widely used LCD display in the industry, so it provides the best value for the buck. Besides, we think providing a more diverse way of presenting photos is attractive and intriguing to the eye.

Q. Where do you ship and is shipping free?        A. We are able to ship to an address in U.S., UK, Australia, Hong Kong, and other European countries directly from the manfaucturing location - Shenzhen China. Due to the special deal offered by our logistics service provider, we are able to offer free shipment to all above mentioned locations except for other European countries. Shipment to an Euorpean country other than UK will cost $15 dollars more.

Technical Specifications

Here are the nitty-gritty specs for you tech enthusiasts:

  • 1 Ghz ARM Processor
  • 4GB Internal Flash Memory
  • 512MB RAM
  • Android 2.3 operating system
  • 10.2' 1024 X 600 LCD
  • Built-in 802.11b/g/n Wi-Fi
  • Built-in speakers
  • Audio-out port
  • 5V MicroUSB power adapter  

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Founders of Coolwi had done this before. Padseen is created based on our past efforts. Right now the key risk is being able to deliver right before Christmas Day. We have lined up an excellent manufacturer for Padseen and are confident about product quality. Your help is much needed. Aassuming we meet our fundraising goal, we will deliver in time for Chritmas. We have already booked air transporation spaces on December 14th directly for drop shipping to addresses in U.S., UK and Europe, and Austraiia - we are racing and your help will reduce the risk.

story:
My Story

While working on a few gadgets, robots, and mechatronic devices, I required a HUD like interface with interactive capabilities. I developed an application in C# which can be easily customized in terms of it's graphics, functionality and application.  

If you are building your own gadgets, and would like a cool front end with interactive capabilities, then look no further. 

Sample Applications

By supporting this project, you will gain access to GHUD and a variety of sample applications that show how to use it. (C# source code projects that you can adapt for your own applications.)

  • Layout  - This sample shows how to layout multiple GHUD components. 


  • Interaction - Display the state of external switches and associate actions with buttons. An interface for Velleman  K8055 Experiment Interface Board is included with this product.


  • Webcam  - Capture and display images from multiple webcams. I’m using an EMGU device driver which supports commercial PC webcams including IP addresses (allowing wireless possibilities over a network). 
  • Servo  - Controlling servo motors using a PC mouse. By clicking the mouse pointer on the screen within GHUD, a pan-tilt mechanism can be controlled. Interfaces for Phidgets and Pololu servo controllers are included with this product. 


  • Color Image Processing  - Detect pretaught colored blobs in a webcam image. 

Additionally, it shows how to automatically control a pan-tilt mechanism, enabling the possibility for object finding and motion tracking.  


  • Sound  - Add polyphonic sound effects to your projects.

And it doesn't stop here! There are more samples that can be introduced with your continued support. 

  • Image Processing (extended) - Experimental code for face detection, object recognition using contours (not just color), and motion detection are currently in the prototyping stage. 

  • Speak - Turn text into speech output through your PC speakers. 
  • Listen  - Listen for voice input from a microphone, and stop listening when the PC is speaking. 
  • Automation - Encode rules for decision making and executing actions. 

Requirements

What is needed in order to run GHUD? The minimum system requirements is a Windows 7 PC (SP1) with .Net Framework 4 (free from Microsoft), and a webcam device. It also supports stereo webcams (tested with Minoru) and pan-tilt mechanism. For detailed information, please don't hesitate to contact me with questions.

Funding

This product is in it's prototyping stage of development. With your support I will be able to make this product available commercially: Create an installer, upload it to the internet, then email you a public license key. My anticipation is that this process will take several months, and I require your help to make it happen. The funds not only cover my costs but also cover the cost of a third-party license. 

Updates will be published at regular intervals following the successful outcome of this campaign.


(Sound effects: http://www.freesfx.co.uk, http://www.soundjay.com, http://www.sidneyturner.com/sound-effects.html)

My StoryWhile working on a few gadgets, robots, and mechatronic devices, I required a HUD like interface with interactive capabilities. I developed an application in C# which can be easily customized in terms of it's graphics, functionality and application.  If you are building your own gadgets, and would like a cool front end with interactive capabilities, then look no further. Sample ApplicationsBy supporting this project, you will gain access to GHUD and a variety of sample applications that show how to use it. (C# source code projects that you can adapt for your own applications.)Layout  - This sample shows how to layout multiple GHUD components. Interaction - Display the state of external switches and associate actions with buttons. An interface for Velleman  K8055 Experiment Interface Board is included with this product.Webcam  - Capture and display images from multiple webcams. I’m using an EMGU device driver which supports commercial PC webcams including IP addresses (allowing wireless possibilities over a network). 
Servo  - Controlling servo motors using a PC mouse. By clicking the mouse pointer on the screen within GHUD, a pan-tilt mechanism can be controlled. Interfaces for Phidgets and Pololu servo controllers are included with this product. 
Color Image Processing  - Detect pretaught colored blobs in a webcam image. Additionally, it shows how to automatically control a pan-tilt mechanism, enabling the possibility for object finding and motion tracking.  
Sound  - Add polyphonic sound effects to your projects.
And it doesn't stop here! There are more samples that can be introduced with your continued support.

story:
Summary

Spin-Off is awesome interactive fidget spinner that is easy to use and fun to compete with against your friends. It is compatible with most games that support bluetooth gamepads.

You can use the spinner as interface for games. It also has a standard D-Pad configuration plus 4 buttons for classic gaming.

It is small in size and can easily fit into any pocket.

Contributors will help us create an amazingly balanced, sleek design, and affordable smart fidget spinner. We are currently in our prototype phase so our design will change prior to production. Our goal is to have maximum spin time, beautiful design, and smart motion tracking.  Our stretch goals below display the games and features that will be added if we exceed our initial goal.

 

Spin-Off Standard Spinner Specifications

• BLE 4.0

• IOS and Android Compatible

• MicroUSB charging

• LED Connection Indicator

• Gyroscope and Accelerometer

• Hall Effect Sensor

• D-Pad  Buttons

• 4 Regular Buttons

• 10m Transmission Range

• 200mAh Lithium Battery

• ~20h Working time 

 

Compatibility

X-input, D-input, Mac mode

IOS and Android application will be released during the first shipment of the initial spinners!

About Me

• My name is Matthew Lippert. I have worked for the Air Force Institute of Technology as a Research Assistant. I was lead software for their Attitude and Determination Control System on small spacecraft. Using my experience I have created an awesome and fun game that I hope will be used by many. This campaign has been one of the funnest projects to work on. It is an amazingly fun and interactive new way of playing simple games. People of all ages will enjoy this!

• Contributors will have the ability to get on the ground floor of Spin-Off. They will have a strong say as to what is developed and the future of Spin-Off. I take crowdfunding very seriously and want to understand what kind of features that contributors would like to see developed into this product.

What We Need & What You Get 

For Spin-Off to be a viable success I need to raise at least $8,000 for it to be worth the development. Hopefully, we will be able to hit our initial goal and be able to meet the stretch goals as well!

All the funding will be going to developing an awesome well made device that will be safe, easy to use, and super fun.

Funds will be used for furthering our development of the current spinner, integrating with games that are already available, and mass production of the final spinner stage.

Risks & Challenges

We are currently in the prototype stage. We have proven that our technology works and we properly estimated that we will be able to reach all of our goals in the following timeline. However, our biggest risk will be mass producing our final design and ensuring a safe and fun product. To help with this risk I have found outside help that will be able to assist with the manufacturing process.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am asking for contributions but I understand that this is not always possible. I would ask that you spread the word and understand that this project is not happening without you. I think this can be an amazing game and if you have friends and family that might enjoy this product them please let them know about this awesome up and coming game.

Don't forget to use Indiegogo's share tools to share Spin-Off with other users!

I just want to thank you for even considering our new product. Sincerely thanks, from the Spin-Off development team .

story:
Hi, we're Kevin Bartczak and Andy Biro,

We're two friends with years of experience implementing security solutions in commercial and government business. A few months ago, we were talking about yet another breach of credit, debit and identity card security. We were frustrated with how the escalating fraud levels are currently hurting so many ordinary, normal people. Almost without exception, nearly every one of these people thought identity theft and credit card fraud would never happen to them, because it isn't well known just how easy it is.

At least, not by people on the right side of the law.

We decided we wanted to help stop the rising levels of fraud dead in its tracks. So we decided to test some ideas of how normal people could protect the cards they normally carried in a wallet or purse. It wasn't easy. It took in-depth experimentation, testing and consulting with specialists to find something affordable and effective enough for everyone. Finally, we believe we've managed to find a simple, but effective solution.

The result is GarbleCard.

GarbleCard uses some high tech developed by th US Department of Defense, to block the signal being read from any nearby RFID chip. That's the chip you see on your credit cards these days, as well as in drivers licenses, passports, access cards and more.

Unlike anything else out there right now, GarbleCard works with any wallet, regardless of which side of the card it's on, cheaply, reliably and without bulking up your current wallet or needing any kind of batteries. GarbleCard is also the only solution that blocks both methods of reading your card: RFID and the traditional magnetic strip on the back. Because of the unique design though you can still use both wherever they were actually meant to be used (ie buying something with your credit card)..

At the end of the day, this keeps random people with a cheap card reader from buying stuff with your credit cards, stealing your identity for illegal purposes, getting access to places only you should have access to and more.

Now, all we need is your help to get the first batch mass produced and protecting people everywhere. But what actually is GarbleCard, and how do we know it protects against fraud that can affect you personally? Read this and find out:

 

 

When Victims Include a Chief Justice, How at Risk are You?

No one is safe from identity theft -- not even a Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.

Recently, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, John Roberts confirmed to The Associated Press, that his credit card account numbers had been compromised. He wasn't even able to buy a coffee without having to pay in Cash when he found out. Most likely it was by a criminal who had managed to fraudulently get his card details, possibly from it's smart chip or magnetic stripe, and had already been in the process of using them for illegal purposes.

So, let me ask you a question. Do you use a credit card, passport or driver’s license with a chip or magnetic stripe on it? Chances are you actually have more than one. According to the Smart Card Association, about 100 million RFID enabled cards in are circulation under various names. Check your cards right now. Visa calls them “PayWave”, Mastercard dubs theirs “PayPass,” Discover issues them under the “Zip” name and American Express calls theirs “ExpressPay.” We're talking about basically any credit, ID or security card with a chip here (and more).

Original card image by Liew Cheon Fong, CC BY-SA

Even if you never use the features of the cards chip, do you know how easy it is for someone to? This lets them steal the details of your card and start using it to do anything you could (such as running up huge charges on a credit card, or identifying themselves as you from an ID card like a drivers license). Do you know how easy it is for them to start using your identity without your even realizing?

All it takes is for someone with a $50 device that they can buy on eBay right now, put it in a bag and walk by you on the street. That's it. Next thing you know you're getting credit card bills for thousands of dollars or worse, and even if you get it sorted out with the credit card company, it takes time, effort and hassle. We all end up paying for higher fees from credit card fraud eventually, too. When they steal your identity they can do much, much worse.

 

 

1. The Setup

The thief connects a cheap, readily available battery-powered card reader to a netbook. They put it in a briefcase, so you never even see it. Some phones have this technology buil right in.  Read more here at Consumer Reports.

2. The Swipe:

 

Fraudster carries briefcase close to your purse or pocket where identity and credit cards might be carried. The card reader reads your card details from a distance.

3. The Copy:

Safe elsewhere, the scammer writes your information onto a new, blank card. Now they have a fully working copy of your credit card or ID. How long it takes for you to find out depends on which illegal things they feel like using it for.

Illustrations by Brown Bird Design

 

 

 

In short, if you ever carry your license, passport or credit card without protection – and go anywhere where people can walk close by, your details can be stolen.

When we realized just how simple and affordable credit card fraud and identity theft have become with the new smart cards, we were shocked. We were horrified. We thought someone would come up with a way to help protect us and the people we all care about.

Here we are though, years after the introduction of smart cards – and we as well as our friends and family, are still just as much at risk as ever. More so actually, as the machines needed to commit this fraud have become much cheaper and easier to get.

So we set out to find a way to stop these evildoers in their tracks. It had to be cheap enough that it could protect the people with little money; the people who need it the most. It had to be easy to use and it had to be effective.

After months of testing and experimenting with materials and manufacturing processes, we came up with a prototype that could be cheap, simple to use, convenient and effective. Take a look.

 

 

 

Just keeping a GarbleCard in your wallet protects you by using shielding developed for the Department of Defence to protect their information and equipment. It prevents your cards from being read by passing card readers. This includes credit and debit cards as well as driver’s licenses, passports and any other card or document using a smart chip.

Take a look at how the current prototype works. What you're seeing here is essentially a complete, fully functional GarbleCard. The only differences to the finished product will be some final tweaks of the cover design (adding backers names etc) which are only cosmetic: 

In tests with our existing prototypes, simply placing GarbleCard near your cards protects you from having your personal information being stolen consistently. Easy. You get increased security, convenience, it’s affordable, and it really works. And GarbleCard doesn't add any bulk to your wallet. It's also a constant reminder to keep your credit and debit cards secure when you’re out and about.

While reading the magnetic stripe in your purse or wallet is much harder for scammers than reading the chip, if they do try, Garblecard stops them there, too. Its shielding and larger magnetic stripe make Garblecard's fake information easier to pick up, so that's what gets read by their machine. Hasta la vista scammers!

 

 

 

 

There are many opinions and methods being used out there to try and thwart these forms of cybercrime. However, GarbleCard is the only solution that:

  • Let's you use any wallet - even your current one.
  • Doesn't damage credit/debit/identity cards
  • Easily fits in your wallet, pocket or purse
  • Shields against most known hacking devices
  • Promotes awareness and security
  • Gives proof of protection to banks if cards are hacked
  • Is affordable... and
  • Can be made available for non-profit fund-raising projects.

 

If you don't carry a wallet, you can still get full protection anywhere just by placing GarbleCard between your credit card and the potential fraudster.

In fact, anywhere you are concerned you might be in an unsecured situation, like a bus terminal or airport, just make sure you hold both your cards together with GarbleCard in your hand. In our tests, we saw how GarbleCard is also effective used in this way, shielding the card completely from scammers.

 

You get two GarbleCards in all of the reward tiers here for a number of reasons. One is to help protect you if you use a double-sided wallet. You can also have one in your wallet and one in your hand, or just an extra card in case you lose one. And of course, it doesn't help your credit situation if your card is safe but your partner’s isn't, so we figure it's always a good idea to have a spare.

 

 

$10 pledge: This is the double card package. Every pledge gets a two-pack set because of the extra protection that another card affords, as described above. The GarbleCard two-pack is delivered in a smart graphic package with simple directions and access to FAQs on our completed website.

$20 pledge: A two-pack set of GarbleCards, plus we'll also include your name (only) on our website as a backer of our project. Everyone will receive an email from Kevin and Andy thanking them for their support and access to the GarbleCard blog and Facebook page so you can stay up to date with news and advice in GarbleCard's mission to eradicate this epidemic of RFID based cyber crime.

$50 pledge: Be remembered permanently for having helped stop the most common form of cyber crime today. Pledge $50 and we'll use your first name and last initial or first initial and last name to create the background graphic noise on one of the two sides of GarbleCard. It took us a dozen or so tries to come up with this unique card design. We're sure you'll get a kick out of seeing your name on GarbleCard's design, everywhere.

 

$100 pledge: This reward tier is even more exclusive and limited to the first 50 pledges, as there just isn't enough space on the card for more names. We'll use your first name and last initial or first initial and last name to create the word GARBLE on one of the two sides of GarbleCard. We need to leave enough space for our names, K Bartczak and A Biro too...after all, we want to be immortalized on GarbleCard with you!

 

 

In researching the potential demand for GarbleCard, we have read a great many articles, studies and interviews addressing Smart cards and the related RFID technology and applications. The links below are valuable explanations used, in part, to prepare this project for Indiegogo. If you are interested in learning more, articles like these are a good place to start:

Newer cards can be hacked too.
SmartCard Technology.
How Smartcard Technology Works.
Should I use my new RFID enabled Smartcard?
Mythbusters banned from speaking about FRID chip by Visa and Mastercard
Who's been scanning your credit card?

 

This Indiegogo project is needed to raise the funds to mass manufacture the first ever production run of GarbleCard. It will be produced by the same companies that actually manufacturer credit cards already, however none of these are set up to produce cards with this kind of shielding technology. Accordingly, there are high costs, complex machine retooling and large minimum orders to get GarbleCard off the ground. It might be a cliché, but it’s true to say that without support of people like you on Indiegogo, this can't happen, and people everywhere would continue to be at risk of largely preventable fraud.

While we have working prototypes, to produce these in mass, we need your support. Our mission is to protect people from credit and identity theft. While the cards are cheap to produce, once the factory's equipment is set up, ultimately we can only get started with your help.

Not only do we need the funds to produce the first production run of GarbleCard, but we need funds to inform people about how high the hacking risks are right now, and what can be done about it. We want to make this affordable enough that everyone can be protected. This may not be possible if we're forced to use some other funding options that have to maximize returns over protecting the largest number of people.

Even if you can't afford to pledge yourself, we need people just like you, sharing on social media. We need people to show the people they care about how to protect themselves. We're determined to stop the current wave of credit card and identity theft dead in it's tracks. Every pledge or social share you make helps to make it real.

Thank you!

Kevin and Andy
