story:
What can Xiobots do for you?

There are Xiobot devices to monitor and control everything in your home or business. 

You could place an environmental sensor anywhere and you’d instantly be able to monitor the climate in your surroundings. Put a garden sensor between your flowers and it’ll tell you about the air temperature in your yard and the moisture content of your soil. Attach a Xiobot control to your sprinkler system and manage your landscaping better by precisely regulating your watering.  Connect all of your Xiobot devices with a Xiobot Intelligent Controller and you’ll be able to securely monitor and control everything from anywhere across the Internet!

What are Xiobots?

Xiobots are tiny, durable, wireless devices — each with its own embedded microprocessor and integrated Bluetooth transceiver — which can operate on a network or the Internet through a Xiobot Intelligent Controller; or, directly with your Bluetooth 4.0-enabled smartphone, tablet, or PC.

What can Xiobots do? Measure and control your environment — manage and automate your world.

Are Xiobots expensive? No. Xiobots will use cutting-edge technologies, components, and manufacturing methodologies whose costs have been reduced by large-scale production. They will be a bargain!

How do Xiobots interact with you? Xiobot sensors can immediately update Bluetooth 4.0-enabled smartphones, tablets, and PCs (that are within range) with status information; or, operate and send text and e-mail messages to you through a network or the Internet using a Xiobot Intelligent Controller.

How "tiny" are Xiobots? The smallest wireless sensors will be about the size of a lipstick case.

What does wireless connectivity do? Connecting sensors and devices to a centralized control system is the proverbial "last 100 feet" problem. And that is: how to get all elements connected at minimal cost in terms of time and material. Wireless technology makes a distributed control system truly "plug ’n play".

What if you are unsure about Bluetooth 4.0 compatibility? Not a problem... if your smartphone, tablet, or PC doesn’t have Bluetooth 4.0 compatibility, the Xiobot system includes intelligent controllers that allow any device with a web browser to interact with Xiobots.

What does a "Xiobot Intelligent Controller" do? A controller offers seamless access to your Xiobots locally (on your Local Area Network) and across the Internet — providing you with real-time information from your Xiobot devices and giving you remote connectivity to your Xiobot controls.  Xiobot Intelligent Controllers include a micro-processor that automatically performs scheduled and programmable functions and executes useful apps.

Control everything with a Xiobot!

What Xiobot devices will be available?

Xiobots can perform simple functions like reading temperature, barometric pressure, and humidity — and complex operations such as connecting to ‘real world’ systems and equipment. They can: switch low-power electrical signals (controlling heating and air conditioning systems); switch 110-220 VAC loads (high-power, household electrical lines); interface with your existing security system or sprinkler controls; or, replicate IR remote controls when used with our Entertainment System app (which will give you control of your television and entertainment equipment like you’ve never had before). And, they can connect to and interact with other home and building automation systems.

Xiobots are easy to set-up and use; will typically operate for over a year with a single set of batteries; and, come with free software applications for your smartphone (iPhone or Android), tablet, or PC. An intelligent controller allows you to access your Xiobots across your local network or remotely through the Internet. The intelligent controller is a microcomputer that stores apps and information; allows your Xiobots to respond to scripted and scheduled (timer-initiated) commands; and, to act upon monitored conditions or events (such as detected temperature changes or a status change in a sensor or detected signal). A cloud service will be available to extend the capabilities of Xiobots even further.

The Xiobot system is extensible... we are committed to a product architecture that will evolve to fulfill future opportunities for both innovative hardware and software.  The devices listed above are just some of the Xiobot products on our drawing board.

Xiobots are here to serve you!

Where would you use Xiobots?

Xiobot devices are designed to be versatile and provide reliable installation in diverse settings — whether they’re used in home and building automation or for industrial control.

A typical home can use several Xiobot devices.  The sample floor plan (below) illustrates how wireless Xiobots might be set up to:

  • manage an HVAC (Heating - Ventilating - Air Conditioning) system using several environment sensors, a contact closure control, and the thermostat app running in an intelligent controller; 
  • detect alert conditions with signal sensors connected to an alarm panel and smoke detectors, water leak sensors placed under appliances in the utility room, under water heaters, and in the kitchen or basement; and,

  • control sprinklers and pool or spa water level with relay controls and scripted commands operating in an intelligent controller.

                                                                            

What else can you do with Xiobots?

  • Accurately monitor the environment (temperature and humidity) of your children’s rooms
  • Locate temperature sensors in your refrigerator, freezer, attic, basement, storerooms, anywhere
  • Monitor your wine cellar, humidor, collectibles, art collection, anything
  • Monitor and control everything inside of a vacation home, rental property, or office
  • Monitor and activate sump pumps, attic ventilators, or any other essential equipment
  • Monitor your pool, spa, or Koi pond temperatures — even aquariums — automatically filling water as needed, and predicting dangerously low temperatures or excessively rapid evaporation
  • Monitor the proximity of your dog or cat
  • Monitor the operation of equipment throughout your home, building, or industrial facility
  • Interface with (and control) an entertainment system — allowing you to programmatically ‘channel surf’, perform complex and hard-to-remember sequences of commands, or automatically switch channels and turn your TV on or off throughout the week
  • Interface with an alarm system to extend, enhance, and personalize its functionality
  • Predict potential frost or arid conditions in your garden
  • Be alerted when utility power fails in unoccupied facilities (or at home while you’re asleep)
  • Be alerted when doors or gates are opened
  • Use the intelligent controller to automatically respond to monitored conditions or random events
  • Use the intelligent controller to execute date and time-scheduled or scripted actions

The possibilities are endless!

Xiobots = Great Hardware + Great Software

We understand that you’ll demand hardware that can be installed with apps that can be configured without opening an installation manual.  We know that you’ll want apps that’ll get you the information you need as quickly as possible and give you the control you expect.

We’ll deliver.  We are committed to producing sophisticated devices whose functionality, reliability, and performance are an outstanding value; and, to creating the most efficient and easy-to-use apps possible.  Every app will be intuitively obvious to use and updated automatically as it is improved.  Every device will evolve and exciting new designs will   be forthcoming.  We are devoted to automation technology — it’s who we are!

Take the Environment Sensor device for example.  It operates with an app that lets you scroll through all similar devices within your Xiobot domain.  Once you select the specific sensor that you want to monitor, the app displays the pertinent information with the presentation settings you’ve previously selected.  You’ll see a calibrated temperature reading, relative humidity, and barometric pressure. You’ll see graphical trends showing highs and lows for each parameter over a specified timespan.  On another page, you’ll be able to select high and low warning and alert settings and the optional actions that you want an intelligent controller to take when conditional events occur.

Intelligent controllers will feature easily navigated  interfaces that’ll make condition monitoring, event handling, scheduling, and scripting actions easy to set-up.

We know that “software makes hardware happen”!


Condition monitoring, event handling, scheduling, and scripted actions

What good are electronic sensors if YOU need to monitor them?

If you have a Xiobot Intelligent Controller or a Xiobot PC interface or you use our Cloud Service (which operates through an intelligent controller or PC), your Xiobot domain can be automated!

An intelligent controller provides the processing power to monitor all of your sensors (and all of the different types of sensors) in real time and to respond to conditions and events with scripted actions.  Your Xiobot controller can even interact with other automation systems (extending capabilities even further).

Automation implies that your Xiobot controls will operate devices and equipment which they are connected  to — executing actions determined by a scripted set of commands (directed by conditions being monitored, or triggered through events being detected, by Xiobot sensors); and, that you can have warnings and alerts sent to you (or any number of other recipients) by text message or e-mail.  Automation allows your sensor information to be perpetually logged, reported, or analyzed; and, makes it possible for Xiobot controls to be activated by your pre-scripted commands or by an app.

You’ll use a specific sensor for a particular task; and, when a potentially catastrophic or important event occurs, your Xiobot Intelligent Controller — running an appropriate app — can respond to it automatically and immediately.

For instance, if you need to know when a compressor or pump has started or failed, use a Passive AC Sensor to alert an appropriate automation app or to execute a specific command script.

Utilize aggregate information from multiple environment sensors to optimize and control your heating and air conditioning system with the Xiobot thermostat app. The app will perform a parametric evaluation of the temperature conditions monitored by selected sensors — integrating several other factors (such as time of day, day of the year, room size, outdoor temperature trends, room occupancy, etc.) — and determines when to activate your HVAC system and which dampers to open and close.  The result?  You’ll experience more effective heating and cooling — keeping you much more comfortable while reducing your HVAC costs.

Use a Garden Sensor to sense the watering needs of your garden — then, use an 8-output, high-power relay control to operate up to eight zones of sprinklers.  (Simply use multiple Xiobot controls if you have more than eight zones.)  With our highly-integrated software apps, you can predict watering needs based upon outside air temperature trends and the detailed information from your array of Garden Sensors.

Use the structured, user interface in an intelligent controller to create “IF / THEN” actions to respond to the detailed information monitored from your Xiobots.  You’ll even be able to script complex actions containing multi-step conditional events.

Scheduled actions will enable you to control your Xiobots based on clock time — and, include other time-based functions such as delays, randomly timed events, timed offsets from sunrise and sunset, days of the week, month, or calendar, and much more!

The Xiobot system is all about building a coherent system of devices and software applications tailored to effectively automate your home, building, or industrial process.  

We are devoted to automation — and you will be too when you install your Xiobots!


Characteristic features of Wireless Xiobots

It's all about connectivity

Just as there are countless ways to use Xiobots, there are many methods to connect and control your Xiobot domain.

You can use Xiobot sensors or controls by themselves — operating them directly with your Bluetooth 4.0-enabled iOS or Android smartphone through a free, downloadable, device-specific app.  Simply put the battery into a device to power it; then, run the app to configure it — that’s all there is to it!  You’ll be set-up to monitor a sensor or operate a control in minutes!

And by the way... if your older smartphone or tablet doesn’t have Bluetooth 4.0 compatibility, you can still use a Xiobot Intelligent Controller to connect to your Xiobots. [Read onward and see how!]

An optional USB interface enables your Windows® PC to access a Xiobot domain. Your smartphone will still be able to control your Xiobots directly; and as long as your PC is powered and running the Xiobot controller app, it can execute pre-programmed commands and respond to monitored conditions and events. 

With a PC’s capacity to execute scripted actions, you’ll be well on your way to automating your sensors and creating a fully functional control system for your home or facility.  The Xiobot controller app can also provide bi-directional access to Xiobots across the Internet.

For the ultimate integration experience, you’ll be able to access Xiobots from your local area network with either a wireless (Wi-Fi) or cabled (Ethernet) intelligent controller. The intelligent controller will store pre-programmed commands and respond with scripted actions independently of your PC; and, it can act as a bridge that lets your Xiobots operate across the Internet as well. 

If necessary, you’ll be able to overcome any wireless range limitations (inherent in Bluetooth technology) by setting-up multiple intelligent controllers; so, your Xiobot domain can extend as far as your imagination will permit.

Look at these typical configurations to determine which is best for you:

Basic connectivity allows you to interact with your Xiobots with minimal infrastructure. Your smartphone or tablet (with Bluetooth 4.0) can use its native Bluetooth connectivity to link directly to a Xiobot.

IP connectivity (over an Ethernet or Wi-Fi LAN) allows your Xiobots to be accessible through the Internet — either communicating with you via a remote user interface or connected to our basic Cloud Service.  (The cloud service makes it possible for your Xiobots to be addressable through the Internet even if the broadband connection at the location where your Xiobots are physically located is only serviced by a dynamic IP address.)

The intelligent controller will routinely monitor your Xiobots and can respond instantaneously with scripted command responses (based upon conditions and sensor events) as necessary.  Additionally, scripted commands can automate scheduled (based upon time of day, day of week, day of month, calendar date, etc.) and recurring actions of Xiobot controls.

For example, visualize a pool sensor sending water level information to the controller that commands the device which activates the pool’s water fill valve; or, imagine multiple environmental sensors furnishing information to the controls that operate an HVAC system and open or close selected vents and dampers or operate fans to most efficiently and comfortably manage the environment of your home or building.

Alert events and monitored conditions can even trigger an intelligent controller to send you text or e-mail messages; so, you’ll know exactly what you need to know about your Xiobot domain as soon as possible.  And if you have installed an intelligent controller, your PC won’t need to be powered on — because the intelligent controller is a fully-functional, standalone processor!

In a large Xiobot installation, multiple intelligent controllers (with IP connectivity through either Ethernet or  Wi-Fi) can be connected to the same local area network — forming a signal backbone that will effectively expand the range of your Bluetooth link and extend coverage among physically dispersed devices.  The size of your Xiobot installation could be virtually unlimited!

How do the pieces fit together?

The Xiobot system is all about building a coherent system of devices with controller interfaces tailored for ease of installation and use. The following diagram abstracts the relationship between these components and depicts the connections between them: 

What can our Cloud Service do for you?

Our Cloud Service can automatically monitor your sensors and will execute alert scripts according to your specifications (using an intuitive and interactive web page interface to define event conditions to act upon and scripted actions to perform).

You’ll be able to read the status of your Xiobots and send them commands — and, you’ll be able to look at recorded status information to see what data has been received from your sensors and what commands have been executed.

Our Cloud Service will be provided at NO CHARGE for two years to our charter contributors — and will be inexpensively priced thereafter.  [Details pertaining to our Cloud Service and this offer will be available soon after the conclusion of our campaign. This offer is subject to change without prior notice.]

FAQs and additional information about our Development Roadmap

Who are we? 

We are a small team of engineers seeking to launch a product.  Our background encompasses decades of system design and electronics engineering — producing aerospace, scientific, and commercial information technology solutions — and (literally) several lifetimes of extensive and diverse software development experience.

What makes Xiobots a viable solution?

We’re taking a proven architecture from a wired modality to wireless.

Connecting sensors to a controller or data recorder is the proverbial “last 100 feet” problem —that is: how to get devices connected?  Do you spend countless hours stringing cabling through walls, within ceilings, around difficult to reach areas; or, do you rely upon wireless technology to solve that problem for you?  The answer is obvious — and that’s why we’ve engineered Bluetooth connectivity into our Xiobot design.

What are our differentiators?

Features, design, quality of construction, the scope of our solution. We are intent upon bringing you cutting-edge technology and proving that “high-tech” does not need to be high cost.

What are our product development plans?

The Xiobot system is EXTENSIBLE — and we intend to produce new devices as opportunities arise.  We have several devices already designed that we did not enumerate in the offerings of this campaign.

Is automation complex?

We looked at automation as a systemic function and understood that ease of implementation begins with comprehensive product engineering from the outset.  We started with a product concept that was rock solid from the ground up and built low-cost, wired Xiobot device prototypes.  We designed sensors, controls, and controllers with the sort of software and hardware integration that could effectively deliver  an elegant solution. Then, we added wireless Bluetooth connectivity to our design to simplify installation..  

Xiobots can take time-consuming and distracting tasks and reliably automate them — resulting in greater convenience, accuracy, and safety for you.

Are there any risks or challenges?

None.  We are using a circuit design [from the Bluetooth chip manufacturer] that has previously passed F.C.C. compliance testing and is already approved for our product.

We are members of the Bluetooth Special Interest Group (SIG) and have developed our products in compliance with their standards, guidelines, and best practices.

How will we use the funds derived from this campaign?

There is equipment to purchase, fabrication processes to contract, and tooling required to take our design into production; and, we’ll need additional development resources to accomplish remaining engineering tasks.  Naturally, components, sub-assemblies, fixtures, and other elements of the manufacturing process will be needed as well.

We will create jobs... specifically: manufacturing engineers, production personnel, customer service people, and marketing and sales specialists.  [NB: We are not promoting a bloated and over-stated campaign!  We strongly believe in the viability and potential commercial success of the Xiobot product and feel that once this product is launched, we will have considerable momentum to carry it to the next level.]

What are the major steps remaining to get into production?

We will finalize our product engineering and concentrate on manufacturing processes. 

We will set-up the production equipment, get people trained to use it, and begin the process of tooling-up for each of the product assembly and fulfillment steps.

We will complete develop the user interface of our prototype software — creating the polished apps that you will use.  

We will design,  implement, and qualify our proposed Cloud Service.  

We will test (and test and test again) our products to guarantee that they will meet the highest standards of performance and quality.

We are confident that we can accomplish these tasks within two to three months from the conclusion of a successful campaign.

What is our business plan?

We will sell Xiobot devices directly through a web portal.  We’ll make plans for more extensive distribution — including opportunities for third-party installers and servicers.

We intend to energetically promote the Xiobot product to insure its broad adoption.

Will Xiobots be available through resellers and distributors?

Yes.  If you are a reseller or distributor and Xiobots are of interest to you, please contact us.

What other incentives are there for contributing to this campaign?

Aside from the tangible satisfaction that you’ll receive in the knowledge that you will directly help create jobs and bring economic opportunity to others; you will also receive attractive, reliable, practical, cutting-edge technology at an attractive introductory price.

In addition, you will receive a 10% discount for all future purchases of Xiobot products.

What if your smartphone, tablet, or PC isn’t Bluetooth 4.0-enabled?

Not a problem!  If you have a Xiobot Intelligent Controller, it will allow any user device with a web browser to access your Xiobot domain through your device’s wireless or Ethernet connectivity.  

How big will these devices be?

The designs of plastic cases for each of the Xiobot devices haven’t been finalized; but, we can definitely tell you that they’ll be small — for example, about 1/2” by 3/8” by 2” (about the size of a lipstick case) for the environment sensor and similarly small for most of the other sensors.

Are batteries included?

Yes... and, Xiobots will incorporate circuitry that will maximize battery longevity.  We expect batteries to perform well under normal conditions and have based our estimates accordingly.  Still, we’ll want to know exactly how well; so for each device purchased, you’ll receive the first replacement battery(ies) absolutely free (including shipping and handling) when you fill-out a short, on-line, product performance survey.

What about wireless performance?

Xiobots use low-energy Bluetooth technology and are subject to the constraints and physics of radio frequency (RF) communication.  We believe that performance for distance should reach roughly 100 feet (30 meters).  Unless you are locating devices behind extremely dense materials (concrete, steel, trees, waterfalls, etc.) or have an exceptionally ‘noisy’ RF environment, wireless performance should be good.  (Note: We designed the intelligent controller system to accommodate the possible need for RF ‘repeaters’ throughout a Xiobot domain as a solution for limited or marginal RF performance situations).

Where will Xiobot apps be available?  

Apps will be freely downloadable depending upon the specific target device.  For iOS smartphones and tablets, apps will be downloadable through the Apple App Store; for Android devices, use the Google Play Store; and for PCs and Xiobot Intelligent Controllers, apps will be downloadable directly from our website.

How are Xiobot devices constructed?  

Xiobots are highly miniaturized electronic devices housed in durable ABS plastic cases.  They’ll incorporated state-of-the-art electronics manufactured to the highest quality assurance standards.

Are they waterproof?  

In general, they are not intended to be waterproof; but specifically, the pool sensor, garden sensor, and leak detector sensors are.  [Note: Wireless connectivity won’t operate if they are fully submerged.]

How are they installed?

Xiobots will be enclosed in an assortment of case formats.  Input and output controls will have one or more rows of screw terminals (appropriate for wiring external circuits); environment sensors will be housed in tiny lipstick-sized cases with a small grill-like baffle; and so on.  Each case will be a to-the-point, minimalist design adhering to the adage: “form follows function”.  

We’ll provide several mounting alternatives for both ease and reliability of installation. Aesthetics are as important a consideration as functionality.

How many Xiobot devices can the system handle?

As a design goal, we’re aiming for an unlimited number of devices within the Xiobot domain.  In practical implementation, 128 devices might be the maximum number when wireless connections are made directly between a Xiobot and a smartphone or tablet (and this is a limitation of the smartphone or tablet software architecture).  The number of connections between Xiobots and intelligent controllers will be significantly greater; AND, you can put numerous intelligent controllers in a network (allowing virtually unlimited numbers of Xiobot devices within the domain).

How many user devices (smartphones, tablets, or PCs) can access a Xiobot domain simultaneously?

If you have a Xiobot Intelligent Controller, any number of user devices can access your Xiobot domain simultaneously!

That’s right.  Any number of user access devices — of any mix — can simultaneously access and control the Xiobot devices in your Xiobot domain.  You can even overlap multiple Xiobot domains and assign different access privileges to each user.  And, one Cloud Service account can make multiple Xiobot domains accessible through a single remote sign-on.

What about power failures?

Xiobot sensors operate on batteries independently of utility power.  Xiobot Intelligent Controllers (and your network equipment) can operate on a small uninterruptible power supply (i.e., battery back-up).  The Xiobot AC Power Sensor will alert you if a power failure occurs or if your utility-provided line voltage is too low or too high..

Can a PC with a USB Interface operate like an intelligent controller?

Yes.  Of course, the PC must remain powered-up (just like an intelligent controller would need to be).  

A PC can also operate as a bridge to the Cloud Service; and if your PC is connected to the Internet with a static IP address and can support web services (i.e., act as a web server), you can, in essence, host cloud services from that PC.  This is practical and useful for large-scale or industrial implementation of Xiobots.

What about security?

Wireless connectivity to Xiobot devices will always be bi-directionally encrypted (by an AES encryption algorithm).  The Xiobot domain will NOT be vulnerable to trespass by external devices.*  The intelligent controllers and our proposed Cloud Service will also be protected by encryption and by device-level,    log-in security.  [AES is the ‘Advanced Encryption Standard’ used by the U.S. government and worldwide.]

* Your local area network (LAN) should be secured following appropriate best practices.

Will there be technical support for Xiobots?

Absolutely!  We envision providing a diversity of customer-centric support.  (After all, what good is any technology if you can’t use it?)  This will include on-line and dial-up support resources.

Technical support will be based here in the United States.  (English, yes;  Español, sí; Peut-être français.)

Will there be an on-line Knowledge Base?

Yes.  It would behoove us to make as much information as possible available to users.  We’ll show implementation notes and provide detailed set-up and operating information.  We’d like to showcase user experiences and examples as well.

Will a Software Development Kit (SDK) be available for users to write commands directly to Xiobot devices?

We are currently thinking along those lines.  Especially with the idea of providing programming ‘hooks’ allowing VBA (Microsoft’s ‘Visual Basic for Applications’) code through MS Office™ or embedded macros in EXCEL® to easily communicate with Xiobots.  (MAC and LINUX users... please be patient.)

Will Xiobots be covered by a warranty?  

Certainly!  All devices will be factory tested before packaging them for fulfillment.  We will warrant them for a full year.

Are we serious about compatibility with other systems?

Yes.  For similar Bluetooth 4.0-enabled devices, we’ll have software solutions for compatibility; for other hardware, we might develop system-specific interfaces.

Will there be a ‘suggestion box’ and any incentive for submitting product development ideas?

Okay... submit a significantly useful suggestion (which hasn’t already been submitted), and we’ll send you a $25 gift certificate towards the purchase of any Xiobot products.

Can we get more information about the diversity of apps that are going to be available?

Some of the first apps to be made available will be noteworthy priorities that any home or building automation system should have — such as: the thermostat app and an alarm system interface app.  There will be apps for the pool, garden and leak detection sensors, an app for monitoring an aquarium, and even an app to remotely operate your garage door opener.

We will strive to make most apps entirely free to download and use — with updates and improvements as they become available.  We will produce premium apps and charge nominal prices for them.

Will we manufacture wired Xiobot devices?

Yes, we believe that there is a niche for them.  For some sensors, they’ll be much less expensive and just as adaptable to their intended application as wireless sensors would be.

Where will Xiobots be manufactured?

Xiobots will be proudly manufactured here in the United States — and we’ll always do everything we can to promote that — as both a corporate responsibility and as members of our community.

Will manufacturing, the product itself, and its packaging be eco-friendly?

Completely.  Manufacturing of all circuitry will be RoHS (Restriction of Hazardous Substances) compliant.  

As a manufacturer, we will support environment responsibility in every aspect of the product life-cycle.

Our intended packaging will be eco-friendly as well.

Are there other Xiobot devices that are not listed as perks?

Yes. We'll post additional information about all of our Xiobots on our website as soon as possible...  http://www.xiobot.com

Can you share any more information?

Our product designs represent a significant investment in effort and are valuable intellectual property. We need to carefully protect that; however, as additional information develops, we’ll share what we can. 

For questions concerning this campaign, please e-mail us at:  Campaign@xiobot.com

For technical questions related to Xiobots, please e-mail us at:  Info@xiobot.com

Please visit our website as our campaign progresses — we'll post additional information there as soon and as often as possible...  http://www.xiobot.com


Please note that some specifications and product features may be modified as our designs are prepared for manufacturing.  Devices pictured are prototypes — production designs may differ.


A note about shipping:  Rates for shipping represent the best method possible for shipping by ground service in the United States and Canada.  Rates for international shipping will be quoted to international contributors when our campaign has concluded.


Thank you for considering our campaign!
story_txt:
What can Xiobots do for you?



There are Xiobot devices to monitor and control
everything in your home or business. 
You could place an environmental sensor anywhere and
you’d instantly be able to monitor the climate in your surroundings. Put a
garden sensor between your flowers and it’ll tell you about the air temperature
in your yard and the moisture content of your soil. Attach a Xiobot control to
your sprinkler system and manage your landscaping better by precisely
regulating your watering.  Connect all of
your Xiobot devices with a Xiobot Intelligent Controller and you’ll be able to
securely monitor and control everything from anywhere across the Internet!

What are Xiobots?


Xiobots are
tiny, durable, wireless devices — each with its own embedded microprocessor and
integrated Bluetooth transceiver — which can operate on a network or the
Internet through a Xiobot Intelligent Controller; or, directly with your
Bluetooth 4.0-enabled smartphone, tablet, or PC.

What can Xiobots do?
Measure and control your environment — manage and automate your world.
Are Xiobots expensive?
No. Xiobots will use cutting-edge technologies, components, and manufacturing
methodologies whose costs have been reduced by large-scale production. They
will be a bargain!
How do Xiobots interact with you?
Xiobot sensors can immediately update Bluetooth 4.0-enabled smartphones,
tablets, and PCs (that are within range) with status information; or, operate
and send text and e-mail messages to you through a network or the Internet
using a Xiobot Intelligent Controller.
How "tiny" are Xiobots?
The smallest wireless sensors will be about the size of a lipstick case. 
What does wireless connectivity do?
Connecting sensors and devices to a centralized control system is the
proverbial "last 100 feet" problem. And that is: how to get all
elements connected at minimal cost in terms of time and material. Wireless
technology makes a distributed control system truly "plug ’n play".
What if you are unsure about
Bluetooth 4.0 compatibility? Not a problem... if your
smartphone, tablet, or PC doesn’t have Bluetooth 4.0 compatibility, the Xiobot
system includes intelligent controllers that allow any device with a web
browser to interact with Xiobots. 
What does a "Xiobot Intelligent
Controller" do? A controller offers seamless access
to your Xiobots locally (on your Local Area Network) and across the Internet —
providing you with real-time information from your Xiobot devices and giving
you remote connectivity to your Xiobot controls.  Xiobot Intelligent Controllers include a micro-processor
that automatically performs scheduled and programmable functions and executes useful apps.
Control everything with a Xiobot!

What Xiobot devices
will be available?





Xiobots can perform simple functions
like reading temperature, barometric pressure, and humidity — and complex
operations such as connecting to ‘real world’ systems and equipment. They can:
switch low-power electrical signals (controlling heating and air conditioning
systems); switch 110-220 VAC loads (high-power, household electrical lines);
interface with your existing security system or sprinkler controls; or,
replicate IR remote controls when used with our Entertainment System app (which
will give you control of your television and entertainment equipment like
you’ve never had before). And, they can connect to and interact with other home
and building automation systems.


Xiobots are easy to set-up and use;
will typically operate for over a year with a single set of batteries; and,
come with free software applications for your smartphone (iPhone or Android),
tablet, or PC. An intelligent controller allows you to access your Xiobots
across your local network or remotely through the Internet. The intelligent
controller is a microcomputer that stores apps and information; allows your
Xiobots to respond to scripted and scheduled (timer-initiated) commands; and,
to act upon monitored conditions or events (such as detected temperature
changes or a status change in a sensor or detected signal). A cloud service
will be available to extend the capabilities of Xiobots even further.
The Xiobot system is
extensible... we are committed to a product architecture that will evolve to
fulfill future opportunities for both innovative hardware and software.  The devices listed above are just some of the
Xiobot products on our drawing board.

Xiobots
are here to serve you!







Where would you use Xiobots?



Xiobot devices are designed to be versatile and provide reliable installation in diverse settings — whether they’re used in home and building automation or for industrial control.
A typical home can use several Xiobot devices.  The sample floor plan (below) illustrates how wireless Xiobots might be set up to:


manage an HVAC (Heating - Ventilating - Air Conditioning) system using several environment sensors, a contact closure control, and the thermostat app running in an intelligent controller; 


detect alert conditions with signal sensors connected to an alarm panel and smoke detectors, water leak sensors placed under appliances in the utility room, under water heaters, and in the kitchen or basement; and,




control sprinklers and pool or spa water level with relay controls and scripted commands operating in an intelligent controller.


                                                                            



What else can you do with Xiobots?




Accurately monitor the environment (temperature and humidity) of your children’s rooms


Locate temperature sensors in your refrigerator, freezer, attic, basement, storerooms, anywhere


Monitor your wine cellar, humidor, collectibles, art collection, anything


Monitor and control everything inside of a vacation home, rental property, or office


Monitor and activate sump pumps, attic ventilators, or any other essential equipment


Monitor your pool, spa, or Koi pond temperatures — even aquariums — automatically filling water as needed, and predicting dangerously low temperatures or excessively rapid evaporation


Monitor the proximity of your dog or cat


Monitor the operation of equipment throughout your home, building, or industrial facility


Interface with (and control) an entertainment system — allowing you to programmatically ‘channel surf’, perform complex and hard-to-remember sequences of commands, or automatically switch channels and turn your TV on or off throughout the week


Interface with an alarm system to extend, enhance, and personalize its functionality


Predict potential frost or arid conditions in your garden


Be alerted when utility power fails in unoccupied facilities (or at home while you’re asleep)


Be alerted when doors or gates are opened


Use the intelligent controller to automatically respond to monitored conditions or random events


Use the intelligent controller to execute date and time-scheduled or scripted actions




The possibilities are endless!
Xiobots = Great Hardware + Great Software

We understand that you’ll demand hardware that can be installed with apps that can be configured without opening an installation manual.  We know that you’ll want apps that’ll get you the information you need as quickly as possible and give you the control you expect.
We’ll deliver.  We are committed to producing sophisticated devices whose functionality, reliability, and performance are an outstanding value; and, to creating the most efficient and easy-to-use apps possible.  Every app will be intuitively obvious to use and updated automatically as it is improved.  Every device will evolve and exciting new designs will   be forthcoming.  We are devoted to automation technology — it’s who we are!
Take the Environment Sensor device for example.  It operates with an app that lets you scroll through all similar devices within your Xiobot domain.  Once you select the specific sensor that you want to monitor, the app displays the pertinent information with the presentation settings you’ve previously selected.  You’ll see a calibrated temperature reading, relative humidity, and barometric pressure. You’ll see graphical trends showing highs and lows for each parameter over a specified timespan.  On another page, you’ll be able to select high and low warning and alert settings and the optional actions that you want an intelligent controller to take when conditional events occur.
Intelligent controllers will feature easily navigated  interfaces that’ll make condition monitoring, event handling, scheduling, and scripting actions easy to set-up.
We know that “software makes hardware happen”!



Condition monitoring, event handling, scheduling, and scripted actions


What good are electronic sensors if YOU need to monitor them?

If you have a Xiobot Intelligent Controller or a Xiobot PC interface or you use our Cloud Service (which operates through an intelligent controller or PC), your Xiobot domain can be automated!



An intelligent controller provides the processing power to monitor all of your sensors (and all of the different types of sensors) in real time and to respond to conditions and events with scripted actions.  Your Xiobot controller can even interact with other automation systems (extending capabilities even further).


Automation implies that your Xiobot controls will operate devices and equipment which they are connected  to — executing actions determined by a scripted set of commands (directed by conditions being monitored, or triggered through events being detected, by Xiobot sensors); and, that you can have warnings and alerts sent to you (or any number of other recipients) by text message or e-mail.  Automation allows your sensor information to be perpetually logged, reported, or analyzed; and, makes it possible for Xiobot controls to be activated by your pre-scripted commands or by an app.
You’ll use a specific sensor for a particular task; and, when a potentially catastrophic or important event occurs, your Xiobot Intelligent Controller — running an appropriate app — can respond to it automatically and immediately.
For instance, if you need to know when a compressor or pump has started or failed, use a Passive AC Sensor to alert an appropriate automation app or to execute a specific command script.
Utilize aggregate information from multiple environment sensors to optimize and control your heating and air conditioning system with the Xiobot thermostat app. The app will perform a parametric evaluation of the temperature conditions monitored by selected sensors — integrating several other factors (such as time of day, day of the year, room size, outdoor temperature trends, room occupancy, etc.) — and determines when to activate your HVAC system and which dampers to open and close.  The result?  You’ll experience more effective heating and cooling — keeping you much more comfortable while reducing your HVAC costs.
Use a Garden Sensor to sense the watering needs of your garden — then, use an 8-output, high-power relay control to operate up to eight zones of sprinklers.  (Simply use multiple Xiobot controls if you have more than eight zones.)  With our highly-integrated software apps, you can predict watering needs based upon outside air temperature trends and the detailed information from your array of Garden Sensors.
Use the structured, user interface in an intelligent controller to create “IF / THEN” actions to respond to the detailed information monitored from your Xiobots.  You’ll even be able to script complex actions containing multi-step conditional events.
Scheduled actions will enable you to control your Xiobots based on clock time — and, include other time-based functions such as delays, randomly timed events, timed offsets from sunrise and sunset, days of the week, month, or calendar, and much more!
The Xiobot system is all about building a coherent system of devices and software applications tailored to effectively automate your home, building, or industrial process.  


We are devoted to automation — and you will be too when you install your Xiobots!


Characteristic features of Wireless Xiobots

It's all about connectivity
Just as there are countless ways to use Xiobots, there are many methods to connect and control your Xiobot domain.
You can use Xiobot sensors or controls by themselves — operating them directly with your Bluetooth 4.0-enabled iOS or Android smartphone through a free, downloadable, device-specific app.  Simply put the battery into a device to power it; then, run the app to configure it — that’s all there is to it!  You’ll be set-up to monitor a sensor or operate a control in minutes!
And by the way... if your older smartphone or tablet doesn’t have Bluetooth 4.0 compatibility, you can still use a Xiobot Intelligent Controller to connect to your Xiobots. [Read onward and see how!]
An optional USB interface enables your Windows® PC to access a Xiobot domain. Your smartphone will still be able to control your Xiobots directly; and as long as your PC is powered and running the Xiobot controller app, it can execute pre-programmed commands and respond to monitored conditions and events. 
With a PC’s capacity to execute scripted actions, you’ll be well on your way to automating your sensors and creating a fully functional control system for your home or facility.  The Xiobot controller app can also provide bi-directional access to Xiobots across the Internet.
For the ultimate integration experience, you’ll be able to access Xiobots from your local area network with either a wireless (Wi-Fi) or cabled (Ethernet) intelligent controller. The intelligent controller will store pre-programmed commands and respond with scripted actions independently of your PC; and, it can act as a bridge that lets your Xiobots operate across the Internet as well. 
If necessary, you’ll be able to overcome any wireless range limitations (inherent in Bluetooth technology) by setting-up multiple intelligent controllers; so, your Xiobot domain can extend as far as your imagination will permit.
Look at these typical configurations to determine which is best for you:


Basic connectivity allows you to interact with your Xiobots with minimal infrastructure. Your smartphone or tablet (with Bluetooth 4.0) can use its native Bluetooth connectivity to link directly to a Xiobot.


IP connectivity (over an Ethernet or Wi-Fi LAN) allows your Xiobots to be accessible through the Internet — either communicating with you via a remote user interface or connected to our basic Cloud Service.  (The cloud service makes it possible for your Xiobots to be addressable through the Internet even if the broadband connection at the location where your Xiobots are physically located is only serviced by a dynamic IP address.)
The intelligent controller will routinely monitor your Xiobots and can respond instantaneously with scripted command responses (based upon conditions and sensor events) as necessary.  Additionally, scripted commands can automate scheduled (based upon time of day, day of week, day of month, calendar date, etc.) and recurring actions of Xiobot controls.
For example, visualize a pool sensor sending water level information to the controller that commands the device which activates the pool’s water fill valve; or, imagine multiple environmental sensors furnishing information to the controls that operate an HVAC system and open or close selected vents and dampers or operate fans to most efficiently and comfortably manage the environment of your home or building.
Alert events and monitored conditions can even trigger an intelligent controller to send you text or e-mail messages; so, you’ll know exactly what you need to know about your Xiobot domain as soon as possible.  And if you have installed an intelligent controller, your PC won’t need to be powered on — because the intelligent controller is a fully-functional, standalone processor!

In a large Xiobot installation, multiple intelligent controllers (with IP connectivity through either Ethernet or  Wi-Fi) can be connected to the same local area network — forming a signal backbone that will effectively expand the range of your Bluetooth link and extend coverage among physically dispersed devices.  The size of your Xiobot installation could be virtually unlimited!
How do the pieces fit together?
The Xiobot system is all about building a coherent system of devices with controller interfaces tailored for ease of installation and use. The following diagram abstracts the relationship between these components and depicts the connections between them: 



What can our Cloud Service do for you?

Our Cloud Service can automatically monitor your sensors and will execute alert scripts according to your specifications (using an intuitive and interactive web page interface to define event conditions to act upon and scripted actions to perform).
You’ll be able to read the status of your Xiobots and send them commands — and, you’ll be able to look at recorded status information to see what data has been received from your sensors and what commands have been executed.
Our Cloud Service will be provided at NO CHARGE for two years to our charter contributors — and will be inexpensively priced thereafter.  [Details pertaining to our Cloud Service and this offer will be available soon after the conclusion of our campaign. This offer is subject to change without prior notice.]
FAQs and additional information about our Development Roadmap
Who are we? 
We are a small team of engineers seeking to launch a product.  Our background encompasses decades of system design and electronics engineering — producing aerospace, scientific, and commercial information technology solutions — and (literally) several lifetimes of extensive and diverse software development experience.
What makes Xiobots a viable solution?
We’re taking a proven architecture from a wired modality to wireless.
Connecting sensors to a controller or data recorder is the proverbial “last 100 feet” problem —that is: how to get devices connected?  Do you spend countless hours stringing cabling through walls, within ceilings, around difficult to reach areas; or, do you rely upon wireless technology to solve that problem for you?  The answer is obvious — and that’s why we’ve engineered Bluetooth connectivity into our Xiobot design.
What are our differentiators?
Features, design, quality of construction, the scope of our solution. We are intent upon bringing you cutting-edge technology and proving that “high-tech” does not need to be high cost.
What are our product development plans?
The Xiobot system is EXTENSIBLE — and we intend to produce new devices as opportunities arise.  We have several devices already designed that we did not enumerate in the offerings of this campaign.
Is automation complex?
We looked at automation as a systemic function and understood that ease of implementation begins with comprehensive product engineering from the outset.  We started with a product concept that was rock solid from the ground up and built low-cost, wired Xiobot device prototypes.  We designed sensors, controls, and controllers with the sort of software and hardware integration that could effectively deliver  an elegant solution. Then, we added wireless Bluetooth connectivity to our design to simplify installation..  
Xiobots can take time-consuming and distracting tasks and reliably automate them — resulting in greater convenience, accuracy, and safety for you.
Are there any risks or challenges?
None.  We are using a circuit design [from the Bluetooth chip manufacturer] that has previously passed F.C.C. compliance testing and is already approved for our product.
We are members of the Bluetooth Special Interest Group (SIG) and have developed our products in compliance with their standards, guidelines, and best practices.
How will we use the funds derived from this campaign?
There is equipment to purchase, fabrication processes to contract, and tooling required to take our design into production; and, we’ll need additional development resources to accomplish remaining engineering tasks.  Naturally, components, sub-assemblies, fixtures, and other elements of the manufacturing process will be needed as well.
We will create jobs... specifically: manufacturing engineers, production personnel, customer service people, and marketing and sales specialists.  [NB: We are not promoting a bloated and over-stated campaign!  We strongly believe in the viability and potential commercial success of the Xiobot product and feel that once this product is launched, we will have considerable momentum to carry it to the next level.]
What are the major steps remaining to get into production?
We will finalize our product engineering and concentrate on manufacturing processes. 
We will set-up the production equipment, get people trained to use it, and begin the process of tooling-up for each of the product assembly and fulfillment steps.
We will complete develop the user interface of our prototype software — creating the polished apps that you will use.  
We will design,  implement, and qualify our proposed Cloud Service.  
We will test (and test and test again) our products to guarantee that they will meet the highest standards of performance and quality.
We are confident that we can accomplish these tasks within two to three months from the conclusion of a successful campaign.
What is our business plan?
We will sell Xiobot devices directly through a web portal.  We’ll make plans for more extensive distribution — including opportunities for third-party installers and servicers.
We intend to energetically promote the Xiobot product to insure its broad adoption.
Will Xiobots be available through resellers and distributors?
Yes.  If you are a reseller or distributor and Xiobots are of interest to you, please contact us.
What other incentives are there for contributing to this campaign?
Aside from the tangible satisfaction that you’ll receive in the knowledge that you will directly help create jobs and bring economic opportunity to others; you will also receive attractive, reliable, practical, cutting-edge technology at an attractive introductory price.
In addition, you will receive a 10% discount for all future purchases of Xiobot products.
What if your smartphone, tablet, or PC isn’t Bluetooth 4.0-enabled?
Not a problem!  If you have a Xiobot Intelligent Controller, it will allow any user device with a web browser to access your Xiobot domain through your device’s wireless or Ethernet connectivity.  
How big will these devices be?
The designs of plastic cases for each of the Xiobot devices haven’t been finalized; but, we can definitely tell you that they’ll be small — for example, about 1/2” by 3/8” by 2” (about the size of a lipstick case) for the environment sensor and similarly small for most of the other sensors.
Are batteries included?
Yes... and, Xiobots will incorporate circuitry that will maximize battery longevity.  We expect batteries to perform well under normal conditions and have based our estimates accordingly.  Still, we’ll want to know exactly how well; so for each device purchased, you’ll receive the first replacement battery(ies) absolutely free (including shipping and handling) when you fill-out a short, on-line, product performance survey.
What about wireless performance?
Xiobots use low-energy Bluetooth technology and are subject to the constraints and physics of radio frequency (RF) communication.  We believe that performance for distance should reach roughly 100 feet (30 meters).  Unless you are locating devices behind extremely dense materials (concrete, steel, trees, waterfalls, etc.) or have an exceptionally ‘noisy’ RF environment, wireless performance should be good.  (Note: We designed the intelligent controller system to accommodate the possible need for RF ‘repeaters’ throughout a Xiobot domain as a solution for limited or marginal RF performance situations).
Where will Xiobot apps be available?  
Apps will be freely downloadable depending upon the specific target device.  For iOS smartphones and tablets, apps will be downloadable through the Apple App Store; for Android devices, use the Google Play Store; and for PCs and Xiobot Intelligent Controllers, apps will be downloadable directly from our website.
How are Xiobot devices constructed?  
Xiobots are highly miniaturized electronic devices housed in durable ABS plastic cases.  They’ll incorporated state-of-the-art electronics manufactured to the highest quality assurance standards.
Are they waterproof?  
In general, they are not intended to be waterproof; but specifically, the pool sensor, garden sensor, and leak detector sensors are.  [Note: Wireless connectivity won’t operate if they are fully submerged.]
How are they installed?
Xiobots will be enclosed in an assortment of case formats.  Input and output controls will have one or more rows of screw terminals (appropriate for wiring external circuits); environment sensors will be housed in tiny lipstick-sized cases with a small grill-like baffle; and so on.  Each case will be a to-the-point, minimalist design adhering to the adage: “form follows function”.  
We’ll provide several mounting alternatives for both ease and reliability of installation. Aesthetics are as important a consideration as functionality.
How many Xiobot devices can the system handle?
As a design goal, we’re aiming for an unlimited number of devices within the Xiobot domain.  In practical implementation, 128 devices might be the maximum number when wireless connections are made directly between a Xiobot and a smartphone or tablet (and this is a limitation of the smartphone or tablet software architecture).  The number of connections between Xiobots and intelligent controllers will be significantly greater; AND, you can put numerous intelligent controllers in a network (allowing virtually unlimited numbers of Xiobot devices within the domain).
How many user devices (smartphones, tablets, or PCs) can access a Xiobot domain simultaneously?
If you have a Xiobot Intelligent Controller, any number of user devices can access your Xiobot domain simultaneously!
That’s right.  Any number of user access devices — of any mix — can simultaneously access and control the Xiobot devices in your Xiobot domain.  You can even overlap multiple Xiobot domains and assign different access privileges to each user.  And, one Cloud Service account can make multiple Xiobot domains accessible through a single remote sign-on.
What about power failures?
Xiobot sensors operate on batteries independently of utility power.  Xiobot Intelligent Controllers (and your network equipment) can operate on a small uninterruptible power supply (i.e., battery back-up).  The Xiobot AC Power Sensor will alert you if a power failure occurs or if your utility-provided line voltage is too low or too high..
Can a PC with a USB Interface operate like an intelligent controller?
Yes.  Of course, the PC must remain powered-up (just like an intelligent controller would need to be).  
A PC can also operate as a bridge to the Cloud Service; and if your PC is connected to the Internet with a static IP address and can support web services (i.e., act as a web server), you can, in essence, host cloud services from that PC.  This is practical and useful for large-scale or industrial implementation of Xiobots.
What about security?
Wireless connectivity to Xiobot devices will always be bi-directionally encrypted (by an AES encryption algorithm).  The Xiobot domain will NOT be vulnerable to trespass by external devices.*  The intelligent controllers and our proposed Cloud Service will also be protected by encryption and by device-level,    log-in security.  [AES is the ‘Advanced Encryption Standard’ used by the U.S. government and worldwide.]
* Your local area network (LAN) should be secured following appropriate best practices.
Will there be technical support for Xiobots?
Absolutely!  We envision providing a diversity of customer-centric support.  (After all, what good is any technology if you can’t use it?)  This will include on-line and dial-up support resources.
Technical support will be based here in the United States.  (English, yes;  Español, sí; Peut-être français.)
Will there be an on-line Knowledge Base?
Yes.  It would behoove us to make as much information as possible available to users.  We’ll show implementation notes and provide detailed set-up and operating information.  We’d like to showcase user experiences and examples as well.
Will a Software Development Kit (SDK) be available for users to write commands directly to Xiobot devices?
We are currently thinking along those lines.  Especially with the idea of providing programming ‘hooks’ allowing VBA (Microsoft’s ‘Visual Basic for Applications’) code through MS Office™ or embedded macros in EXCEL® to easily communicate with Xiobots.  (MAC and LINUX users... please be patient.)
Will Xiobots be covered by a warranty?  
Certainly!  All devices will be factory tested before packaging them for fulfillment.  We will warrant them for a full year.
Are we serious about compatibility with other systems?
Yes.  For similar Bluetooth 4.0-enabled devices, we’ll have software solutions for compatibility; for other hardware, we might develop system-specific interfaces.
Will there be a ‘suggestion box’ and any incentive for submitting product development ideas?
Okay... submit a significantly useful suggestion (which hasn’t already been submitted), and we’ll send you a $25 gift certificate towards the purchase of any Xiobot products.
Can we get more information about the diversity of apps that are going to be available?
Some of the first apps to be made available will be noteworthy priorities that any home or building automation system should have — such as: the thermostat app and an alarm system interface app.  There will be apps for the pool, garden and leak detection sensors, an app for monitoring an aquarium, and even an app to remotely operate your garage door opener.
We will strive to make most apps entirely free to download and use — with updates and improvements as they become available.  We will produce premium apps and charge nominal prices for them.
Will we manufacture wired Xiobot devices?
Yes, we believe that there is a niche for them.  For some sensors, they’ll be much less expensive and just as adaptable to their intended application as wireless sensors would be.
Where will Xiobots be manufactured?
Xiobots will be proudly manufactured here in the United States — and we’ll always do everything we can to promote that — as both a corporate responsibility and as members of our community.
Will manufacturing, the product itself, and its packaging be eco-friendly?
Completely.  Manufacturing of all circuitry will be RoHS (Restriction of Hazardous Substances) compliant.  
As a manufacturer, we will support environment responsibility in every aspect of the product life-cycle.
Our intended packaging will be eco-friendly as well.

Are there other Xiobot devices that are not listed as perks?
Yes. We'll post additional information about all of our Xiobots on our website as soon as possible...  http://www.xiobot.com

Can you share any more information?
Our product designs represent a significant investment in effort and are valuable intellectual property. We need to carefully protect that; however, as additional information develops, we’ll share what we can. 
For questions concerning this campaign, please e-mail us at:  Campaign@xiobot.com
For technical questions related to Xiobots, please e-mail us at:  Info@xiobot.com
Please visit our website as our campaign progresses — we'll post additional information there as soon and as often as possible...  http://www.xiobot.com

Please note that some specifications and product features may be modified as our designs are prepared for manufacturing.  Devices pictured are prototypes — production designs may differ.

A note about shipping:  Rates for shipping represent the best method possible for shipping by ground service in the United States and Canada.  Rates for international shipping will be quoted to international contributors when our campaign has concluded.

Thank you for considering our campaign!

story:
“We are each of us angels with only one wing, and we can only fly by embracing one another. ” -- Luciano De Crescenzo  

As a modern interpretation of the love story, we are here introducing you “Journey of Love” Key Chain Set. This key chain set is designed as a perfect gift to your loved one. One for you, and one for your loved one. When the two key chains meet each other and make a complete heart, “I Love You” is what it says and what you mean.

The concept of this set of key chains is to create more interaction between you and your loved one, adding more fun and love expression. If you are too shy to say “I Love You”, the key chain will say it for you. If you want to say “I Love You” in a more humorous and surprising way, the key chain will do the job for you. It is more than a key chain or a simple decoration, it means “Love” and it SPEAKS.

The connector also allows you to remove the half heart from the key ring. It provides more flexibility so you can wear it as a pendant or even attach to you phone, bag and anywhere you want.

 The surface of the key chain set is protected by chromium plating which prevents the key chain from accidental scratches and keeps it shiny all the time.

Product Specifications:

  • Key Ring Diameter: 3.1cm  
  • Half Heart Dimension: 2.9cm*1.6cm  
  • “LOVE” Word Dimension: 2.0cm*0.5cm

Perks:

Risks and challenges:

We feel that the risks associated with this project are very minimal and fairly low. We've already gone through the build process with our current prototype. The main challenge we see would be we receive more orders than anticipated which may delay the final delivery. Just in case, we have allotted extra time in the project timeline to allow for this. 

If any other challenges come up, we promise to be transparent and communicate with our backers immediately. We will try our best to complete this project.
